Reviews.Content: very satisfied and pleased with the service Dianne Cheeek was awesome, excellent service.!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL ON CENTURY BLVD!!!”
Reviews.Author: chicagobeenz
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Los Angeles just for the weekend and the service was impeccable! From the moment I pulled up in valet, Javier and his valet attendants greeted me with a smile and had one of the bellmen's, Giovanni assist me with my luggage. Giovanni was very knowledgeable and personable and me feel right at home. The front desk staff, Yessenia, Mustafa, Stephen, Elizabeth, Paul & Whitney were all very helpful throughout my stay. Manny at the Concierge desk was very pleasant to work with....he recommended a very good Indian restaurant in Marina Del Rey. The Sheraton Gateway will always be my choice of hotel whenever I travel to LA. Thank you for providing such great service and attending to my needs! I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “When you go to this hotel ask for Diane Cheek, she is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: almondj0y
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton hotel is beautiful trendy and clean. What really set them apart from other hotels was the service you receive from the moment you pull up. Everyone is great, but I must say Diane Cheek sets the bar high! Diane is professional, always happy and goes above and beyond to make your stay at the Sheraton top notch. She is timely, she thinks outside the box and follows up and follows through to ensure all your needs are met when you ask questions or need assistance. Diane Cheek really wowed me and EXCEEDED my expectations. She's a keeper and deserves raise! I truly mean this from the bottom of my heart. ~ Mr. & Mrs. Kebe :0) We stayed here for 6 days over 4th o July

Reviews.Title: “The location is great, the service:world class.”
Reviews.Author: dave29222
Reviews.Content: I frequently use airport hotels at LAX to break up long trips on my return to Hawaii and have found this hotel to be very convienent, clean and roomy. Staying 10-12 nights a year for one night at a time I consider myself knowledgeable and experienced at LAX. On my recent trip, I needed to use the internet and although Sheraton has great free WiFi in their lobbies it was late and I needed to get internet access in my room. I called guest services and Diane got me online in a snap to complete my task without a charge. It made the difference ina nice stay and a memorable one....something that is rare in an airport hotel stay. Thank you Diane for making a difference.

Reviews.Title: “Guest services”
Reviews.Author: Doosetdaram3
Reviews.Content: Diane was the best!!! Helped us with everything we needed from directions to in room services! Really a top notch place to stay that is close to the airport. Just ask for Diane!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Darn Good for an Airport Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Anderson_SF
Reviews.Content: Pros: My room was clean, quiet, and the decor looked new (not worn out or heavily abused). The two restaurants we good, better than some airport hotels I've stayed in. Cons: Only one, in April the lobby bar was quite cold as it sits right in front of the main doors so every person going in or out let in the cold wind. OVERALL: I'd stay again if I come back on travel or with my wife.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT SERVICE AND GREAT CONFERENCE.!”
Reviews.Author: nivita
Reviews.Content: Irecently staed at Sheraton for my conference on saturday June 25th. The hotel was really pretty but it was very, very full. The lobby looks very beautiful. I had a reception and the food was expectacular. Extreamly great flavor. But the most important detail is Estela Estrada when she decorated the fruit table and she always maintained all of the tables clean. She was friendly with everyone. Everyone was happy including me because she gave good attention to everybody and had everything conscience. She would go from detail to detail from every cup to every little wrinkle on the table.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel at LAX”
Reviews.Author: Colotraveler
Reviews.Content: Gateway service and amenities were great. The front desk rep comped us... Starwood Preferred Guest (SPG) member... an upgrade to the club level after first saying it was sold out but then found us a club room. We ask for an extra bed for our grandson to stay a few days and it was promptly provided at no charge. The outdoor pool was nice and warm even though LA was cool that week. We got the same great service last year and will return again. Self-parking cost was lower than most LAX hotels ($~14/night).

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL SERVICES”
Reviews.Author: adriana064
Reviews.Content: My room was really big and nice and quiet. Also very nice view. I have my conference every year. I'm really happy here. My students love this hotel and love the food very much and its really healthy. They always like the salad bar and Estela Estrada is the best because she always makes my Buffet's turn out to be really nice and organized. She is really friendly with my people and her smile always welcomes you. Thanks you Estela! I'll see you again preety soon.! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and friendly environment for any business stay”
Reviews.Author: Robert-Corp
Reviews.Content: I stayedon the Sheraton Gateway for a couple of days. I had a meeting on June 14th and the staff was excellent. I would like to appreciate the great service provided by Ms Estela Estrada for making sure we were always satisfied. She was very helpful, always greeted us with a great smile. From the reviews on trip advisor I read she is an amazing person and also excellent to provide anyone top level service. Thank You Estela!!! You are the best server at the Sheraton Gateway LAX!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby & pool, rooms need renov”
Reviews.Author: Danimal091
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic, nice insonorisation (close to LAX) but rooms are so out of date. Cleaning lady left door unlock by inattention, I would imagine, but personel were awesome though &offer complementary internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Guest Service by Diane Cheeks”
Reviews.Author: TeAnn
Reviews.Content: I would like to first start off by stating that this is my 2nd stay here at the Sheraton Gateway Los Angeles and the 2nd experience has been EXCEPTIONALLY great!! From the time we checked in, to the level of Guest Service over the phone by Diane Cheeks has been wonderful. All things are extremely important due to the nature of our stay. We are here on a medical trip for our 7yr old son. Diane has made certain that erroneously charges were removed and we had ample enough towels. She always called back to ensure we were okay. We are grateful and blessed to have been serviced by Diane Cheeks. As a result, my husband and I will definitely consider the Sheraton Gateway L.A. for all future stays when we are in the LAX area. Warmest, Freunda "TeAnn" Gray Room #1020

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful!”
Reviews.Author: KGB4125
Reviews.Content: Diane was fabulous! I called the front desk asking where to go for an inexpensive breakfast and Diane offered coupons for the breakfast buffet. She was sweet, fun and helpful. A real delight!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: 1krg
Reviews.Content: Great job - guest services (especially Diane), Helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT SERVICE AND A SMILE.!:)”
Reviews.Author: rositahernandez
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the sheraton gateway for a couple days for some business. so the food is very goodand especially the mexican food. delicious! and the service is excellent and ms. estela estrada. she is a great person. she explained to me everything and what was each thing from the mexican food and she gave a lot of attention to everybody and she was there to serve everyone bervages and coffee.! thanks for an excellent service estela! i wish you continue with all your hard work and effort!!

Reviews.Title: “Service at the hotel was absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Shaz07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel as a stopover in between flights from Asia to Cleveland. Believe it or not, this place was surprisingly cheaper than the Raddison. We stayed for one night and in spite of the fact that the hotel was crazybusy thanks to a cancelled flight, our check in was quick and the lady at the counter (I forgot her name, sorry) was very friendly and polite even though she was so busy. We then had dinner at the bar downstairs and as they were crazybusy again thanks to the influx of visitors from that cancelled flight, they accidentally forgot our order and immediately offered a 50% discount off our bill, which wasn't really necessary cuz we knew they were busy. Sure, the furnishings were a little old but everything was clean, spick and span. I couldn't believe how quiet the place was even though it was beside the airport and I absolutely loved the hotel's mandarin and mint toiletries. I wish they had more! Check out was quick, very friendly and great and my husband joked that they put up the Singapore flag at the lobby because I'm from Singapore. My only little gripe was that I emailed them close to 2 weeks before arriving in LA, asking if there's any vegetarian options at the cafe or around the hotel since my husband is one and never got back a reply. Most emails were automated so the hotel should look into this to ensure that guests with relevant questions could get answers. Overall, this is a really good hotel and I'd definitely stay there again if I'm in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Gateway - average but worthwhile.”
Reviews.Author: BFD
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton Gateway overnight to break the flights from Sydney to Toronto. It is only a couple of minutes from the terminal on the hotels shuttle, so is very handy. The area is pretty average, full of airport carparks and commercial offices and premises. As a result there are not too many options for a meal or something to drink, and the Sheraton charges premium rates for those services as a result. The hotel is clean and comfortable, but a bit worn. Given the amount of people that come in and out of the place on a daily basis, I can understand the impersonal attitudes of staff. All in all, good for a rest, but that is about all.

Reviews.Title: “House keeping staff was excellent!”
Reviews.Author: bvermeer1
Reviews.Content: I would like to commend the Housekeeping staff for the excellent care they take of their guests. I am a flight attendent and was on a layover at the Gateway. I left my ring in the room. I called the hotel and left a message regarding my lost ring. In just a short time ,I received a call back from Juana Pailla at Housekeeping. She was so professional and courteous. My ring had been found! I was so happy! I would like to write a special thank you to Gloria Cardena who found my ring and turned it in. She is a special lady. I appreciate so much her honesty and integrity. I would also like to thank Cesar Gonzales, who arranged the shipping of my ring. We in the airline business travel so much and hotels become ,at times, our homes away from home. The Housekeeping staff of the Sheraton Gateway made my stay as comfortable, safe and secure as if in my own home. Job well done!

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated Sheraton...decent rooms. Convenient LAX transit hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcmug2002
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks very dated from the outside (probably built in the 70s) but the inside was very nicely renovated and quite modern. extremely close to LAX...less than 5 mins shuttle ride. we'd buffet breakfast at the restaurant the first day (jet-lagged...too tired to go out for food)..$13 per person or so and the selection was very nice. they've some specialty items so it was more than your standard scramble-eggs and bacon breakfast bar. there was also a full service starbucks in the lobby area for pastries and coffee and small bites. Parking was $12 or so for overnight guests...it was not exactly on-site so you do have to walk across the street to get back to the hotel. they have on-site valet parking and it was about $20 or so. free wi-fi in the lobby area only. room was newly renovated but as you can imagine, bathroom layout was still a bit old. pool area was quite nice as well...nice lounge chairs and sun beds. since it is so close to LAX, you get a full airport view...it wasn't noisy or anything, just a very plain boring view ;) overall a decent choice for a quick stay in LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Diane Cheeks Rocks”
Reviews.Author: dawnsworldinc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with the family for a graduation party and LOVED it. The hotel is clean, the beds are comfy and the customer service was impeccable, thanks Diane and the rest if the Sheraton staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: WineLover0717
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with friends for just one night as I we were picking up someone from LAX and I was also leaving through LAX the next morning. This was a great value for us (we paid $119) - there is a free airport shuttle, we could go out in LA (expensive taxi ride though), the hotel bar was a pleasant to spend time in (and we spent a LOT of time there), my room was clean and spacious and quiet. There is a gym, a pool and outdoor area as well as a restaurant but we did not take advantage of these other amenities so I could not give this a 5 star rating since I did not experience it all. I would stay here again if I were flying in or out of LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean & friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: onlysunshine
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying at the Sheraton Gateway & was very happy with our stay. We did the girls only trip (daughter, mother, grandmother) and we had a blast. The hotel was less than 5 minutes away from the airport and they have a complimentary shuttle to and from the airport. The rooms were a nice size overlooking the airport and to our surprise you cannot hear a thing!!!!! nice and quite. The beds & pillows were awesome, so comfy slept like a baby. We had one small issue in the bathroom, called Guest Services and Diane promptly took care of the problem. Diane was very polite and professional and called us back to make sure our concerns were met. I wish we had more Diane's in some of these other hotels. Thank you Diane! The pool is heated and we loved the jacuzzi and cabana's, very nice touch. Our first day, we thought we take tthe bus but that turned into a long drawn out project, so we rushed to rent a car for the rest of our trip. We valet parked at the hotel for a much cheaper price! and that was worth every penny. Javier was the best! and was so polite and friendly, he made us feel like we were at home. My only issue is we brought our laptop to use in the room and the hotel charges $12 per day for internet in the room, I feel this service should be included. You do have the option of using your laptop downstairs in the lobby or using their business center for free! Overall, we enjoyed every moment and will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beds!..Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: cdmallar
Reviews.Content: I stay here alot for business. It is a very nice hotel! I love the beds. They are soo comfortable. The gym is great too. Very close to hotel. The only negative is the hotel shuttle bus to airport. It is not hotel owned. I think its run by the airport. It stops at 3 or 4 hotels, you never know exactly when it will come. They say every 15-20 minutes, but your never sure when...Start early to the airport. Overall the hotel itself is very nice! Will stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: macleary2000
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay here again. Nice room, nice pool with cabanas, nice fitness center. Nice free internet computers in lobby. You can hear the planes, but only a tiny bit, not an issue. The kids loved the view watching the planes taking off and landing.

Reviews.Title: “Great attention and facilities”
Reviews.Author: Sakura_002
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just great, the facilities are clean and comfortable. The personnel is nice and always please to help. The conference rooms are good and with great lightning. The meals are really tasty with lots of international food and drink options. The mexican food selection is quite great.

Reviews.Title: “Love the attention”
Reviews.Author: Rcarrion1
Reviews.Content: Hi this hotel had a great team of personal as it is Ms. Estela Estrada that give us a great customer experience and service. Had a great atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Appreciation for your Hard Work”
Reviews.Author: gilahasid
Reviews.Content: To Whom it May Concern, We recently held a wedding in one of your wonderful ballrooms, the Panahi & Cohen-Gadol Wedding, and it was very successful thanks to your wonderful, hard working crew and management. I deeply appreciate all the effort your crew put into this wedding which made it even more special. Thank you Billy, Elias, Estella, and Moses and the rest of the crew for being so pleasant and on time with your help, your work truly made a difference that night. I look forward to working with you again! -- Best Regards, Event Planner/Coordinator Gila Hasid 310.925.4369 GilaHasid@gmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed in this hotel about 10 times in the past couple of months and I can't recommend it highly enough.”
Reviews.Author: moosesamui
Reviews.Content: The service is excellent. Special mention needs to be made for Jonathan at the front desk, Merly who is in customer care and Maria in house keeping. Their outstanding service will keep me coming back. Very convenient location for business in both LA and OC. A block from LAX makes it especially convenient and only a 20 min drive to the Santa Monica beach. Awesome rooms. Very clean and very comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “just felt dirty didnt enjoy our stay here other than to fly out next morning”
Reviews.Author: she_marina
Reviews.Content: Room felt very grimy dirty. Wish we had of stayed somewhere nicer. Pool was nice, although seems nicer in pictures. Breakfast in the resturant was good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Honkie_HK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one day at the end of May in transit. Waited 10 min for shuttle bus, and the bus is shared by one or two other hotels. I got on in international terminal, by the time it arrived the other domestic terminal, it was full. The lobby looks stylish, and provided kiosks to print boarding pass. The room is not as new and stylish as the lobby but looks nice enough for one night stay. Check-in line was long, and I waited like 7 min to check-in. Overall, nice experience. I used 3000 starwood points and think it is value for "points".

Reviews.Title: “Great cleaning service”
Reviews.Author: wxc85
Reviews.Content: Teresa Ortez was very nice and cleaned the room the way I wanted it cleaned, and was very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not as great as we expected from Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: tns777
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from a Friday to Monday in late May. Upon arrival to the hotel, we couldn't figure out where to self-park as our GPS was taking us one way and there were lots all over the place and it didn't appear to be clearly written anywhere. So, we begrudgingly pulled into the valet area, hoping they could at least tell us where that is and whether we could unload anywhere. They ignored us for the few minutes that we sat around trying to get their attention though they were not understaffed and there were not too many cars around. Finally we gave up and drove off, looking around for the self-park area which we finally finally found (behind the hotel). After we parked, we had to drag our bags across a massive parking lot into the hotel because it seems if you don't valet-park, you're an unwelcome guest. The gentleman who was checking us in, however, was very professional and cordial. He even got me to sign up for their preferred member deal. I wish I had made a greater effort to remember his name. Christian, maybe? Here, I thought, was where the true Sheraton experience would begin. ALAS! We got to our room and I found a man's black sock on the little armchair by the bed. Ew ew ew. I think socks are about 1 step above underwear on the nasty-clothes-to-find scale but still far below the shirt or scarf. Anyway, we were really displeased that the room hadn't been cleaned thoroughly enough to find this or the flip flop left behind under the bed (who doesnt clean under the bed?!). Well, we called to get housekeeping to remove it and they came quickly, sending a man and a woman, but when we opened the door, they looked at us as though we were supposed to bring it to them. No, thank you! I don't go on vacation to clean up after other people. The woman finally came in, picked up the sock, and on the way out threw us this condescending "It's just a sock, you silly girls" look. It's just YOUR JOB, not mine! I don't want to touch other people's soiled clothes and I don't appreciate you condescending to us. Also, the lids on the starbucks cups that they have in the room were dirty with some kind of brown stuff. And we didn't make a big deal about it, but socks? come on! On Friday night, we placed the "do not disturb" sign on our door so that the housekeeping who comes by early in the morning (as they always do) wouldn't bother us. We had breakfast and around 12:30 we left the hotel and TOOK DOWN THE "Do not disturb" SIGN! When we came back later that day, the room wasn't cleaned. We needed to shower and since we had left our towels on the floor as instructed by the little "green housekeeping" flyer, we couldn't very well use them again. So we called down for housekeeping to bring us some towels. It took them a half an hour to bring us 4 towels. A woman at the front desk (Jessica?) kept calling to ask us whether we had received them and apologizing when we hadn't. Come on, Sheraton. It's not like you had to prepare the towels. Anyway, we ended up having to dry ourselves off with those tiny washcloth/hand towel things because we were in a hurry. Very comfortable! The next day, around the same time, we came downstairs and asked them to send housekeeping while we were out. The white guy at the desk offered us these words of wisdom, "Now, did you by any chance have the 'do not disturb' sign up?" WHAT? THERES A SIGN LIKE THAT? WHAT DOES IT DO?! Of course we did! and we took it down early in the day! That's what people do! It's your job as the hotel to keep track of whose rooms were cleaned and whether the ones that asked to not be disturbed are ok yet. Am I supposed to leave the hotel by 8am just so it's convenient for you to clean my room? And why is it that every other hotel I've ever stayed at seems to be able to handle this conundrum while still getting my room clean? And if there were come kind of iron-clad housekeeping schedule, do you think you might mention it to us when we check in so we're aware of the Sheraton's idiocy and can be prepared for it? Then, the guy at the front desk is about to start lecturing us when he stops mid-sentence and just tells us that he'll send someone up. How did I know he was about to lecture us? Well, imagine a condescending face looking at you and beginning with the following, "Well, you know in the future, you should--" Yes, thank you. In the future we should book elsewhere is what you were going to say. The room itself was fairly well decorated. Obviously not thoroughly cleaned. The chair at the desk had some stain on the seat and we used one of the many pillows they give you to cover it up when we sat down. The curtains were kind of gross (the blackout ones) and definitely could have used a wash. The sheets were clean and good so we had no complaints there. But mostly, what ruined the experience was the condescending attitude of certain members on the staff that made us feel like idiots and I don't really think that is the goal of the Sheraton. I would have just ignored everything else if it weren't for this idiotic attitude and frankly, THAT'S what's going to make me reconsider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL GOOD FOR AN OVERNIGHT STAY BEFORE YOUR FLIGHT”
Reviews.Author: gorgeouspaula
Reviews.Content: Perfect for an overnight stay before or after a flight. Restaurant with simple food on sight and nice swimming pool. parking rather expensive at $28 but hotel prices are reasonable so this averages the price out. I would use this hotel again the room was clean and the bed comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence...”
Reviews.Author: QualityTlvr
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this Hotel since 1998,,,more so since 2003...Love the location...and the nice breeze. Its near the LAX City transist center...for buses to neaby locations...Santa Monica, Hollywood, Culver CIty, etc. At the Front Desk...Mr. Jonothan Mace and Ms Smith are my favourites. Henry and Erik at the Concierge Desk are super too. Upstairs..on the 15th floor is a spacious and inviting Club Lounge--hosted by 3 incredible people: Veronica, Heidi and Juan...always chipper and helpful ! Super staff. If you enjoy commerical aircraft, like I do...this is THE place to be! Minus the noise too. I love the Link Compuers that are complimentary that Sheraton provides in the Lobby(on in the Club Lounge too !)...There is a Starbucks in the Lobby and the Brassrie restaurant has a GREAT buffett breakfast and nice lunch too. Nearby is Westchester Village...a 7 minute walk away....CVS...Trader Joe's, Ralph's, many restaurants and a Panera Bread and IHOP...to name a few...all walkable. On a scale of 1 to 10...I would give this Hotel a 13...the employees go out of their way to accommodate.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: jleatherwood
Reviews.Content: Our team experienced such wonderful and attentive service from the catering staff and all facets of service from this hotel. Our fourth year here, and every year gets better. Associate Estele Estrada took amazing care of us, and made sure everything we needed, or may need was taken care of quickly and smoothly.

Reviews.Title: “Yolanda Padilla is excellent”
Reviews.Author: reeti785
Reviews.Content: Yolanda Padilla's customer service is unmatched. She is polite and sweet .. I wish her the best .

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here if you are flying home - bad location for sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: richlcfc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a four night visit to LA. Hotel is fine and service was good but parking wasnt great as you either pay a fortune to valet park or walk 5 minutes up the road to an angry airport carpark, angry because the man in the booth was a moron. Our room stank of cigarettes which we complained about and were moved rooms and given a free breakfast which was good. Overall, the hotel is a good place to stay if your flying home but would avoid if you are using as a base for sightseeing in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Guest Services”
Reviews.Author: Aficonsulting
Reviews.Content: Call numerous time and finally get Dianne Cheek, who was a wonderful staff. She took time out to locate someone to help me to resolve my billing question. I want the management to be aware of the wonderful staff you have. Thanks Uchenna Nworgu

Reviews.Title: “First class service and great accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Nancyjmac
Reviews.Content: I called to the front desk and asked for a few items (table, extra chair, etc) that were needed and Diane was very friendly and the items were brought up to my room quickly. It has taken me sometimes over an hour at other hotels to have these exact items brought to my room. I was very impresses. Also, the beds are very comfortable! Thanks Diane and the Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “Gamex at the Sheraton was great”
Reviews.Author: HarmonWard
Reviews.Content: Three times a year the Sheraton hosts our game convention. They always treat us with friendliness, respect. and professionalism. Estrela Estrada is just one of their outstanding staff. She did an great job serving food to hundreds of hungry Stratgicon convention attendees.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay near LAX.”
Reviews.Author: Hotelanator
Reviews.Content: Everytime I'm in town near LAX I stay at the Sheraton Gateway. They have great service, a great lounge, a great bar in the lobby area, and a great breakfast in the AM. I recommend the Sheraton Gateway for anyone needing to stay around LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to grab a shower and sleep between flights”
Reviews.Author: happy_riad_fan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night between a long-haul flight arriving late in the evning and an early morning connection. I got a very good rate by calling an airport hotel consolidator when I arrived at LAX and asking about availability. The rate includes free shuttle to/from the airport which helps for travellers :-) I was exhausted, grumpy and grubby on arrival but the shuttle was fast (the hotel's very close to the airport), the staff wonderfully friendly, and the room comfortable and clean (although there was a problem with shower). Perfectly fine place to crash between flights and grab a few hours sleep if you can get a reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Estela Estrada”
Reviews.Author: achiriaco
Reviews.Content: Estela Estrada is the best assistant I have ever met at the establishment. Very helpful, courteous, nice, and eager to assist patrons in any way. Truely a great contribution to the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: jgs715
Reviews.Content: Billy rolled his cart into the room we were meeting in and it was like the saffron trucks coming over the last hill of the Silk Road. It was like spotting an oasis after crawling across the desert. It was manna from heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: SVO767
Reviews.Content: I typically don't expect a lot from airport hotels. These hotels typically have a very high volume of guests who typically don't stay for much more than a couple of nights. In sum, I wasn't expecting a lot by staying here. However, I was extremely disappointed in the cleanliness of the room, especially for such a reputable and high quality brand such as Sheraton (Starwood). The room itself I found to be generally clean, however the bathroom was the worst. There was a lot of loose hair in the bathroom, the mirror had water spots on it, and there were dirty towels hanging from the top of the shower. I basically felt as if the room had not been cleaned by housekeeping staff before my check in. I also felt like the front desk staff was not very welcoming. I felt like I was a burden to the staff by checking in. The welcome was not warm or informative. Nothing more occurred here other than an exchange of my ID, credit card and a room key. Not even an exchange of smiles. Even though I will not recommend this hotel, I would hate to say, "don't stay here" based on my single overnight experience. The hotel is very close to LAX and nearby office buildings. It certainly provides a convenience if you need to be in the area. It also provides nice views if you enjoy watching airplanes. More than anything, I just want my voice to be heard about a disappointing experience I had here.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to California:”
Reviews.Author: jimmyrc1
Reviews.Content: I and my wife Shannon Coleman enjoyed our trip to Los Angeles very much, It started off rough we had to take a early flight that cause us to get here early, the late manager didn't have a room available nor would he let us stay in the lobby so we wonder round until the next day. After coming back Mrs. Diane Check met us with a smile offer us breakfast, she apologize for our trouble, in each day she check on us, told us about different area to to visit in Los Angeles. Because of Mrs Diane Check in Mrs. Arlene Smith I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Quick response & compensation”
Reviews.Author: TTL514
Reviews.Content: On my rercent stay, I realized my room phone was not working. When I used my cell phone to call guest services, Diane Check she immediately addressed the issue and offered a complimentary lunch for the inconvenience. I was extremely impressed by her quick resolution of the situation and thoughtful compensation.

Reviews.Title: “Again, the best place to stay near LAX”
Reviews.Author: Pamz-on-the-road
Reviews.Content: My second time at this hotel and once again, the stay was AMAZING. We were greeted by the valet staff with a smile, greeted warmly by the front desk staff, treated like royalty by the wait staff at the bar and got to stay in a great room with STARBUCKS COFFEE in the room. Love, love, love this hotel. You guys will too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and customer services”
Reviews.Author: transa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days, very nice hotel and great customer services, very close to LAX airport. Estela Estreda (Food and Beverages staff) was very helpful of providing food and services to our customers.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek & Chic”
Reviews.Author: KaliKross
Reviews.Content: I have a lot of hope for the Sheraton Gateway. It has all the look of a four-ish star hotel, & the service is impeccable, especially that of Miss Doyle, the Paparazzi bar's tender. I was also impressed w/ the ladies at check-in/check-out, one of whom even called upstairs to ensure I was satisfied w/ the room since my previous stay was far-below satisfactory. The first stay left me convinced that I'd been placed in the maid's quarters. Dried boogers adorned the shower curtain & bath walls. Mold & mildew were among the bathroom's assets. The coffee maker was too disgusting to use. And the fixtures were rickety if not altogether broken. Oh, and the chair... The chair!!! Rme. Think navy chair covered in a white dandruff-esque substance. Ewww! But my more recent stay was far better. My room was spotless, & breakfast was divine. Salmon & capers? Mmmmmm. Grits & maple sugar? Say it ain't so! Despite the dander that peppered my first stay, I actually love just being in the lobby of the Sheraton Gateway, & I enjoy the in-room views even more. Now if only I can get the Sheraton to love me as much as I love it... I'm "Arnold" on this one: "I'll be back."

Reviews.Title: “Smart attractive lobby area sets the stage for a refreshing, enjoyable stay.”
Reviews.Author: OneHappySoul
Reviews.Content: Convenience from LAX is great! We just hopped on the shuttle right outside baggage pick up and in minutes we were in the stylish lobby...lots of inviting areas to hang out, a nice business center in one corner, exercise room that looked out onto the classy, relaxing outside pool with lots more great areas to sit and chill. Clean refreshing place that gave no hint of how close we were to the airport. Standard "two double bed" room had a nicely polished feel with very, very comfortable, cloud like beds. Nothing remarkable about the bathroom; standard, but clean. The Starbucks right inside the lobby was a great alternative in the morning. Some of us had a full breakfast in the hotel restaurant, and some had lighter fare from Starbucks and picked up some traveling food there too. This is a great place to rejuvenate if you are just passing through LA, or as a base camp if you are exploring LA.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people”
Reviews.Author: strawberries1
Reviews.Content: Joseph Martinez at the front desk was Awesome. Heidi in Club Lounge was wonderful. Luz in housekeeping was excellent. People were very nice and helpful. It's great being able to get to and from airport easily.

Reviews.Title: “Always Stay and always will when at LAX”
Reviews.Author: DarrenN69
Reviews.Content: A very welcoming Hotel from the minute you step inside. Staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms are always clean and functional and the beds are sooo comfortable. Great after a long flight. Great amenities especially the fitness centre. Best brekkie buffet going around. I can't fault this place and always enjoy my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Yolanda Padilla is absolutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: mmoore_11
Reviews.Content: I spend 75% of my time on business trips. Often times I'm barely greeted by hotel staff members that seem as exhausted as I am. However, today I received a treat and was greeted by an upbeat, customer focused and dedicated Sheraton employee - Yolanda Padilla. Yolanda was genuinely concerned about me and my needs, asked about my day, and far exceeded my expectations. Her exception level of service will keep me constantly coming back to Sheraton and tell others of the great service I received. Yolanda deserves a raise!

Reviews.Title: “My hotel of choice when in LAX area”
Reviews.Author: multinati0nal
Reviews.Content: This is absolutely my favorite hotel that I have experienced in the LAX area and I have already returned twice. I've been lucky to meet front desk associate Joseph Martinez each time and have had a great experience. The first time, the hotel was extremely busy with a convention and I was unable to get the room I had reserved. Joseph was extremely accommodating and apologetic and made sure to secure me a private room that was actually leagues beyond what I expected for the price I had paid through Expedia. The view was great, much nicer than the other LAX hotels I've stayed at and the amenties in the room and hotel are just super nice. The second time, Joseph remembered me! He very kindly secured an extremely nice room for me - when I went up and it was accidentally still being serviced, I went back down and he immediately accomodated me with another room that was on a lower floor, but was even nicer. He really went out of his way to please me as a customer. The hotel itself is beautifully set up and I have only had extremely positive and helpful interactions with the staff as they took care of my requests for internet and some packaging for my belongings. It's kinda weird, before I just figured a hotel is a hotel and I don't need anything fancy or a particular brand, just whatever is cheapest at the time. My experience at the Sheraton here though has ensured that I will always seek out this hotel when I visit LAX, and will always seek out the brand first when I travel elsewhere. Thank you so much to Joseph and the other associates for some very awesome stays!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location.”
Reviews.Author: toutouwai
Reviews.Content: Well appointed large room. Altough situated at the end of LAX runway, the room is very effectively soundproofed. an excellent stop over site after a long flight.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel that could easily be on the Sunset Strip or Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: lisafairchild
Reviews.Content: My husband and our young son recently stayed at the Sheraton Gateway for 9 nights. Although we live in Los Angeles, we were having some work done at our house and so had to stay in a hotel while it was being done. Our insurance company gave us a choice of hotels and originally we had planned to split our stay between another hotel that was much closer to our house and ten minutes from our son's school and only spend the weekend at the Sheraton Gateway. However, after three days at the Gateway we decided it was well worth the drive (about 40 minutes in traffic) to instead book the entire 9 day stay at the Gateway. What can I say, the hotel is extremely well run and although it's busy it doesn't feel crowded or overwhelming. The lobby area is beautifully appointed and could easily be that of one of the trendier hotels on the Sunset Strip or in Beverly Hills. Nothing about this hotel suggests "LAX", from the incredible breakfast buffet, one of the best that I've had (and I've had many) to the five star Paparrazi restaurant where I dined on one of the best salmon in papillote that I've had, to the scrumptious chocolate lava cake. The pool is sparkling and well maintained and the cabana area is light and airy and so relaxing that I decided to take one day off and spend it by the pool. They also have an extremely well appointed fitness room as well as a convenient guest only complimentary internet "cafe" off of the lobby. Thanks to the management and staff at the Gateway I can truly say that the 9 days that I stayed there felt more like a vacation then any that I've taken recently where I've actually gone somewhere! I recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a relaxing and first class stay in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “A welcome break for LAX travellers”
Reviews.Author: bigguyinpasadena
Reviews.Content: One usually does not look forward to stays at LAX area hotels but my stasy Sheraton Gateway Los Angeles is an exception. It is a nice large hotel with full facilities located close to LAX.The rooms are well maintained and nicely furnished with comfortable beds. As a Starwood Platinum Guest I am very well taken care of at The Sheraton Gateway-really makes a difference. But the thing that really makes this hotel stand out-and the reason I stay here even when not flying out of LAX-is the outstanding staff. For example. Our waiter Horaccio in the Paperazzi lounge remebered us from a visit several months ago and greeted us as returning friends, while providing excellent service. The front desk folks were great as well,Friendly and professional. Speaking of Paperrazi-the in house restaurant,the food is really exellent! They have a new chef who is looking forward to bringing even more delicious Italian food onto the menu. This place is worth a special trip just for dinner!

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: Rueben2007
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to LAX airport. So close, that you can see and hear the planes landing and taking off. The hotel staff is very friendly and professional. My room was clean. The bed was really good!!! However, the rooms need a little update. They feel more like a Holiday Inn or Comfort Inn and less like a Sheraton. The walls are like paper towel. You can hear your neighbors. The hotel lobby, restaurants, bar and pool are nice. Valet parking is pricey. Self park is a much better deal. Few restaurants nearby. All major road are not too far. The best thing about this hotel was the room bed and staff. If you need to be close to the airport you should stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A Superb Stay - couldn't recommend highly enough”
Reviews.Author: wilbaer
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days here as a base for some LA activity as first-timers to the City and it was absolutely superb. Room was fine (hardly any aircraft noise to speak of). We were on the Club level and despite bathroom not being too new, this was not an issue as everything else was perfect. Staff everywhere were exceptionally helpful and went the extra distance to help out their customers. Breakfast was great (Club room visitors got free buffet breakfast at weekends instead of the Club room breakfast - more substantial). Club brekkie was still fine though. Staff in the hotel restaurants were great and food was very good. Didn't try the pool, but people out there seemed to enjoy it. All in all, a really enjoyable stay and way better than expected for an airport hotel. I would recommend it highly to anyone - close to LA tourist activities as long as you have a car. Hollywood/Bev Hills only about 20 mins away and Disney circa 35-40 mins. Only negative aspect would be the very over-priced valet parking. Convenient, but way too expensive at circa $24 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Good for "right before you fly"”
Reviews.Author: AlbertR
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 night at the Sheraton gateway, at the end of a vacation, the night before we were to fly back out of LAX. The hotel is pretty basic, nothing special. The location is great if you are going to catch a flight, and they have a shuttle bus service to the terminals. I paid a special rate by using cash + point on Starwood, around $40. The room was quite large, and well appointed, but the bathroom had issues: mildew stain on the showerhead, and some yellow colored grime on the toilet. There's a Starbuck's on location, which is good. $24 for overnight parking (there is no self parking option anymore, it's all "valet" now) is grand theft! I have stayed there before, and there was no valet back then. I wonder who came up with the rip-off idea...? Another bad idea is that they charge $10,95 for wi-fi Internet in the room, but if you want to connect with two devices (e.g. I-phone and laptop), you have to pay twice!! Another rip-off... I would stay there again, but only for 1 night, and only if I had a flight the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo! Excellent service and Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: cad_world_traveller
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for a night before departing LAX the next day. This is my second stay here. I was greeted with excellent service at check-in. Being a SPG gold, I didn't have to request anything as everything I had wished for was mentioned and offered by the kind staff at the front desk. From king suite upgrade to late check out. I really commend on the service I received. All sheratons should in fact learn from this. Free wi-fi throughout the hotel facility is a bonus!. Our king suite was facing West Century Blvd and the runway but we really had no issue with excessive noise or sound as others had mentioned. The rooms do have sound proof windows. Being one of the closest airport to the LAX runways, one should expect some level of sound especially when one of the older cargo jets scream down the runway on take off!! The AAA rate we got was super,which includes buffet breakfast for 2 at the Brasserie. The selection was good and satisfying. I have to also mention the wide array of fitness equipment at the gym. Being a fitness enthusiast, I have to say this hotel gym offers more than some other top end hotels. The lobby s fairly spacious with relaxing lounges. Overall, I would definitely return to this hotel in my next visit to LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Joe_Troutman
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sheraton Gateway Los Angeles and I have to comliment the hotel on their staff. Everyone there was extremely helpful and very pleasant. I had a particularly great experience with Gabriela and Francisco at the Rendezvous bar. I had many gatherings there with customers and they provided a very pleasant atmosphere and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: DRAM07
Reviews.Content: A good hotel to crash out after a long flight from the U.k.Efficient shuttle from LAX . The room was clean and quiet .Breakfast excellent choice and service. Staff friendly and pleasant. Good location to collect hire car and start holiday.Booked this hotel through Air New Zealand at the room rate was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Lipstick on a pig”
Reviews.Author: ant1999e
Reviews.Content: Valet service and the fancy lobby are misleading. There were holes in the ceiling from water damage on our floor. The light in the bathroom was installed crooked, shower head was crooked, ton drain drained slow and toilet also had drainage problems. I was not impressed with this place.and would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Get another hotel or pay next to nothing”
Reviews.Author: traildawgz
Reviews.Content: Bathroom was awful - see the photos. I had asked for a recently renovated room and they were unable at the front desk to understand what there inventory was. Bathroom door had holes drilled in it, stains etc. Guys, buy a new door swap out the hardware. The sink had broken and stained caulk...caulk and clean the sinks! Generally I like Sheraton...this was not good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: 143SFCA
Reviews.Content: There are a plethora of hotels adjacent to LAX. This is one of the better ones. The rooms are clean and comfortable, staff friendly, and its location is great. The starbucks on site is convenient, the restaurants decent, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: redhand
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Gateway Hotel on the first and end nights of our Californian vacation. On both occasions we took the upgrade offer and for 30 dollars had a room on the Club Floor, free appitiser in the evening and buffet breakfast in the morning. Great value. Free internet in the lobby was an added bonus. We found the room to be very comfortable but would recommend staying at the rear of the hotel where aircraft noise was considerably less that in the rooms at the front. Staff were very friendly and helpful and overall we had a very enjoyable stay. This hotel kind of restored my faith in the Sheraton brand.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel stay ever - Avoid this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tippy5555
Reviews.Content: I was kept awake all night from loud music in the ballroom followed by loud guests in the halls, and the hotel did nothing to remedy the noise. I paid for a night's sleep but received nothing but a headache. The paintings on the wall were literally rattling from the music - it was a horrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Food Service!”
Reviews.Author: Localguy96819
Reviews.Content: Whether it's a banquet, meeting, or just dinner you're looking for, the food service team at the Sheraton Gateway LAX are top notch! Whether it's Zee Bell, Sales Catering Manager; Estela Estrada (associate), Juan (manager), or any other member of the catering team, they attended to our every need! Eusum at the Paparazzi Restaurant was great, as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: pootiemn
Reviews.Content: I found trip advisor Diane Cheek very helpful with my stay! Diane provide useful information that made my stay very comfortable. Please hire more staff like Diane and I will return time after time and recommend the Sheraton Gateway to friends. Thank you Diane.!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service”
Reviews.Author: tonyisit
Reviews.Content: Everytime I come to this hotel I am greeted by an awesome employee names Rheziel at the front desk. She always welcomes me and she remembers my name. When I check out, she always remembers to say " Thank you ". In fact, everyone at this hotel is awesome. The facility is spotless with friendly service. This is the only place I ever want to stay when I come to Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Great service.”
Reviews.Author: mmiklos38
Reviews.Content: My company recently used this hotel for training. We had the pleasure of meeting and working with a lot of the conference employees. Everyone was very helpful and friendly. I would especially like to acknowledge Estela and Roberto. Both of them had a 'can do' attitude and did everything to make our stay very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Way to End a Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: vacationdaily158
Reviews.Content: WOW...What great service at the Sheraton Gateway. We checked in and had associates that exceeded expectations. Thanks to both Yolanda and Whitney for a stress free check in and out. Great dining experience with top notch, professional service. Thanks to our server Miguel for that! I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants superior service and outstanding accomadations.

Reviews.Title: “The Sheraton is The Best Place to stay at the LAX airport”
Reviews.Author: jackscl
Reviews.Content: The staff is always accomodating. Special Thanks to Diane Cheek for her prompt service. You are the best..

Reviews.Title: “A great experience and excellent customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Teach4ed
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful experience at your Hotel. The Banquet Department, Billy and Lucas where very attentive. They were on top of everything and also they made sure we were well taken care of. The bartender was very friendly. Overall I would definetely recommend this Hotel to my Colleagues and friends.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Smile”
Reviews.Author: bgfoureasy
Reviews.Content: We often think of a Smile as Love; Welcoming. Beyond the Smile Ms. Estela Estrada in the Banquet department @ the Sheraton Gateway went above and beyond her continually consistant Joyfully Loving Smile to make us all feel as though we were joining this fine facility as guests in her home. Very Respectfully, Thank You.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel Option”
Reviews.Author: FlyJayClass
Reviews.Content: I stopped over in LA on my way to and from New Zealand last month and stayed at the Sheraton LAX in both directions. I have stayed at the hotel before and think it is one of the best in the airport area. If you are an aviation buff like myself, some of the airport view rooms have a great view of arriving and departing aircraft. The rooms are clean and very well appointed . The Club Floor is worth the extra money if you are arriving after a long haul flight as you can enjoy access to the lounge for snacks in the evening or continental breakfast in the morning. Free wifi is also available on the Club level. I have never had anything bad to say about this property however I did have a small issue with the bathroom this visit. Oddly enough I was in room 1565 both on my way to New Zealand and on the way back. During both stays (about 3 weeks apart) there was such a loud noise of air blowing quite forcefully through the air vent in the bathroom that the door to the bathroom had to be closed at all times. And when in the bathroom it was not only irritating but this constant flow of cold air that could not be controlled was very unpleasant. Especially when getting out of the shower. The bathrooms are definitely in need of some updating and this air vent issue needs to be addressed. My only other issue was with respect to the shuttle service from the airport terminals. For whatever reason (possibly just luck) it always seems as though the shuttle for the Sheraton LAX arrives at the airport shuttle stops much less frequently than the shuttles bound for the other airport hotel properties. Just an observation. I would still highly recommend this hotel to travelers stopping over and looking for a nice place to stay in the airport area.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Diane Check”
Reviews.Author: ccovin
Reviews.Content: I got what i needed almost before i hung up the phone. Thanks for following up to make sure i was taken care of. You made my stay more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Average to above average not 4 star, maybe 3.5”
Reviews.Author: Jabezgreen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four days on late March. Overall the property is fine and the service was OK but not phenomenal. Nothing bad, just nothing to write home about. The hotel is pretty close to the airport and also pretty convenient to the LA area(depending on traffic of course). Self parking is behind the hotel and was slightly convenient. There are some stores nearby and a Burger King which was about $18 cheaper for breakfast as compared to the hotel. No free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel fantastic weekend”
Reviews.Author: son063
Reviews.Content: On arriving at the check-inn desk we were greeted by Yalanda Padilla.What a welcome she give us.Offered us different options before we could make up our minds.This young lady has so much patience and good customer service.Our whole stay was wonderful and I can really recommend the sheraton to all my friends and family.Every staff member was polite and helpful giving direction to where we went.The buffet breakfast was really good.We felt like royalty in your hotel.We spent our annerversary at your hotel and you made it special.Once again thank you Sheraton Tiffany Richmond uk

Reviews.Title: “Great meeting arrangements!”
Reviews.Author: Sheraton_LA_Downtown
Reviews.Content: Visited the hotel for a one day meeting and was blown away with the style and attentive service. Especially from Estela Estrade who wins my vote every time!

Reviews.Title: “Gaby is amazing”
Reviews.Author: RICURA
Reviews.Content: I visited Los Angeles recently and I stop by the Sheraton Bar and was my best desicion, I find a the best bartender ever see, Gaby is amazing, very courteous, friendly,very detailed and may you fell very special, she's one of the best bartender in the area 100%. thank you much for your treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: TheWaywordTraveler
Reviews.Content: I have clients in the area so the hotel is conveniently located but there are no bars, shops or restaurants w/in walking distance. If you are willing to take a short taxi ride you can get to some good spots... I would recommend Pancho's if you like Mexican I have to mention Juan in the Club Lounge -- what great service, very attentive, keeps the place neat and clean, any request you have he takes care of. Whatever they pay him -- he deserves a raise -- Juan delivers.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: OleseaStraticiuc
Reviews.Content: I just had a weekend escape and we stayed at Sheraton gateway. The hotel is really nice, but what makes it nicer is the hotel staff. I wanted to mention Juan M. Ramos, he was great. We called the hotel at 9 pm because we wanted some fresh towels and Juan was knoking at our door 5 minute later with everything we needed and even more. He was amazingly generous, he offered his help with whatever we needed. I've been in hotel industry for years now and I really wish that more and more hotels in US hire people like Juan. Thank you Juan from the girls from Room 872

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Irvine-Robbie
Reviews.Content: I arrived for check-in at 10pm and there was a very short (about 5-8 minute wait). There were 5 people working check-in. The person at the front desk was busy but VERY nice. The hotel was in reasonably good condition and the room was perfect. The lobby looked very busy (Saturday night 10pm) and there were multiple events occurring in the meeting rooms. This appears to be a conference hotel. Self Parking is $13 and a bit inconvenient. It is behind the hotel. It is about a 100-200 yard walk to the side entrance to the hotel. It was windy when I arrived and raining in the morning when I left. This may pose a problem for some travelers. If it does, you had better pay the extra $12 and valet park ($25 total). There is a Starbucks in the lobby and there appeared to be plenty of places to sit around. This is a great business hotel or a good place to sleep if you have an early LAX flight the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Ms. Erika Morales gave me great support which makes me feel at home”
Reviews.Author: Lilishy
Reviews.Content: Ms. Erika Morales supported me by getting bottle water, slippers and helped me understand how to use TV and facilities. She smiles and takes care of me which made me feel like I was at home. I appreciate her help to me. This is very impressive to a visitor.

Reviews.Title: “Great and Immediate service”
Reviews.Author: 357Q
Reviews.Content: Rafael Santo and Arlene Smith assisted me in correcting a billing issue that occured on my pervious stay. The serviced I received was professional, courteous, and immediate. Within a hour my issues was corrected and I received a corrected billing statement. Great service. I will definetly recommeding this hotel and continue to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great conference service”
Reviews.Author: socialmh
Reviews.Content: For three days associate Estela Estrada kept us stocked with beverages and breakfast, kept the tables looking beautiful and was there for additional requests, we never ran out of anything. She also did all of her work quietly and never disturbed our lectures with clanging of dishes. Thank you for your quiet friendliness.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: ulucey
Reviews.Content: The pool is gorgeous. Diane in guest relations has been very helpful. I would recommend this property to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not just comfortable, but enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: RobertStephen
Reviews.Content: I was at the hotal for a three-day series of meetings of educators from over about California cities, and we were very pleased with the facilities and service. Among others, we appreciated how Roberto and Estela made our meal service warm and friendly -- always a plus after hours of talk!

Reviews.Title: “This location, staff never disapoints”
Reviews.Author: luvs2travel015
Reviews.Content: Great location, easy access to freeways. Juan in the lounge (15th floor) is excellent. He is congenial, works hard and very nice! Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overnight Airport Stay..!”
Reviews.Author: svandergaag
Reviews.Content: Great Rate Extremely comfortable beds Excellent business center Great Subway next door & Starbucks in this hotel (How could you lose) Somewhat noisy AC (But it worked well) Somewhat hollow door (I could hear my kids from down the hall.. :) All in all a good pick...!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Mopower
Reviews.Content: Fantastic exercise room, wonderful pool area and very quiet rooms

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, good airport hotel. Good service. Terrible valet and slow elevators”
Reviews.Author: YHD
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for LAX. Has a shuttle service and great views of the runways for plane spotting. Generally the service is good. The valets I think are an outside company and are a total joke - incompetent, rude, slow, and that is using tripadvisor friendly terms. Took 7 requests and 23 minutes to get a car at 10:20 in the morning. Not peak time. The car finally was 'found' after 5 people got involved and that was after a lot of shrugging and passing the buck. My colleaague was told several times the car was "on the way" when it was obvious they had no clue - especially since they found the key still sittin at the valet desk 15 minutes in. The hotel staff in general is friendly and helpful. The elevators are VERY slow - plan well ahead if you have to meet people downstairs. The Club floor and rooms are nothing special, but decent and quiet. The hotel and rooms are somewhat dated, but a very decent airport hotel. Starbucks in lobby is nice and the gym is fairly good. Nice pool area for warmer LA days.

Reviews.Title: “Estela Estrada helped get us tuna/veggie lunches quickly”
Reviews.Author: 90266Frank
Reviews.Content: Our conference used the Sheraton's box lunch purchase bar; the first day there were no veggie or tuna sandwiches as we had requested of our corporate conference arrangements people. Estela Estrada notified the chef, and the first day tuna sandwiches were made up right away, and the chef waived the charge. Subsequent days there were veggie sandwiches each day at regular prices. Thanks go to Estela!

Reviews.Title: “THANK YOU FOR ALL YOUR ATTENTION”
Reviews.Author: Carmelita_64
Reviews.Content: I would like to Thank Estela Estrada for her attention and willness to provide customer service... she was always on top of things and making sure we were satisfied as was all the staff during our conference. Great place to meeting. again thank you all.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but didn't wow me”
Reviews.Author: Foufikins
Reviews.Content: We are Starwood Gold Preferred card holders so we were upgraded to the executive room which turned out to be really was nothing that special. It seemed like any other standard room except they provided a bathrobe. The room was very clean; the duvets and bed also comfortable. The blue airport shuttle was prompt and serviced a few other hotels too. We had a buffet breakfast in the hotel restaurant which was $20 each but the most economical choice in the restaurant given that single entrees averaged $15 in any event. There is a new Starbucks in the lobby too. The check-in staff and concierges' service was very good. We got the room for $100 per night. I don't think I'd pay more than this for this hotel though. The lobby is quite dark and so is the lighting in the rooms. I didn't like that WIFI is $12 in the room (although it's free in the lobby). There is a $5 shuttle to Manhattan Beach from the hotel too. The outdoor swimming pool did not have any lounge chairs out as it was too cold.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: groundsquirrel
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and had lots of amenities. The staff was friendly, especially Estela Estrada, who was efficient, charming and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Full and fine service”
Reviews.Author: jmbrink
Reviews.Content: My experience at this hotel was first rate, clean rooms, friendly staff, efficient parking, excellent b'fast, and more. The only negative worth mentioning is the desk chair which was broken down. Gabriela S at the bar took very good care of me and other guests for lunch and dinner times when the main restaurant was closed or not the right atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Need more like Diane!”
Reviews.Author: doc42games
Reviews.Content: Diane Cheek was amazing She Made me feel at home and wanted. A Pleasure to stay here we will be back with the Strategicon conventions. immediate service and friendly. That is what I expect at a hotel like this. No worries!

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly comfortable, clean, and guest friendly”
Reviews.Author: ewmelton
Reviews.Content: I was on the 9th floor of your hotel, and I must tell you that each and every one of your maids and cleaning staff where so friendly and courteous. I found that all of the rest of your staff where also very accommodating where ever I met them. I was there for the Bachata Congress and it was a wonderful event that I had a great time attending.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Environment and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: george_vlahos
Reviews.Content: We ate at the Papparazzi Restaurant. Ms. Estela Estrada was the associate who catered to us during our VIP Breakfast. She was attentive, courteous, and professional. We enjoyed our experience during the PMAG Conference, and especially the wonderful serive Ms. Estela Estrada provided that morning.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service which Exceeds Expectations and Redefines Excellence”
Reviews.Author: RobertKinney
Reviews.Content: I travel weekly for business. This hotel is a gem. The staff is exceptional! Every touch point of the staff is friendly, accommodating, and anticipative (from the curbside to the valet, lobby, bell desk, restaurant both breakfast and /or dinner, to house keeping...). After 60 nights of stays in the past 4 months, my sampling is a solid reflection of what you will encounter. Not once have I met or seen a grumpy head employee. I have found alternate hotels closer to the beach, a little less expensive, but no one has come close to the customer service level of this staff's happy demeanors which becomes contagious. All employees are part of an A Team, with special mention going to: Romain, Mario, Kerri and Horazzio and Irene to mention a but a few. Thank you for making my time on the road, away from family less of a distraction by providing a new level of customer service with exceptional attitude and attention to detail! Warm regards, John S. Kinney CM President Kinney Aviation Consulting LLC Denver Colorado

Reviews.Title: “Great place to host a conference!”
Reviews.Author: NelsonMaldonado
Reviews.Content: the hotel is large and comfortable for a one day conference. the staff is the best part of the hotel aside from it's location next to LAX. of particular great service were our attendants for the day, Sami Afif and his staff of Elias Moscoso and Estela Estrada who really went out of their way all day to make it a most comfortable and successful conference. We are very pleased and look forward to our next meeting at the Sheraton Gateway! we would gladly recommend the hotel to our association members.

Reviews.Title: “Paparazzi was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: SkiBumChris
Reviews.Content: I ate at the Paparazzi bar (inside the hotel) twice. The food was fantastic. The decor is really cool - doesn't feel like you're in a hotel bar/restaurant at all. And most importantly the service was incredible. Horatio, the bartender, was friendly, attentive, and very helpful - even though I was traveling alone he made me feel welcome and like a regular! Both nights the manager, Romain, came to make sure everything was great. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “The customer services rendered by Ms. Daine Check exceeded my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: LBJs1245
Reviews.Content: I reviewed prompt customer services beyound my expectations from Daine Check, The consistencey of service was more than what I normally receive from during business travel from Daine. I would highly recommend the Sheraton Gateway as a place of stay during business or pleasure travel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel For The Price”
Reviews.Author: BluesTraveler75
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for 1 night due to an early LAX flight but it was a good value. The service was great and professional. The room was clean. They had a Starbucks on sight which is always a plus. Great location if you are flying out early.

Reviews.Title: “Slept on a cloud!....”
Reviews.Author: BelleOrchidee
Reviews.Content: We came back from Menzanillo, Mexico and were very very tired from the trip. The Shuttle picked us up at the LA Airport, with hardly any waiting time. We checked in the hotel and had requested the 15th floor. We were given a non smoking room on the 14th floor. There was free bottled water, ice, clean luxurious king size bed, nice soap, shampoo and lotion in the bathroom. In the room is free Starbuck Coffee and cream/sugar. What a nice way to start the day. We slept like logs and the room was nice, quiet, private and clean. We would definitively return to that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bed great, shame about the bathroom.....”
Reviews.Author: kiwiabroadandbeyond
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because of reputation, proximity to LAX, free shuttle & as only overnighting alone, wanted somewhere safe, clean etc. Very disappointed to arrive and get no service from driveway staff AT ALL. Shuttle driver was great BUT Sheraton staff not interested in guests arriving by shuttle (obviously).....same for reception staff. Got help to room with luggage only after asking for it. Bathroom was small & on closer inspection - FILTHY! Urine around base of /AND long dark hairS attached to floor screws of toilet. Used shower cap and hair on shower curtain. Bed was comfortable. Morning buffet b'fast -No options for "light eaters" - overcharged as full buffet. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “As close to perfection”
Reviews.Author: jerseycali1981
Reviews.Content: Great! Especially the Paparrazi lounge, with Horacio, love him! Great service, attentive, and just great

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is great; however, customer service is excellent. Check out Juan from Club L. on the 15th floor.”
Reviews.Author: running4u
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very accommodating. The rooms are very nice and large. If there's something you need and don't see it or have it in your room, call the front desk and you will be greeted with kindness. The area has lots to offer within walking distance if you know where to go.

Reviews.Title: “Location/Service/Experience”
Reviews.Author: mosklj
Reviews.Content: Like the hotel a lot. They took excellent care of me from the moment I got out of my car in valet parking. 15th floor concierge level. Some promos sent my way. Diane in guest services was very helpful! You can't go wrong staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlennisBell
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before our Hawaiian vacation and we found it to be most convenient to LAX. It was very clean and the staff was all very helpful. I don't know about spending a vacation here, but it's great for accessing the airport the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Great changes from our last visit”
Reviews.Author: TravelPort101
Reviews.Content: We normally stay at the Westin Los Angeles Airport when we are in the area, but recently decided to try the Sheraton Gateway Los Angeles Hotel for the second time and we were pleasantly surprised as a guest to the hotel. The service was at a higher standard than previously. Our morning room service arrived within 15 minutes which normally takes 30 to 40 minutes at most hotels. The service at the bar was always timely. As a Platinum member we always receive a great room upgrade unlike the Westin Hotel. The higher standard of service at the Sheraton Gateway has changed our view of the hotel and is now our choice over the Westin hotel. Kudos to Management and their staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay...”
Reviews.Author: ds_home1255
Reviews.Content: Dianne Cheats was very professional and helpful with guest services! The food at the restaurant was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Higly recommended”
Reviews.Author: trailblazer88
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night on a stop over in order to catch a flight the next day. We were expecting noise from the airplanes as the hotel is quite near to the airport but we never hear the air planes at all. Overall, it was a good stay. The rooms are clean and the front desk and concierge were very helpful. We would stay here again if I am on transit to another city.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury close to airport”
Reviews.Author: YoungTraveller88
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in June 2010 with my partner. Really enjoyed our 2 night stay here. Nice bar food and breakfast, great location for those who want to be close to the airport. Lovely swimming pool with loungers etc and good fitness centre also. Our room was spacious and the bed was really comfy. Staff were very helpful in helping us organise a trip to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel - Close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: SouthFLTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed heare for one night prior to a flight out of LAX. The hotel was close to the airport and was clean and comfortable. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful at check in. The rooms were clean and the hotel had free Wifi in the lobby and a shuttle to the airport. I would highly recommend this hotel if flying out of LAX for it's comfort and convenience to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Not the usual Sheraton standard.”
Reviews.Author: Jillian128
Reviews.Content: Whilst the rate we got was excellent $100AUD a night we were underwhelmed by the room and service. No fridge. Basic room. Had to pay for wifi in room. Breakfast buffet is sub-standard. No really good healthy offerings. Service is efficient ie fast but not too good at listening. ie specify just eggs and bacon and get hash browns as well??? Pool is nice. Gym is good.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely no soundproofing between rooms”
Reviews.Author: Travelingpossum
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton for a conference. The food was good and the bed was comfortable, but the amount of noise that came from the adjoining room ruined my stay. My neighbors were conversing loudly well into the night, and I could hear their conversation almost perfectly. The lack of soundproofing is unacceptable. I will never return.

Reviews.Title: “Quick and comfy stopover”
Reviews.Author: CaramutJane
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Gateway with three young children on a stopover between Australia and South America. We arrived at the hotel after a 14 hour flight and a 3 hour detainment at LA airport (where I found immigration staff to be surprisingly rude). Reception allowed us to check in three hours before the advertised check-in time for which I was extremely grateful. The rooms were comfortable and notably, the beds were wonderful. I could not recharge my iPod but that's being a bit fussy. The spa and pool were open until midnight and my kids and I were thrilled to be able to have a late swim. The outdoor spa was terrific on a cold LA night, and you do not have to go hunting for towels. Breakfast was not included in our online booking so double-check if you want it. In-room coffee would have been appreciated. Denny's is a kilometre's walk from the hotel and provides a good, inexpensive meal, especially if you have children. We will be staying at the Sheraton Gateway again.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Estela for a great job at our meeting!”
Reviews.Author: Paytonm
Reviews.Content: I attended a meeting on January 13th for Gateway to LA and we were served by Ms. Estela Estrada. She was so warm and friendly and attentive to our needs. Great job!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sheraton!”
Reviews.Author: amandadesouza
Reviews.Content: Customer service was great, even though the hotel was packed! Diane Cheek did a great job.

Reviews.Title: “Great Layover Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pipsta
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in December just for one night while breaking up the flight from NZ to UK. Travelling by myself with a large suitcase I found everything- from shuttle pick up to checking out a pleasure. The shuttle bus was quick and efficient and easy to find. No queue for check in and even though I was earlier than check in time they gave me a room immediately. The concierge helped me to find a bus to Santa Monica and off I went. The starbucks in the hotel was a godsend and made nicer by the extremely friendly staff. (even got a complimentary tea when their till was not working) In the night I opted not to eat in the hotel, again the concierge gave me a map and marked on it where In n Out burger was, about a 10/15 minute walk. I had breakfast in the morning in the hotel off the a la carte menu which was ok, but at least it was quick. The main joy for me, especially being a solo pregnant traveller was how all the staff, reception, cleaners, wait staff were so friendly and quick to give a smile - nice when you really have spoken to anyone in the past 24 hours! Recommend and am staying there again at end of week when I do the trip back to NZ.

Reviews.Title: “Best location for overnighting before the long haul flight”
Reviews.Author: skippyLuzern
Reviews.Content: It seemed a good idea to make an online booking for a King room on the Executive Floor (with a late check out) before embarking on the evening flight to Australia, except when I arrived after midnight from the East Coast there was no available King bed and the Executive Lounge was not in operation until the following week! I asked for a "downgrade" as it was a waste of money for non-existing services, despite the offer of an appertiser in the bar (at 12.45am) and a breakfast coupon. When the key did not work for the third room offered to me and I had hauled my luggage for the third time through the corridors, the clerk on the front desk, new on the shift, took me and my luggage to the room and apologetically did her best to placate me with the offer of a $50 credit on food - so I ordered room service. The 3 rating is for her making up for the less able clerk earlier in the evening who just did not get it! This is a very convenient hotel and has a great lobby with great wi-fi (I think it was even free) and very comfortable and private armchairs and chaise longues to pass the time between check -out and a late flight. I checked my bags with the bell boy and took the Ocean Trolley to Manhattan Beach and Manhattan Village and would say it was one of the best $5 buys I have made - again a great way to get away from LAX for a few hours without the hassle of renting a car, and there are great cafes by the ocean and friendly drivers on the Trolley which stops outside the Sheraton and good shopping at the Village trolley stop. The hotel rooms are supposedly "refurbished" but I have stayed here before and my recollection is that the rooms were much better presented before. My positive recommendation is based on the location and the excellent lobby areas as well as good rates online if you can pick the right combination.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Business”
Reviews.Author: pnathan
Reviews.Content: The proximity to the airport made this a convenient location for a business meeting. From the porte cochere to the lobby, the hotel has a hip, club-like atmosphere that I suppose is evocative of the LA scene. The rooms and facilities however are standard and adequate for business.
