So, on Saturday night I guess some sorority had a function, and some students attended prom at the Sheraton and decided to pull the fire alarm on the 11th FL which caused everyone to wake up at 1:30-2 am. After discovering it was a false alarm the security of the hotel decided that it would be wise to sit by my door and talk with hotel guest while his walkie talkie was sounding. Needless to say, I got no sleep that night! I felt as thought it was college all over again. Lastly, housekeeping comes knocking on your door at 830-9am asking you what time can they clean your room (WTF!!!)! Some ratings give it a 4 star, and I will say no way. Small rooms, bathrooms, sort of outdated, etc.... I wouldnt argue if someone said 3 star, but not a 4 people!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: hovansgroup
Reviews.Content: As it is every time we stay with you, we are always happy with our room and service but in particular, we would like to comment on one of your staff JUAN in the Club Lounge. We have always found him to be polite with exceptional customer focus and service. Juan has always made our visits enjoyable. Well done Juan. Leslie & Val Hovan Sydney, Australia

Reviews.Title: “MIGUEL G IS WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: LPPowers
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were on a business trip to LA and stayed at the Sheraton Gateway for three days. Our meetings were held in the hotel's conference center, therefore, we ate lunch at the Brasserie for convenience. Our first lunch server was Miguel who gave us wonderful service and great food. So wonderful that we decided to go back the next day and ask for Miguel to serve us. Then, on our third day, we visited Miguel yet again for more wonderful service and this time, we brought our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Staff do everything possible for you”
Reviews.Author: MALAWI8386
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with the service I've been receiving from Sheraton and especially, from the Sheraton LAX. The staff at LAX Sheraton put a new spin on the term customer service. From the Club Lounge - where Juan Gomez doesn't just ask if I need anything, but does the tasks of keeping customers like myself happy by picking up plates, refreshing the food station setup, always greeting me, and helping out with luggage - to the Front Desk where staff immediately changed my room because of issue I had, with no questions. The same holds true of the downstairs open air bar where all the staff are courteous, efficient, and friendly. I stay at five star hotels while on business travel in Europeannd I have to say, Sheraton LAX is at the same level of service as many of these same hotels. It's comparable to the service I receive at the Ritz Carlton in Dana Point, CA. Kudos to the staff and to the people who train the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not NEARLY as good as I expected...”
Reviews.Author: KansasCityGuy
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, and after a horrid stay at the Westin a couple of weeks prior, this SPG Gold turning Platinum guest expected it couldn't have been any worse. It wasn't worse, but it wasn't as good as I had hoped. First, check in was average. Two SPG line front desk clerks on the phone, so I waited for a bit at checkin. Got my room, and went up. As reviews indicate bathroom average at best; bed was actually pretty comfy, and the size of the room not bad. Thank goodness for the AC/Fan, as it for the most part drowned out the airplane take off noise. My wake up call assurred to me at checkin never happened...good thing I was up early anyway, and my appointment wasn't until noon that Sunday. Good thing I didn't have a flight. The next morning,I took the shuttle back to the airport, then to Avis to rent my car for the next two days. I drove up to the valet and told him I would check out in an hour, and how much valet was. $10 he said. I asked if there was any self-park, and he said there was, behind the hotel, and the first 2 hours was free. After driving around quite a bit, I finally found the lot, in the paid traveler lot behind the hotel. At check out, an hour later, I asked about the free parking for 2 hours, and if I needed a ticket validated. The front desk stated she did not know, and she did not have to do anything. As I drove out, I was charged $8.25 because I didn't have a white ticket that the valet was supposed to give me! This is unacceptable, and I was quite mad--mad enough that I likely will try the Marriott or Embassy Suites down the street. Very disappointed in this hotel's service and noise. Now, Westin is worse, but as an annual Gold member, this is not the level of experience I am used to.

Reviews.Title: “excellent customer service!!”
Reviews.Author: princessdebbie47
Reviews.Content: I am writing a business review to say I am extremely happy with the service that my company has recieved working with the Sheraton Gateway Los Angeles since Sept 09 -May 2010. Every Saturday and every other Sunday we are here at the Sheraton for business where guests are brought to the sheraton to await there time to go to the port of Los Angeles and the Sheraton provides us this ability and supports us while we are there. They are extremely accomodating and customer service is top notch. I would like to specifically name several people who make this possible. From the top dealing with Elizabeth Equbatsion and Donald Maselli. They are extremely professional and so pleasant to work with if you have catering or banquet or convension needs. The concierge Albert Nobel and also Henry Eustaquios. Excellent . We need them to do faxing for our company when we are there every week and both of them are very professional and extremely helpful and very kind. Staff.. I cant say enough about Roberto. It is a pleasure to see him every week and he always makes sure we have everything we need.. excellent service Agustin Marcelino Carillo Estella All are so helpful. Also the security that they have in the hotel is excellent , the gentlemen (I'm sorry I don't have there names) always come by make sure we are safe and see if we need anything. Any of the circumstances that were a concern for us were handles immediatly and professionally. Overall the Sheraton Gateway Los Angeles Is an Excellent hotel for any business needs and I would highly recommend! Thank you for a great experience! Debbie Andrews Metro Shores

Reviews.Title: “Very Close location to LAX - On Century Blvd.”
Reviews.Author: JQuatt21
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sheraton Gateway LAX. This was my first trip to Los Angeles and I was traveling for business reasons so did not have a choice on where to stay. Here is what I thought about the property: Front Desk Check In: We arrived before the check in time and there was no wait at the front desk. The front desk staff was extremely polite and helpful and checked us into the rooms early because there were extra rooms available. Rooms: The room that I stayed in was a one bedroom standard non-smoking room with a king bed. Each room had a LG flat panel television, iron, ironing board, small recliner chair, and a desk to work on. At the Sheraton, unless you are a SPG (Starwood Preferred Guest Elite Status) member, wi-fi internet access in the rooms is not available free of charge. Wi-FI is available but will be charged to your room. I am not sure what the rate was for Wi-FI in the rooms but downstairs in the lobby area, pay internet was offered by the hotel for a fee of $6.95 for 15 minutes so I would assume that the price points would be similar. The beds were very comfortable and I found the sheets and pillow cases fresh and clean. No problems there. Lobby Area: The Sheraton has a very large lobby bar which was open most of the day into the evening hours. All around the lobby bar area were large contemporary looking benches that had lg flatpanel televisions that were playing various programming such as ESPN, and CNN. The lobby bar area was quite big and could accommodate a large amount of people. Pool Area: The pool at the Sheraton was really nice. Outside, they had tables and chairs set up along side poolside cabanas. Also, there was a hot tub located adjacent to the pool. I did not get a chance to swim in the pool because the weather was too cold at the time of my visit but it looks like a nice area for a quick dip during your stay. Restaurants/Room Service: I did not order room service but the menu did have a wide selection of items to choose from but was a little pricey $$$ for my budget. If you wanted something quick to eat, there is a subway right next store to the hotel. There is also a full service steakhouse located on the lobby level but is also $$$ and did not go into the restaurant. Finally, in the lobby area, there is a small sundry shop in which you could pick up small essentials that you may have forgotten at home as well as snacks, juices and soft drinks, ice cream bars, and small Los Angeles souveniers. The Sheraton is a nice property if you need to find a hotel near LAX which has great shuttle service to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service and resort like atmosphere at a airport location”
Reviews.Author: smpprule
Reviews.Content: In times when the travel industry is lacking in the service department it is refreshing and pleasant to stay at a hotel that has exceptional customer service. Although all employees were very helpful and friendly three standouts were: Antonio (Restaurant breakfast) Frank (Room service ordering) and Whitney (front desk) The atmosphere and design of the hotel is very stylish, calm and comforting. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer care”
Reviews.Author: lordiford
Reviews.Content: I was here for a conference and all staff were extremely attentive and conscientious. Whenever we needed assistance during our conference, even if we made changes (e.g. more food, different delivery time), they were friendly about all requests. I would absolutely recommend for any conferences you may need to schedule! The food was also very good for the lunch they catered. The location is unbeatable. Furthermore, they were having a Wii bowling tournament on Wednesday night and the gentleman running it (I think his name was Eric?) was so friendly and fun! It was almost like I wasn't at work! Downside- I could hear the airplanes when I went to bed, although it wasn't too loud to keep me from sleeping. Also, the bathroom was just mediocre. On the other hand, the bed was fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “OK for airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lavy81
Reviews.Content: I booked this through my company travel agent as I was in the USA for a business trip. LAX was just a stopover so I checked in about 10pm at night and 7am in the morning. For the rate that my company got me, it was quite value for money and reasonable. This is an airport hotel so once you have checked in, the Sheraton Gateway is like any other chain hotel. I suppose I expected more 'personality' and more 'atmosphere' but perhaps it was my expectations that needed to be managed as this is really just an airport hotel. In addition, It was surprising however that my corporate rate didnt include breakfast, esp when I turned up in the morning at the restaurant expecting everything to have been paid for already. The pick up from the airport to the hotel and return was efficient and the wait shouldnt take more than 15 minutes. You have to pay for wi-fi and internet access to your room. I dont really see any differentiation factors between this hotel and any other standard hotel. But for the price that I got, it was fine. If I were at the airport area I might consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “The glass is half full!!!! (Definately not half empty)!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ladams_10
Reviews.Content: I have frequently enjoyed my stays at the Sheraton Gateway, La. It is usually for pleasure. The staff always make you feel welcome and enhances the quality of the visit. In Late December, shortly before Christmas, my daughter required knee surgery that was far more complicated that anticipated. The Staff at the Sheraton,especially Whitney Johnson, who checked us in, turned a somewhat unpleasant situation into one that reassured me of the calibre and high quality of service that has become the norm at that hotel. Everyone was so helpful and empathetic. I felt so helpless , but thanks to their excellent help and professionalism, my glass...during that difficult time became half full rather that half empty. As a matter fo fact...it was overflowing!!! EXCELLENT HOTEL!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great front desk....”
Reviews.Author: flypdx
Reviews.Content: I always appreciate, especially from airport area hotels, when the greeting from the front desk personnel is warm and friendly. The Sheraton has this, great job front desk and kudos to the inhouse IT help that got my computer running.

Reviews.Title: “Still great after 11 stays”
Reviews.Author: biora
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for business and stay frequently at the LAX Sheraton now the Westin down the street has gotten very tired. The service at the Sheraton is great and the food is outstanding. They have a real chef working there which is not common for an airport hotel. It is the best hotel at LAX and I have tried them all.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Gateway is clean, friendly and has everything.”
Reviews.Author: TobyTodd
Reviews.Content: My two teenagers and I spent four days at the Gateway. Prysler was our bellman. He was very helpful with tips on sightseeing and generally getting around L.A. He was very enthusiastic and expressed his appreciation to be able to work there. We received a daily discount if we didn't request our rooms to be made up...which was fine with us. The elevators are fast, the computers very accessible and the front desk helped us with ordering take out with a selection of menus on hand. We will be going back soon, and will DEFINITELY stay here again! It was a beautiful experience!

Reviews.Title: “We got a stomach bug--they were very helpful!”
Reviews.Author: tkline
Reviews.Content: My family of four all got a stomach bug (from friends, not the hotel!), which resulted in us being stuck in our room for 3 days. The hotel staff was extremely helpful, providing us with abundant towels, sheets, etc. as often as needed. Front desk staff called at least once a day to check in and make sure we were doing okay. All in all, a lousy vacation, but the staff at this Sheraton went out of their way to help us out at a tough time. Also a positive--they removed a few phone and internet charges, without my asking. I thought that was an extremely nice gesture. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel! A surprise to end the week with!”
Reviews.Author: pitstop53
Reviews.Content: I finished my business week with this hotel. After a week in Los Angeles I expected the typical rude service we have all become accustom too. The check in process was typical with the young girls into their own world. That passed quickly and I went to my room. The hotel was spotless, the room was spotless and appointed well. The maid was just down the hall and I asked her for an extra coffee. She smiled, spoke broken English and happily helped me with my request. I did eat at this hotel. I was single so I went to the lobby bar for a drink and some dinner. The bar was busy with customers but I did find a seat and hoped I would be noticed. There were 2 bartenders that evening with a full bar of customers. I saw there were several attractive ladies and the immediate thought was, great, now I have to deal with the flirting bartender for service. Again to my surprise they were right on with service. I got my drink a menu and the bartender never lost his rhythm with his conversation. My dinner arrived with-in a reasonable time as well. It wae correct and tasted good too.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and easy place to stay near LAX”
Reviews.Author: zoofamily
Reviews.Content: We had an early flight and didn't want to deal with the traffic in the morning so we stayed the night at the Sheraton Gateway @ LAX. Check-in was easy, check-out was easier! We got a great place to stay and a newspaper, too. The shuttle for the airport was waiting for us when we got downstairs so it couldn't have been easier. We didn't eat there, but they have a restaurant and a Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “As usual the customer service was outstanding”
Reviews.Author: lvdejavu
Reviews.Content: Short distance from airport, easy acess to freeways. Staff is very friendly always willing to help, thanks Beena at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: veronica1030
Reviews.Content: We especially love the location of the hotel. two minutes from lax. The pool area is great. the bar and restaurant service is great. The food is slow to come out but the portions are very desent. pricey but come on, its L.A. The atmosphere is appropriate if you just want to hang out minus bells and whistles. the gym is very well equipped. the staff is always very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Night pre flight”
Reviews.Author: GolfandYogaGirl
Reviews.Content: I am a loyal SPG member which is why the Sheraton was my first choice. I had an early flight and wanted to be close to the airport. I had very little expectation for my experience at the hotel though seeing its proximity to LAX. I was blown away by how friendly, courteous and informative everyone was, even knowing I was merely sleeping at the hotel. It was a wonderful experience and a great way to sleep well my last night in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Personal touch”
Reviews.Author: bholmes7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been coming to the Gateway Sheraton in Los Angeles for more than 10 years. Over the past few years, a number of employees have stood out by providing exceptional service. This includes two Concierge employees who work in the lounge on the 15th floor, Juan and Veronica. They are friendly and professional, always. Two bartenders in the restaurant's bar (Mario and Horatio) went out of their way to make us comfortable during this most recent stay. Both also provided exceptional service and were obviously very experienced and pro's at what they do. One addtional comment relates to Mark, the Food Services manager. Without knowing who he was, he answered several un-related food questions about the hotel and was more than helpful in guiding us to answer our questions. Hat's off to the staff at the Gateway!! Keep up the good work!!! BH

Reviews.Title: “Easy to like”
Reviews.Author: TPitts
Reviews.Content: We arrived 9:30 pm at LAX. The shuttle came in a matter of minutes for the short drive to Sheraton Gateway. The staff at our quick check-in was very curtious and helpful. Our room was large and very clean. The bed ...terrific!! Bathroom shower has great pressure. Our room was extremely quiet. Breakfast the next morning was delicious. Our entire experience with this hotel was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: denealio
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Gateway LAX is a nice little oasis of style in the middle of all the uglyness and tackyness of other LAX hotels and restaurants. Sometimes the bar can be a hotspot, even more now that they added the free Link@Sheraton area with free wifi. On the outside the hotel looks like a typical Sheraton mega-chain, but inside decor is sort of a Southern take on a W hotel for the lobby and public areas. The pool has cabanas and they light candles at night. The hotel has lots of suites, so SPG elite members are treated well here. Rooms are recently remodeled, except for the bathrooms, which are well maintained, but still look late 1970's.

Reviews.Title: “Scaled down ammenities on the weekends”
Reviews.Author: Skydlimit
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel, but they close down the platinum lounge on the weekends. That is not cool, especially since they didn't offer free breakfast in its place.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Colt-135
Reviews.Content: In LA for 3 days for a family funeral. Wanted to stay at LAX the night before early morning departure. surprising great experience!!! Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Gateway is my favorite hotel in the LAX area.”
Reviews.Author: OldRoadWarriorDenver
Reviews.Content: Comfortable bed, good internet access, good restaurant and lobby bar, good exercise facility, reasonable rates, and convenient location--the Sheraton Gateway Los Angeles has everything I look for as a business traveler. I've spent dozens of nights at every other hotel within a few miles of LAX , but the Sheraton Gateway is my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location to Los Angeles Airport”
Reviews.Author: Rosquete
Reviews.Content: Receptionist Paulo? was fantastic when Sheraton lost my reservation Paparazzi Restaurant House bread was served with dried tomato tapenade Nice grilled romaine salad Genovese shrimp with pesto and linguini had an unusual taste Great food presentations Very friendly, but slow, food service Nice wines by the glass Charge for parking Charge for internet

Reviews.Title: “Great airport stopover hotel”
Reviews.Author: srh10
Reviews.Content: Perfect for a long layover at LAX. Comfortable rooms and beds, great staff, lovely pool area, reasonable food prices, Starbucks in the lobby. Staff let me check-out at 6pm - no extra charge. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very average service”
Reviews.Author: Azzrielish
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel as we were going to a concert nearby. We drove up from San Diego with friends and booked two rooms. The hotel was doing repairs on the elevators so it was slow getting to our rooms on the 10th floor, which I would not have worried about except that our keycards did not work and it took three trips to the lobby to get it sorted out - which was a very slow process given the elevator repairs! The room was nice and clean and we also stopped for a drink in the bar before we went out and the bar was quite nice. Where the hotel failed us was in customer service. After we returned to the hotel after the concert (at around 11 pm) the people in the adjoining room made so much noise that we couldnt sleep. After putting up with it for an hour or so we called the lobby to complain but the noise continued. Several more complaint calls and still nothing. At around 4 am after our final call we heard security come up and knock on their door and finally all was quiet. Unfortunately we had to be up at 8 am the next morning as we had plans with our friends. It was disappointing to pay for a hotel room to sleep in when we couldnt get any sleep! I sent a written complaint to the hotel after our stay but did not even get the courtesay of a response. While I understand this was mainly just bad luck on our part in that the people in the adjoining room were very noisey and this may have been a one off event, it certainly has deterred me from ever returning or recommending the hotel. On a side note, the LAX area is not really convenient to anything, so I would only recommend getting a hotel near LAX if you have an early flight out the next day.

Reviews.Title: “If you get a good price why not.”
Reviews.Author: Saintor
Reviews.Content: We used it because it was close to LAX and quite affordable given the level of comfort. In that regard, we were pleased. The view of airplanes landing and taking off was entertaining. Not noisy, surprisingly. We lose time figuring out where to park. The front entry was so crowded that it took us 15-20 minutes just to get the info. The parking behind the hotel is not well advertised and it is a 5-10 minute walk; they prefer that you pay the full parking valet price. In short, the parking arrangements suck. The breakfast is way too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “manager of the hotel did not know what to do”
Reviews.Author: EstherD
Reviews.Content: We missed our flight and received two rooms from the airplane company as per compensation for missing our flight. By mistake the lady at the counter of united gave me only one voucher for the night instead of two vouchers. When we came to the hotel and we explained that we have two rooms they told us to call united and ask them to fax the voucher to them. We were very tired, it was 1am, and I asked the manager if maybe he by himself can call united and ask for this voucher. After 20 minutes wait he came to me and said that he is very sorry, but he couldnt reach any one at united. I think that as a service of the hotel he should have offered us a room and try to get his voucher the next day. .......

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for airport stopover”
Reviews.Author: KGD'sMOM
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here in January, we used the Sheraton inbetween our flights from Toronto to Maui at the beginning and end of our vacation. We really like the sweet sleeper beds and the fact that it is one of the only hotels in the area that has two queen beds was the reason for booking. I kept checking their website and got a rate of $89 for each night. We were upgraded to a suite on the second stay which was nice because we were there longer. Very quiet considering how close to LAX and efficient staff. We ate breakfast at the buffet in the morning and though it was good we paid nearly as much for it as we paid for the room. The shuttle to airport runs on a regular basis and was easy to deal with each time.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing worked”
Reviews.Author: BeaPants
Reviews.Content: Free valet parking was filled so we had to park a block away and walk or pay. The key card machine was broken so we had no key. The air was faulty. Even after being fixed it was muggy in the room. Loved the beds though.

Reviews.Title: “Quite average experience”
Reviews.Author: adeges
Reviews.Content: Having been a bit tired of staying at La Quinta LAX upon arrival, I used HotWire for another LAX hotel before an outbound journey home. Booked a 4-star property priced at $86 including tax. Found it to be Sheraton. You cannot be any closer to LAX than at Sheraton. Is it an advantage or vice versa, I don't know. Upon arrival, we were given a room at the 3rd floor where the noise from hotel A/C was unbearable. Asked for a change and immediately got a room 4 floors above where the noise was easier to come to terms with. The room was quite worn out, with stains on the armchair still not eradicated from better times. Rust on the hairdryer was a funny thing to see at a 4-star hotel. If I'm not mistaken, there was also a quite old TV set. If you're not in the mood to pay $24 valet parking, you should walk a block to nearby LAX public parking and pay some $12 there. No street parking for a mile around. Overall, I would say the hotel was acceptable for the price I paid. Next time though I would look for a better alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Nice LAX Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2worldtravelersnj
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night prior to next day flight, upgraded to suite on 8th floor, had a nice feel to it, kind of like a corner room with bed off to a secluded area and separate seating area. Bathroom was a bit old school and tight where you have to shut to door to use the bowl. It is a shame that these older properties doen't get updated bathrooms because this is all the craze these days! Gym was perfect! Pool looked very inviting as well, didn't need to eat in house as I had access to club lounge, overall this is a nice perperty and I would no doubt stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best in LAX area”
Reviews.Author: phl-kc
Reviews.Content: Just a quick note to reinforce the great operation and service at Sheraton LAX. I have stayed at the Courtyard, Westin, Raddisson and Embassy Suites near LAX and in my opinion, Sheraton is the best by far. Best qualities are the top-notch fitness room for an airport hotel, nice sized rooms and friendly, efficient service. I'm not pleased with the food and beverage operations (low quality and overpriced) but all in all, I usually have a great experience at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property”
Reviews.Author: DonInConnecticut
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. Overall, the property itself is outstanding, some of the staff not so much. It was a Priceline rate that was outstanding, though, and a definite bargain - even with a slightly shirty/indifferent staff. The parking lot was being rebuilt the day we checked in, and there was a LOT of staff confusion about Plan B. One valet told us to park alongside a curb, then his supervisor curtly directed us to move: Lots of attitude from him. Not the usual quality of Sheraton employee. The desk staff was OK - not warm, but in no way hostile, either. Just efficient and perhaps uninterested in dealing with a Priceline customer. That's sometimes the price of a bargain rate. The upside: Rooms are immaculate, modern and fresh. Quality, plush furnishings. Quiet. Lobby is upscale and new. Outstanding pool, hot tub (under an enormous tree) and sun deck - they work hard to achieve a sort of West Coast/European trendy feel, which is no easy matter in an airport hotel. For some reason you've got to walk past the upscale bar/restaurant to get there - ?? The business travelers in suits end up having parades of sunbathers wander past. Oh well. Location is plenty convenient to the airport. Not an easy location if you're a pedestrian - there's nothing much nearby. But a terrific view of LAX's decorative light poles.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel...good service”
Reviews.Author: devonmax123
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights last week in Dec. 2009. Has shuttle from airport. But used rental car, cost $ 24 / night for valet parking (has self park for $ 13/night but farther away and lot is not owned by hotel, not sure it has in/out previleges or not). Recommend Valet for super convenient. Smaller than average hotel room but clean, modern and comfortable beds. Wall-doors are thin. Double panel windows but occasional can hear planes. Very close to airport, pretty much between 2 runways, quiet enough and should not bother your sleep. Great view from higher floor...we stayed at room 1254 (12th floor, facing airport, great views). Free newspapers (USA Today, WallStreet , LA times). Breakfast buffet cost $18.95, average. Great gym .Has Starbuck in lobby. Has gift shop in lobby. Subway sandwich shop across the parking lot...On channel 14 in room tv, has departime plane schedules on it...so you can track your plane schedule before leaving hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: whimsicalwarthog
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had a day lay over in LA coming home from our Mexican vacation. This hotel was fabulous. When we arrived we were exhausted and hungry. Checkin was fast and the rooms were great. The beds were so amazingly comfortable and the linens were as well. From our room we could watch huge jet airplanes land ( the airport is practically across the street) but we could not hear a thing, it was pretty cool Food from room service was delicious but pricey. For coffee lovers there is a Starbucks in the lobby. The hotel is located not to far from Manhattan Beach. You can catch a trolly like bu to the beach and surrouding areas for only three bucks! Great hotel to stay for a day or two!

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and Comfort at Sheraton Gateway LA”
Reviews.Author: Cornucopia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Gateway twice in December 2009, self, wife, daughter and her boyfriend. We liked the bigger than usual rooms, comfortable beds (best anywhere!), convenience to and shuttle connection to LAX and the free broadband (in the lobby), Having a Starbucks on the premises was a bonus. Also, the valet parking was quick and reliable, if a bit expensive..... We couldn't get the in room broadband to work and the IT Help Desk (external to hotel) was on message, so no help!! So I asked the Desk to refund the four day broadband charge I had committed to and they said they did, after I returned home it appeared on my credit card!! Now they're not answering email!! So nice, comfortable, convenient hotel but a shame about the administration!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stop over”
Reviews.Author: jbg7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent an overnight layover at the Sheraton Gateway. We found the hotel to be great for what we needed before continuing on to San Francisco the following day. The staff members at the front counter were friendly enough although I didn't agree with having to pay for short term parking. If we needed it overnight then fair enough but we only needed parking for 4hrs before having to return our rental car. The room was big and very spacious. We used the gym on the ground floor. There were various weight machines and cardio machines. The pool was closed due to maintenance. The main restaurant was closed due to it being a Sunday so we ate at the bar. The food was good and reasonably priced. There was also an endless supply of non alcoholic drinks. In regards to the internet we used the internet on the ground floor which was located next to the bar. It was complementary so I'm not sure why the other review writers were charged. There is a complementary shuttle service to the airport which runs approximately every 20minutes. Because the Sheraton is the last pickup its a direct trip to LAX which takes about 5-10minutes. Overall the Sheraton is a great stopover/layover and I highly recommend it. The only negative I have which doesn't involve the Sheraton is the poor service provided by United Airlines. All I can say is their service in general sux!! I don't recommend as a preferred airline.

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport”
Reviews.Author: missyk311
Reviews.Content: We had a short stop over after a long 20 hour flight. The hotel was clean and comfortable. Close to the airport as we had a 7am flight to New York

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in a Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sungoer
Reviews.Content: This hotel was worth every penny we spent, we found a great deal on PriceLind (US $67 + taxes). We weren't expecting anything great for this price, but were very pleasantly surprised when we got there. We only stayed 1 night on our layover, the air traffic could have been annoying had we been staying there for longer. The rooms were newly decorated, with very comfortable beds, flat screen tv, comfy chairs. The room service was excellent as well, not cheap, but what room service is??!! The food was excellent, with very prompt service.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Makenna09
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel at the end of our American trip for one night before we left to go to Canada. Although the hotel is very close to the airport and they offer a free shuttle service this hotel wasn't up to standard!!! Firstly we were booked in a room and when we got to the door, we opened it and to our horror there was already someone booked in there, so after we got the scare of our lives we went down to reception and all they did was change our rooms!! After this I felt like the hotel was not safe and I was extremely let down and after traveling all day I had had enough. So I let loose, and gave them a peace of my mind! After a 20 minute conversation, the hotel upgraded us to the top floor, and gave us free dinner and free breakfast. Although I was still very annoyed that they booked us into someone elses room, they at least seamed a little sympathetic and the manager was kind enough to offer us the free meals. Even though the location of this hotel is perfect for a quick getaway to the LAX, I would not recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Staff not helpfull”
Reviews.Author: Ash68Australia
Reviews.Content: We stayed only for one night.I made a mistake when booking and booked the wrong date.Which was no issue but the staff member at the desk was very ignorant about it.Just said you have have booked the wrong date then stood silently ,i asked do you have any rooms available for tonight? To which he said yes we have .They then proceeded to charge me twice the price I had originally paid.He did not offer or seem to want to offer any help what so ever.The beds were comfortable. The room was dated and could could use an update.We were on a family vacation and stayed at 7 hotels in 3 weeks.This was the only hotel i could say a negative word about.Once bitten twice shy I will never stay here ar at another sheraton again.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: lowbloodsugar
Reviews.Content: Wish we would have booked this placed for both legs of our trip. Made online mistake of booking the 4points on return part and HATED that place. Had left drivers license in the Gateway room at departure which they saved for over a week and returned to us. This facility is trendy and update with excellent customer service. The lady at the front desk remembered our name from a week prior. There is a Starbucks here and the decore is beautiful. Highly recommend to all!

Reviews.Title: “Decent rooms overall...but service could be better.”
Reviews.Author: jlg22
Reviews.Content: I am originally from Los Angeles but I am currently living overseas. I booked this hotel for about 5 nights during my summer vacation when I came back home for a visit. I booked this hotel through Hotwire, so I didn't know which hotel I would be staying in until I entered my credit card info and paid. It said 4 star hotel, but in reality the hotel itself was more of a 3 star hotel with 2 star service. However I only paid about $80/night for the room and I think the self service parking was like $12 a day or something like that. The room itself was pretty good, with large bed and contemporary furniture. One of the few problems I had with the room was the bathtub. As other reviewers have mentioned, there was the problem of slow water drainage and the tub was a little chipped around the drain. The other problem was that there was a door that separated my room to the room next door, and you could hear the family next door with their noisy kids, whenever they were in their room. Other than those things, I was generally satisfied with the room itself. However, the main problem was the service. At the front desk, the staff seemed a bit aloof and unprofessional at times. Quite frankly, some of them (even though they were dressed professionally) spoke and acted a bit "ghetto" and it seems like they weren't trained in proper etiquette. That wasn't the main issue though. The main problem was that I had requested a small fridge to be sent to my room 3 times. The first 2 times, I had called the front desk and they told me it would be there in 30 minutes. 1.5 hours later...no fridge. SO I called again and spoke to the same guy and he sounded surprised that it hadn't come yet and said he would call maintenance to see what was going on. Another 30 minutes passed by and nothing. So I went outside my room and saw one of the housekeeping ladies and explained to her my problem. She was really nice and on a walkie talkie informed another man of my problem, and within about 15 minutes, they had brought up the fridge and set it up. So, the housekeeping and maintenance people did a good job, but the "unprofessional/ghetto" front desk person didn't. I think he was just being lazy. I wonder who hired that guy and I'm guessing their criteria for hiring hotel staff must be quite low. The hotel itself was just ok. The pool could have been in better condition, and the fitness room was being renovated, so the temporary fitness room was tiny. The elevators do shake a bit. The only other comment I have was of the shuttle driver. He was a really nice and funny man. I think he must have been Latino and I forgot his name, but he made the trip from the airport to the hotel very fun. I hope they pay him well. However, I think the shuttle is not just for the Sheraton hotel but for other hotels in the area as well. But overall, for $80/night it was a decent value I think. It could've been a lot worse.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: BBuddy
Reviews.Content: We landed at LAX at 11ish, and being from the east coast I figured that I really didn't want to drive to a hotel in West Hollywood still on east coast time so I booked a stay at the Sheraton Gateway for one night. It was a great stopover. After collecting our luggage it was a very quick trip on a shuttle provided at the airport right to the hotel. Check in was incredibly quick and we were in our 3rd floor room. The view wasn't great but we were only staying one night so it didn't matter. Starwood hotels are our favorites so this was an easy pick. The bed was super comfortable. The only complaint I had, was that the bathroom was kind of dark especially if you were in the shower with the curtain closed. The hotel has a super workout facility with lots of treadmills and elipiticals and weight machines and dumbells. One of the things that I noticed right away (and something I was concerned about) was the noise from the airport since we were so close. It was never a problem for us. We couldn't hear any planes coming OR going so it never interupted our sleep. Check out was at noon so we got up early and picked up our rental and was all ready to being our vacation fully refreshed.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: HotMama168
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze. Done in 2 min. Room is as pictured. Bathroom was cramped, not newly remodeled as the room, but it was ok for 1 night. Toiletries were nice and were Bliss products. Service was great and had absolutely no problems. We got to use the business center to print out our boarding passes for Jet Blue the next day. I'd stay there again. It was perfect for a layover for us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice unexpected night”
Reviews.Author: Me9247
Reviews.Content: My husband did not expect to stay at this Sheraton. Our flight was post poned 24 hours and the airline put us up in this hotel. I usually enjoy Starwood properties and this Sheraton was no different. This one actually felt more like a W than a Sheraton to me. The room was clean and in working order. Two chairs, a table, a desk, and a king size bed. (A standard room.) The workout room had many cardio machines, weight machines as well as free weights. There is a small pool. Since it was raining we did not get to experience the pool but note all the restaurants in the hotel look out on to the pool. My only complaint with the hotel is the service in the restaurants. The night we arrived we ate at the bar. The food was ok once it arrived. My husband ordered a burger and I a salad. My salad came out 25 minutes after his burger. There was nothing on my salad that needed to be cooked. The next morning we eat in the only open restaurant. There was a breakfast buffet. We were asked when we were seated what we wanted to drink with our buffet. I wanted juice and my husband coffee. When I got back from the buffet my juice was on the table. My husband asked again for coffee but it never arrived. When they gave us the check the coffee was on the bill. We said it never arrived we did not plan to pay for it. They made us feel like we had done something wrong. The food wasn’t great but ok. Plan to pay for it though since it is hotel food pricing. Since the airline pick up the room, I can not speak to value. The location is extremely close to LAX. The shuttle service was prompt and clean. The driver even helped us with our bags. If we find ourselves in need of a hotel in the LAX area again we will probably stay but eat somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A high quality business/airport hotel - one of the very best"”
Reviews.Author: calflyer80
Reviews.Content: I found this to be a high quality business/airport hotel. The positives include the shuttle service from/to the airport; the effecient staff; room quality; computer access in the lobby; and very comfortable and modern rooms. Of particular note of excellance was the restaurant bar. Exceptional food and drinks presented by a friendly staff. Be certain to try the happy hour specials. I found nothing negative about this property and would certainly stay again. I have stayed at nearly every hotel on the Century Blvd airport strip. I would have to stay, based on this stay of two days, that the Sheraton Gateway is the overall best.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant for stop overs!”
Reviews.Author: charliegirl_b
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over night between 2 late night flights. We arrived at LAX around midnight and the shuttle arrived after about a 10 minute wait. The entire flight crew from our flight jumped on the shuttle with us and we all headed to the Sheraton Gateway. The lobby is very nice with comfy chairs and a sophisticated feel to it. We checked in straight away and were given a room on the 9th floor. We headed to bed as soon as we got to the room, however when we tried to turn on the A/C we couldnt get it to work. I rang down to reception to see if there was a trick and they offered to send some one from maintenance up. He was there within 5 minutes and for roughly 10 minutes attempted to fix it. He then said he would have to move us to another room and quickly rang down to reception and found out that the room next door was empty. He let us in to the room and offered to help us move of things. He turned on the A/C for us and then arranged for a porter to bring up the new room keys for us. It was all very organised and very friendly. We had a brilliant nights sleep in a wonderfully comfortable and huge bed and woke up watching the planes landing at LAX. We couldnt hear a sound as they landed but it was great to watch them. We had breakfast at the subway down the road and then checked out. The hotel held our luggage and we brought tickets for the Ocean Express shuttle which leaves from just outside the hotel and takes you to the beach and 2 shopping centres for $3 each return. We thought the hotel was great and would throughly recommend it for stop overs.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, good value, good location, all round great!”
Reviews.Author: kadamoli
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Gateway at Lax following a trip back to LA. We had a 17 hour flight with a 3 year old, so checked into the hotel after the flight, to get some sleep before seeing friends and family. The shuttle was fast , check in quick, really good room, 2 great queen beds, nice bedding, and good sized room. I was worried about the noise being so close to the airport, but it was fine. Used the pool briefly next day, nice, clean and relaxed. USed the Starbucks in the lobby, but slow, and pricey but nothing major. We did order room service and it was crazy price, they charged for delivery, tex, room service, and I think we paid nearly $60 for 1 kids snack, salad and burger, and maybe 1 soft drink. I think this is the way the hotels around the airport make thier money, from tired hungry guests. Luckily I got a good price on the hotel and was all round happy, just might be good idea to pick up food outside, (not their is much close) and the airport is expensive. I would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Groked
Reviews.Content: At the same price of other hotels in the area, the Sheraton offered a much nicer room and amenities. I will put it as my first choice the next time I return.

Reviews.Title: “Barely acceptable . . .”
Reviews.Author: Pausanias
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Gateway was chosen for us by our cruise line, Noble Caledonia, and certainly wasn’t the place we would have chosen. It’s a typical soulless chain hotel, convenient to the airport and that’s about the best one can say for it. Our room, on the 7th floor, had a view over the runways and decor that might have been modern were it not for the dreadful darkwood monster cabinet that dominated the room yet held only a flatscreen TV. What an eyesore and what a waste of space! The bathroom was straight from the 1970s. As there isn’t even a fast food joint within easy walking distance, we tried their own steakhouse and that was a huge mistake - they botched up a main course, managed an all-time low for a Caesar Salad (no dressing at all, dried-up chicken) and topped it off with lethargic service. Breakfast was a slight improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to rest your head”
Reviews.Author: form2
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a spot to rest your head that is conveniently located near LAX. The Sheraton is it. You can't go wrong it's literally one of the last hotels before the airport entrance. i've been missing a lot of flights lately. So this time around I wanted to be sure that my friend and I would be right next to the action without having to actually sleep at the airport. It was a good decision. There are so many hotels located near LAX they might as well put up some casinos and make it like Las Vegas. I thought Sheraton would just be a run of the mill standard corporate hotel (which it is) but it is also well kept, has a friendly staff, upgraded rooms, and very unexpectedly comfortable beds! Considering it's geographic location near the airport it was safe for me to assume we would be hearing a lot of air traffic, but no sound could be heard from the outside. Now that's a hotel you wouldn't mind having a layover in.

Reviews.Title: “Great value on Priceline--less than $60 before fees”
Reviews.Author: usd2busmc
Reviews.Content: Great room, easy check-in, and a short walk to Budget Rental. Comparable to the Renessiance. Check in easy, and was not made to feel like a cheapo even though I booked through third party reservation.

Reviews.Title: “So nice that I couldn't believe it was an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: skipsterNewYork
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise the Sheraton Gateway LAX is. Got the room on Priceline for about $65 for an overnight before flying out early the following morning. I always benchmark hotels on whether or not I would have been satisfied if the rate had been higher and I say yes! The accommodations were much more valuable than what we were lucky enough to pay. Although the room furnishings (carpet, chair, armoire) could use replacement, the bed and bath were quite nice. In fact my family and I checked in early enough in the afternoon where we were able to use the beautiful pool area located on site. Compliments to the team at this property for keeping it up so nicely. If I need to overnight at LAX again, or am on business and staying at LAX, this will now be the hotel of choice. There is only one criticism--which is not really the hotel's fault---if you are a family on a budget there is absolutely no place to eat in walking distance except for maybe Subway or Burger King.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and amazing staff - - I was sorry to leave!”
Reviews.Author: Pamz-on-the-road
Reviews.Content: I wound up here because I was changing planes and needed a spot close to the airport. What a great find! From the van driver to the front desk clerk to the restaurant servers to the phone operators, EVERYONE who works here was fabulous. The room was lovely, clean and bright, and breakfast in the restaurant was wonderful. This is the kind of place that business travelers dream of. I was sorry to have to leave, but wouldn't hesitate to stay here again for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “All you expect and more from Sheraton!”
Reviews.Author: ForeverYoung50
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about as close as you can get to LA airport! It is 1st class all the way. Well appointed, spacious rooms offering every comfort and style. Our room had a nice view over the city at sunset and it was the perfect place for weary travellers to relax for the night, ahead of an early morning flight the next day. We could order a meal at the bar and take it back to our room and though only burgers and fries, it was fine. There was a complimentary airport shuttle from the hotel in the morning and all major car rental companies are in the vicinity for those wanting a car. If you want to be close to the airport for that early morning flight, then this is where you want to stay! Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Greate hotel near the airport”
Reviews.Author: TravelPort101
Reviews.Content: My first Impression was not positive at the Sheraton Gateway. When we pulled up to the hotel the valet Attendant asked me to move the vehicle after I got out of the vehicle and was preparing to unload our luggage. ( I was the only one in the area) This was annoying. He should have flagged me to drive into another area or lane, instead of waiting for me to get out of the vehicle. The hotel is very close to the LA airport. Valet parking is an extra cost as well as Internet access. The reservation desk was quick and courteous and had an upgraded room prepared in advance, (one of the fastest check-in to date) the room was a semi suite which is a larger then your standard room and updated to include a plasma screen and contemporary design. The bed was very comfortable; I thought I was at a Westin. Overall, the room and hotel was clean and comfortable. Room service was prompt, but we had to wash the coffee cups to remove brown spots. I would give this place 5 out of 5 if we did not experience the annoying valet or the dirty coffee cups.

Reviews.Title: “One night for lay over”
Reviews.Author: Browns_Wifey
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here on our way back from our honeymoon. Our flight from Miami didn't get in LAX until 11:30pm so we stayed at the Sheraton until our flight back home the next day. The room was perfect!! The most comfortable hotel bed I've EVER slept in!!!! and I've slept in many hotel beds. I mean the BEST!!! They even had normal size pillows, unlike some hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for one night airpot overnight”
Reviews.Author: GreenCardWedding
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on priceline (given hotel after they accepted my bid). We arrived at 3am after a 3 hour flight delay from Boston. The shuttle brought us right to the hotel and the girl at check in took one look at us and said we could have a 2pm late check out. The room was enormous w/a very comfy king bed and lounge suite. It smelled a little smoky although the whole floor was nonsmoking. We had a really neat view of the airport so watched planes land in the mroning while having a coffee. It was very very quiet in the room. We checked out the next day for our international flight. I was overnight there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but.....”
Reviews.Author: holltmarie2009
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful! It looks so big and fancy inside. The lounge area is so comfy. The bar is big and the pool is clean, But there are some things that need to be changed. The room is supplied with bottled water but be sure not to drink it or you will pay $5 for it. The drinks at the bar are so expensive. I paid $12 for a margarita. The pool is very shallow. I think they need to clean out the jaccuzzi out once in awhile, The Wi Fi is not free in your room but free in the lobby. It didnt make much sense but ok. Also the maids come to clean your room so early!!! But everyone was polite and nice. The pool is open ;ate and the view is beautiful!!

Reviews.Title: “All in all a great hotel; conveniently located--GREAT BEDS”
Reviews.Author: brownman
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel that is centrally located. The lobby is big and has free Wi-Fi and a full service Starbucks. We booked on Priceline and got the same service as everyone else. The staff was super friendly and we even parked our car out in front while we checked in and took our bags to our room. The valet held our keys for us. We checked in about 11 AM with no problem and no line. As someone mentioned, the elevators are slow because the two elevator banks are not connected so you have to hit the button on both elevators. This means that during almost every elevator ride, the elevator opens up without anyone getting on. Use the 3 elevator bank as we found that to be the fastest. Our room was on the 10th floor and we had a view of the LAX parking lots. We heard some plane noise but it was not disturbing. The beds were so comfortable. The bathroom is a bit small and needs renovation but it did the job. The one thing that we all noticed was that the room was very dusty. It looks like the cleaning staff doesn't dust the rooms. I walked by a cleaning cart and it did not have a duster. Parking is an issue. $24 for the valet parking but there is free parking along 98th street directly behind the hotel. There's a two hour limit 8 AM - Midnight. So effectively you can park from 10 PM to 10 AM without moving your car. The parking is right outside of Easy Park-LAX‎ so it's safe but the street fills up quickly. You can park in the Easy Park-LAX‎. We found this to be convenient and it's just across the street from the hotel. We almost always found parking in the first couple rows. Tell them that you are a guest at the hotel and you can pre-pay for about $13/day with in/out privileges. The area is really safe. I even got back past 1 AM one night without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “I Could Live There It Was So Nice!”
Reviews.Author: trvlr2008
Reviews.Content: The room was so awesome, one could live there quite comfortably...king bed, dining table, living area, study area and huge bathroom. The robe in the closet was a nice touch. The decor was modern, yet very comfortable. Had a view of the airport runway - not a disturbing sound to be heard! Room service was impeccable - butler training?? And the food was very good. Shula's was great also. Wish I had an opportunity to spend time in the pool area as the cabanas were very inviting. The bell staff and concierge were great - the best impression of a hotel. Four people could have spent a great deal of time in there without being in each other's way. Next time I'll need to bring my family. Worth much more than the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Convenient Location - No in-room Safe though.”
Reviews.Author: SydneyShane
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights at the end of a recent trip and were pleasantly surprised. Great decor in the hotel, very modern ... So LA.... The express line for SPG members was great.. The room was big and funishings new, we had a fantastic view overlooking the airport and runways and out over the iconic LAX sign which changes colours. The bed was super comfortable. One big disappointment is that there was no in-room safe. I hate this especially because you are staying somwhere where you have no idea who will be accessing your room while you arent there.. . That aside, there is a well equipped, (pay per millisecond of use) business centre and a cool pool area to hang out if you are lucky enough to have the notorious "marine layer" of fog burn off in the afternoon. If you will be going to and from the hotel quite frequently . You can avoid the extortionist valet parking rates - ( and having to tip the valet each time) by using the self park facility at the back of the hotel. $13 a day I think it was. There is also a star bucks in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good, but the executive lounge was overpriced”
Reviews.Author: DMenist
Reviews.Content: This was a very pleasent hotel. Parking is somewhat difficult and as we all know if you get a ticket in l.a., its gonna cost big $$$ We were on the 11th floor. We had access to the executive lounge which was pretty sad, but they forgot to bill us (hahaha) There was only one heated food item beef, pork, or fish. They had a big lcd t.v. (in the lounge) and various food items (still in the lounge) My only problem with the lounge was the fact that the attendent was on a guest computer the whole friggen time. Otherwise it was very convieniently near the airport with a shuttle

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Leesw8
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night before leaving from LAX. I had stayed at various hotels in the LAX area over the past few years and this was by far the most comfortable. I booked on Priceline for around $80 including tax and service charges, so it was a great deal. Parking was pricey at $24 for valet, but by far the easiest option. The suite was very comfortable and clean - it was just what we needed. Didn't try the bar and restaurant, but there is a full Starbucks in the lobby. Free wireless access in the lobby but not in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: RobMichelle
Reviews.Content: I really liked the location for my son (14 years old) and I to go to all of the sights including Santa Monica, Hollywood, Orange County. We were upgraded to a club level room and the free breakfast was light, but very good. Overall, the staff made the hotel a pleasant place to be for four days. Parking was expensive, as usual in LA. Booked on Priceline for $66 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Sutter
Reviews.Content: At just under $75, including taxes, from Priceline, we felt the room was a good deal. Room large enough and comfortable. We did not rent a car until the next day (walked a mile to Hertz rather than relying on shuttles), so did not have to content with high parking fee. We arrived late and were glad the lobby /bar was still open and serving food (and not just snacks) at 1 a.m. Only breakfast option, apart from the main restaurant, was a Starbucks. I did hear some aircraft and auto traffic noise from our room in the morning, but nothing major (my wife heard nothing). Not sure if the beds were as comfortable as those at the nearby Hilton but the price was better, at least by using Priceline. We waited perhaps 5 minutes for the hotel shuttle at LAX at midnight. You do need to look carefully, since many shuttles are shared by several hotels; you might find one bus serving 3 different hotels so you need to look carefully at the electronic signs. This hotel is one of the very closest to the hotel entrance.

Reviews.Title: “convient for ongoing flights”
Reviews.Author: Deb70
Reviews.Content: Rooms a good size, clean, room service not very good could not understand I wanted slippers they bought sugar. good size gym, internet expensive being $5.95 for 30minutes. courtesy shuttle to airport, we usually stay at Embassy suites North which I think would still stay there again as alot more room and breakfast and managers drinks but have to shop around. Starbucks in the hotel made the best coffee I had in the time I was in america. We told the girl as well.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay in LAX.”
Reviews.Author: Ellemay
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel due to being SPG members and wanting a hotel close to the airport. Check-in – Everything went accordingly to plan. However, on entering our suite the room was incredibly dark and gloomy. We rang reception and asked whether we could have another suite. They were very accommodating and happy to please without any dramas. Room – Our “new “ suite 659 was enormous with a generous lounge room with sofa couches, coffee table, working desk and TV cabinet. The king size bed was slightly off to the side with good views of the airport and was exceptionally comfortable with big fluffy pillows. The bathroom was normal size with shower over the bath and a good vanity unit. Facilities – There is a shuttle bus that goes to the airport every 10 minutes. A excellent outdoor swimming pool with plenty of comfortable deck chairs. There are plenty of taxi’s available if you want to escape into town or down to the local Manhattan Beach. (which we did..) Restaurants – We had dinner at Shula’s 347 and had a lovely steak meal with attentive staff. We also enjoyed a quick lunch at the Brassiere Restaurant which was okay too. Overall : An excellent Airport Hotel with superb facilities, staff and rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good location....it does the job”
Reviews.Author: davlynski
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a couple of times between skiing in CA and a trip to Cuba. Compact rooms, reasonable food, a good pool....everything went smoothly. Regular shuttles to LAX. It's hard to get excited about an airport hotel, but the Sheraton does the job well.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very good service, clean room, good price”
Reviews.Author: trinitron436
Reviews.Content: It's an older hotel (like most in the LAX area) but they've done some improvements since I was last there including new bedding and plasma tv's in my room. Looks like they're doing some work in the lobby too. The Shula's restaurant is expensive but I got a decent meal at the bar the following night. Very convenient to LAX and less expensive than the Marriott and Westin. All in all, a decent airport hotel that seems to be trying to get better.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely poor”
Reviews.Author: Ray Goldberg
Reviews.Content: Smelly dirty rooms. Decor needs serious upgrading. Restaurant seriously overpriced and over rated. $12.95 for slow Internet. Overpriced and would no way recommend staying. Look elsewhere unless this is $50 a night

Reviews.Title: “Valet parking employee theft...”
Reviews.Author: jrzyshawn
Reviews.Content: I know I should not have left anything of value in the car, but I forgot. I just simply forgot. I inadvertently left a digital camera in the glove box, a closed glove box when I parked the car and when I checked for it in the morning it was gone. .. I notified the Manager who in turn referred me to the Supervisor for the valets. I filled out a claim form with them and received a letter telling me, too bad for you. We are not responsible for items left in the vehicle. I know this is something I could have avoided, but I just forgot it in the glove box. I am furious that the valets are rifling though guest’s cars and opening the glove box looking for items to pilferage. For what it’s worth, I once dropped my wallet in a rental car in Las Vegas and did not realize it. The valet that parked the car found it and notified the front desk who in turn notified me. This guy could have robbed me like the employees at the Sheraton LAX, but he did not and he was rewarded for his honesty. So just a heads up for everyone traveling to the Sheraton LAX and valet parking a car with them. BE AWARE. If you accidently leave anything of value in the vehicle, even if it is out of plain sight, they may search the vehicle and steel from the people that help ensure they receive a paycheck. Needless to say, I am don’t giving my business to the Sheraton LAX when I am in L.A. from now on. I should have noted that when speaking with the parking manager/supervisor, he indicated this is a common problem they have among their parking staff and was not surprised that it happened. He even seemed to know just which employee parked the vehicle possibly had stolen the item. Hey Sheraton LAX, I hope that $150 camera was worth all the lost business that myself and my colleagues will now be giving to other hotels when we need to stay at LAX

Reviews.Title: “A bit dissapointed with the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Marjol
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night at the end of our two week trip in California. We booked the hotel through priceline for $60 a night, excl. tax. It was the only 4 star hotel during our trip. Check in was easy. We got a room on the third floor. The room was big enough, the bed was comfortable, but the carpet was worn and there was a big red stain on it... There also were some clothes left in the closet, which I thought was pretty strange. The bathroom was very small, not what we would have expected from a 4 star hotel. We had a fine night without any airport noise, but were a bit dissapointed with this 4 star hotel, which looked more like a 2,5 or max. 3 starhotel to us. We preferred the 3.5 star Crowne Plaza we stayed on the first night.

Reviews.Title: “They must have bought the last two stars”
Reviews.Author: mirrorshirt
Reviews.Content: This place does not deserve 4 stars. The room we have is a disappointment. It is so dated and the restroom is dirty. Everything is so expensive. They charge $4.50 for a bottle of water that is worth $1 and they tack on two extra kickbacks to themselves for room service. The food at the bar was taken from cardboard boxes and microwaved and then marked up 800%. My understanding is that a four star hotel is supposed to be nice but this isn't. The hallways look like those in the movie "the shining". It is a 2 star hotel that has connections with someone on a rating board somewhere so they purchased the extra 2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Dependable and Convenient to LAX!”
Reviews.Author: WestCoastTripMaster
Reviews.Content: I can't believe all the people who diss this place. Are we talking about the same hotel here? I have been staying at this hotel for several years now whenever I fly in or out of LAX. It is super close to all the terminals, and I have found the hotel shuttle to be, likewise, super convenient. I have always had pleasant and efficient service at the check-in desk. The staff has always been great at accommodating any of my requests. Parking has always been easy - valet works well for me as does the self-park behind the hotel. I've never had a bad experience with either. Restaurants and bar are really good for in-hotel dining. My rooms and bathrooms have always been clean, the beds comfortable, and room service has been great. For my needs, this hotel has always been my "sure bet" to make entrances and exits from LAX a more restful and pleasant experience. Now many of my friends do the same thing I do. We live a two hour drive from the airport and having the Sheraton Gateway there to remove some of the stress of traveling has been a wonderful thing. No, it isn't a resort or super fancy hotel - it caters to the business traveler - and, in my opinion, it does a great job for its niche and for a super reasonable price. I think it really gives a great value. If I want super-duper fancy or deluxe, or a more social hotspot, I'll go stay at a resort somewhere. When I stay at LAX I'm focused on my flights and how to make my getting to and from them convenient and less stressful. This hotel and its employees have consistently done exactly what I've wanted and needed for years. So far, never a bad experience for me. Only good ones.

Reviews.Title: “What a contrast!”
Reviews.Author: redhand
Reviews.Content: In January we stayed at the Sheraton Hotel, Heathrow. It was old, drab and 5 years over due a make over. By contrast, and for much the same price, the Sheraton Gateway is modern, fresh, spacious double bedded room and all the facilities you require for a comfortable, relaxing stay. If you check my review history you will see that I rarely award 5 stars but I really could not fault this property. Starwood have work to do to standardise their properties. They could do worse than use the Sheraton Gateway as their benchmark.

Reviews.Title: “There are better options”
Reviews.Author: tickettoride
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson the week before,the Marriott a couple of years ago (and was satisfied) but partner booked this place for 40 dollars more so I was expecting more. The look of this hotel is minimalist not plush.Lots of pilots staying there. The room was noisy as it faced the runway!! I needed a certain store but the concierge sent us on a wild goose chase to Manhattan Beach.On top of it he denied it.I reported it to the manager and he was great.There are better optionsfor the money.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for price deal”
Reviews.Author: mydogrules
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights while attending conference down the street in a different hotel. Clean spacious, well appointed rooms. Why do these hotels around the LA still charge $12 a day for wireless internet? Got good deal on room, paid first night regular price got 2nd night half price. Shuttle service to and from airport. Lots of staff in lobby to answer any questions. Parking not on site unless you do valet at $24/night, otherwise have to park behind hotel across street in a long term park n fly lot. Flat screen tvs were a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Not a property expecting you to come back”
Reviews.Author: Stevied888
Reviews.Content: This property does not really honor Starwood Preferred Guest program. No PSG floor or lounge no extras provided at other properties. Room was nice but the rest of the property was very average. I defy you to find out how to get to the pool. There also was no hottub with the pool. Menu selection at the restaurants was limited. The reason to stay here is for proximity to the airport but that is it. There are much nicer Starwood properties in the Los Angeles area.

Reviews.Title: “Just Average”
Reviews.Author: DavidHaup
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sheraton Gateway airport due to meeting near airport. Would not stay there again as I am sure there are better alternatives. Everything was just average. While the staff were friendly, they were not all that sharp. ordered room service and asked for wake up call and communication was not great. Hotel is right next to airport and you can hear planes all night long, room vibrates. also disappointing to have to pay $11 for internet access. should be free. Elevators require you to press button on both sides to wat for elevator and this results in stopping on many floors unnecesarily on way down. No restaurants within walking. firness center was good. Bathrrom door awkwardly bumps up against toilet making it incolvenient to go in and out, poor architecture on that one. All in all staff tried but I would not stay again. I find Marriotts to be consistently better than Sheratons. will try Marriott Manhattan beach next time

Reviews.Title: “Rude Front Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: mhynes
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were very disappointed with the hole experience at the Sheraton Gateway Hotel in Los Angelas. We have been at several Sheraton hotels over the years and were generally happy with the accommodations and service. This time we were disappointed. I work as an Airport Planner and I requested a high floor in order to view the arrival of airplanes right outside the window. We arrived late and we recieved a room on the 3rd floor opening up onto the top floor of a part of the hotel. In front of us stood this massive heating vent that blocked our view. I was very upset with the room. By this time it was 11:30 PM and we did not want to request a room change. Secondly, once we arrive from the Airport we come up to the front desk and I say good evening and that we just arrived from the airport and are very tired. I ask the front desk clerk whether she can tell me how long will it take to get to Santa Monica Pier and what would be the cost by cab from this hotel. Her answer - I don't know. Second question, do you know whether their is transit that can be used to get there. Answer - I don't know. She said go ask the bellhop who was not there. This in my opinion was very bad service.

Reviews.Title: “Alright for airport, wouldn't stay otherwise”
Reviews.Author: Honeym00ner_86
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely getting on. The room seemed a bit dated and the shower was horrible. The room itself was comfortable however. The parking here is confusing - it seems like the only way to park is to valet park which is annoying as we would prefer to park ourselves. It was okay for the night before the airport, but would only stay here for this reason.

Reviews.Title: “Slowly Going Down Hill”
Reviews.Author: Johnc4pa
Reviews.Content: This used to be one of the better airport hotels. It isn't anymore. The first change that I really don't like is the airport shuttle is shared with other hotels. What this now provides you is a longer wait for the shuttle and when it does arrive it is full. After waiting to go back to LAX the hotel staff told me they had no control when it would come and taxis are available for $20 (for a 2 minute ride). The staff here has also become less than pleasant, even in the platinum lounge. You know it's bad when you give them a tip & they don't even smile or acknowledge you the next day. Many of the reviews here comment on the slow elevators, so I will just say a five minute wait to get to the lobby is typical here. I ate at the hotel bar each night and the food was very inconsistent, even for the same meal. BBQ shrimp was good one night, lousy the next. I do think the rooms here are pretty good. Flat panel TV with a good selection of channels. Given all the negatives, I would only consider this hotel again if I could get it for under $100 a night.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Gateway to the Gateway to the East (LAX)”
Reviews.Author: snowyphile
Reviews.Content: There is a shuttle to the terminals, and the rooms are quiet and reasonably clean. There is a nice outdoor pool, suitable for swimming laps, which one accesses through the fitness center (the latter looks good).

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly mediocre”
Reviews.Author: nycthing
Reviews.Content: This hotel has its pluses and negatives - if you set your expectations real low, you will be pleasantly surprised. It is a factory built for conventions and the lobby and restaurants will be filled with people wearing badges. You are clearly an afterthought here as a single traveler not part of the group. That said, the room is quite nice and a good sized. I often stay in the LAX area as it is convenient to visit various parts of LA where I have friends and family. The parking situation is a mess - be sure to ask for an in-and-out pass when you arrive or you will keep paying. The management of that place (it is not run by the hotel) is a mess and if I return I would park at one of the many nearby airport parking lots. In summary, a very nice room, a good location and generally good value if you get a rate below $150. Convention oriented factory that does not offer personalized service in any way. You can make your own decision.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice near LAX”
Reviews.Author: fenwayman
Reviews.Content: I usually stay that the Sheraton Gateway by LAX if I get a good rate, which I usually can find. I find the hotel consistently pleasant. My most recent stay I arrived around 1 PM worried that I would not have a room available, but the clerk was able to find one for me ("the room we set aside for you is not ready, but I am sure we can find one for you now".) She was friendly, asked me if I wanted a wake-up call, help with bags, etc. Very nice welcome. The room was facing the airport and I could see planes land and take off, but it was well sound proofed. Great bed and linen. Great water pressure in the bathroom. I don't think there were many other guests that night because there was absolutely no hallway noise. The fitness center here is a bit larger than you usually find, with several cardio machines, a rack of dumbells, two benches, and a small machine with pullies. Very nice. Bell service was excellent. I had to leave the hotel to run to the Hilton in the morning to get a rental car. I explained that I needed to leave the bag for "about a half hour". When I returned with the car and got out, they recognized me and brought the bag out without my having to enter the hotel. I was impressed.

Reviews.Title: “disappoitnig for a sheraton”
Reviews.Author: prada777
Reviews.Content: This property should be ashamed to charge for the old, worn out rooms..particularly the bathrooms which have mold and peeling bathtubs in every room I have stayed in recently. The furniture is dirty, (stained chairs-yuk, unclean desk tops, and really grungy small bathrooms that have tubs that are chipped), and the carpeting often stained. The Sheraton company should be ashamed to have this hotel using the name as a franchise. Avoid at all costs. In addtition, airplane crews receive all the priority treatment, including getting on the shuttle before even disabled passengers! I guess if you work for an airline it is an okay place to stay.
