In need of major physical renovation in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great rate... until you add it up”
Reviews.Author: traci_9
Reviews.Content: I booked our reservation through continental.com to get the miles credit and received a pretty good rate. We checked in rather late after visiting Disneyland all day and was greeted at the desk by a not so friendly attendent. When asked where to park our car, he informed me they had valet. I told him I'd like to self park and he seem offended that I didn't want to valet park. He abruptly told me I needed to park behind the building - and that was that. We drove around the block and found what we hoped was the right parking lot - and then proceeded to drag our luggage around the block tothe front of the building - all the back doors were locked as it was late at night and our key cards would not open the doors! (Needless to say we didn't think of unloading while we were up front... wish we had). The room was nice and comfortable, but the charges for the internet were outrageous - especially on top of paying to park. When I checked out the next day the girl at the desk wasn't much nicer. Didn't even get a thank you. I assume maybe because the rate I got was so cheap? I don't know - but I won't come back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Has Changed Hands and Deteriorated”
Reviews.Author: Dawgz529
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel previously and was generally quite satisfied with the room and service. Not so this time. The hotel recently changed hands (it's a franchise from Sheraton) and apparently the new owners have embarked on some cost cutting measures that have really caused the hotel to go downhill fast. The food has gone from generally excellent to barely passable; the room was not as clean and crisp as before; the wait time for room service has gone way up; when calling the front desk I had to try twice for a total of 18 rings for someone to pick up. In addition, they no longer run their own shuttle but use a pool shuttle that's not nearly as convenient as the old one. It's also clear from the attitude of the employees that something is amiss. What a disappointment. I'll be looking elsewhere for a stay at LAX next time.

Reviews.Title: “Paid for Parking!??”
Reviews.Author: seanlall
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is almost right next doors to LA International Airport (LAX) with a free shuttle and that is why we chose it. We were flabbergasted that we had to pay for parking. About $12 for Self Parking which is about 3-4 minutes away from the front or $24 for Valet Parking. Never paid for parking while staying at any hotel before. Wish we were informed in advance. Room was ok. Had to pay for internet. Front Desk was mostly indifferent, but not rude. Elevators were very slow but are being renovated. Would not recommend other than proximity and convenience for the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Gateway LAX”
Reviews.Author: Lauri W
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights on business/pleasure in Dec. Weekend rates were great...$109/night. They ended up giving me those rates during the week too. Probably because the pool was down and they were rennovating a set of elevators so had to use service elevators...not becoming of a 4 star hotel. They do have a 4 star restaurant...Shula's. Not quite kid friendly or budget friendly but the wait staff was great to look at! They had a breakfast/lunch restaurant on premisis but did not frequent. Requested and got a room close to elevators which is always nice at a hotel this size. Saved my walking for what really counted...Hollywood! Nice clean place, helpful staff. Great for the money! Their shuttle was very timely both to and from airport. Parking expensive and a few blocks from hotel so I just rented a car for one day and returned it that night...to a nearby Enterprise location that is very near this hotel. The Enterprise shuttle actually dropped me off at the hotel because they went past it, which saved me shuttle time from the airport. Probably wouldn't have stayed at this place if the business portion of the trip wasn't held there. I really wanted to stay at Eco Lodge because I heard there were more restaurants over there plus I could get a smoking room, but this worked out.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price, make sure to get it cheap”
Reviews.Author: peanut118
Reviews.Content: We booked our room through priceline for $60 a night on priceline, had I paid more I would have been disapointed but for that price it was worth saving the extra money in these tough times. Valet parking was $25 but well worth it if you are going to be in and out a bunch. The rooms were older and we had to move rooms due to the heat not working and the sink being clogged in our first room. In the second room everything worked fine but the shower seemed to have mildew or soap scum in both rooms. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and that alone with the starbucks in the lobby were the highlights of this hotel. If you are looking for someplace cheap to crash for the night, this place is it, if you are looking for more I would stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for overnight lay-over at LAX”
Reviews.Author: stephdunne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during a lay-over from Seattle to Puerto Vallarta. We landed in LAX at 11:00p and caught the hotel's shuttle to the hotel. The hotel's shuttle automatically runs outside the baggage claim areas every 15 minutes 24 hours per day, so need to call anyone to get picked up. The ride to the hotel is about 5 minutes, so super convenient especially when arriving late or leaving early. We didn't try any of the hotel services since we arrived so late and left so early. The room was comfortable, as expected at a Sheraton. There is a Starbuck's in the lobby of the hotel, which is also convenient for an early morning start.

Reviews.Title: “Best Airport Hotel Bar None”
Reviews.Author: GlendaleCA
Reviews.Content: This is the BEST airport hotel property I have ever stayed at. There is almost nothing to do around LAX, very few restaurants, bars, fun things to do. So if you have to be there for a nite before you leave town, this is the best hotel to stay at. By far! The vibe feels almost European, maybe b/c several of the front desk people are, maybe because of the very sleek feeling of the hotel. I feel more like I am in the downtown of a fun city than at an airport area with nothing going on. Front desk is always helpful, and the lobby is always abuzz. Always, and in a good way. There are some very hip, cool chairs in the lobby bar area, and they are always full. The rooms are nicely updated. Try and get a room where you are facing the runways. It is pretty cool. By the way there are often very good prices at this location. Do not bother with staying at the Westin, which often is a more upscale Starwood brand. This is a MUCH better overall hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest experience”
Reviews.Author: jayjazz
Reviews.Content: I was there over the weekend for a conference for my job. Had I payed my own money, I would have been very disappointed. For starters there was very little hot water in the morning. So having to get up to a cold shower every morning was not that pleasant. Next, the public elevators were not working so you had to ride the service elevators with the employees. Also the service elevators were only running one at a time; so most of the time you were waiting anywhere from 3-5 minutes to get on an elevator that wasn't packed with patrons as well as employees. That was very uncomfortable considering that there were sometimes where I had to ride the elevator with the wait staff who had just cleared off tables of dirty dishes or the cleaning staff who had loads of soiled linens; not cool. Furthermore, the bathroom in my room was extemely small. If I was there with my wife and child we would have had a hard time making it work. The rooms are not family friendly at all, and the bathtub was pealing. However,the beds and pillows were great, they were the best things about the room itself. The cleaning staff was exellent as well as the wait staff when we had our meals. I like the access that the hotel gives you to the Trolley so that you can go down to Manhattan Beach. Also, the Los Angeles by Night tour was awesome!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Los Angeles by Night”
Reviews.Author: jasonw8
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights over the weekend for a conference. Had my company not paid for the room, I would have had major issues. It was also my first trip to LA so the excitement allowed me to overlook some inconveniences. First, I would avoid this hotel until the elevators are updated. The main elevators are not working and the hotel suggests the service elevators. So we rode for four days with the soiled linen cart and the guy who cleans up after room service. Sloooooow elevators. Next, the room did not have hot water in the mornings. Hot was not a problem in the evening, but the early morning hours produced room temperature at best. The bathrooms should certainly be updated. On a positive note, the housekeeping and hotel wait staff were outstanding. Concierge were invaluable. Make sure you take the LA by Night tour. The concierge will book you for $55. They'll pick you up/drop you off at the hotel. If possible, go on a Sunday evening, as the traffic is almost non-existent. Also, take the $3 trolley from the hotel to Manhattan Beach. Awesome. Eat fish tacos at WAHOOS.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel near airport”
Reviews.Author: grothman
Reviews.Content: So its right next to the airport so you can hear the planes obviously. I'm not quite sure how to describe the style of the hotel..its like it was on the cutting edge in the early 90s and the decorating is still ok but some things have fallen into disrepair like the textured wallpaper in the bathroom etc. It was a good change though from a traditional boring looking room. Valet parking was quick...i think it was $25/night for me. didn't eat there but i noticed they had a nice open bar. If you have to return a rental car, there are plenty of places nearby to fillup gas. Leaving the hotel you can't just take a left, you have to go down the street and somehow figure out how to turn around...i never found a place so i had to go through the airport to get back to century blvd going the opposite way..still it only took me 5 mins to get to Hertz. I would stay there again but i'd prefer a new or newly renovated property first.

Reviews.Title: “Red Light Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nieblax
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice within 2 weeks at this hotel and had 2 complete different experience. We book thru hotwire and paid $99 taxes in. The rooms were clean and the location is great for people coming in and out of the airport. There is also a trolley that can take you to Manhanttan Beach or some shopping malls for $3 round trip. Pretty decent. Our first experience was decent, professional staff, clean rooms.. However, our second experience.. What a nightmare. They had a "covention" of Rough Riders Bikers. They almost fill the entire hotel. People were yelling and partying all night.. Apparently, we were the only one on our floor not invited to the party. People knocked on our door ALL night (litterally we had to get up at 4:30 am to catch our flight and there were 4 people sitting in the hallway envoying another drink next to our room door.) We should have thought it would turned out this way when we saw police cars parked in front of the hotel when we checked in.. When we checked out, there was only 1 employee in the lobby and clearly he looked at uncomfortable as us... We saw prostitute in the lobby (it was not hidden - remember - we were intrudes into their "convention"), people driking from their Vodka bottles... Really, we could not get our of there fast enough... BEWARE... If that is the kind of group they want to rent their hotel too... They should let other customers know uo front what is to be expected for the week... The poor clerk at the lobby wanted to leave with us.. NOTHING in this hotel was under control.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a transit stop”
Reviews.Author: ozitravlr
Reviews.Content: Hotel is showing its age, which is why reviews are mixed. Our room was OK, clean - though seemed a bit musty. The usual comfy Sheraton bed, important in a transit stop. Quiet, curtains darkened the room effectively. A/C not very efficient. Limited toiletries supplied, nice orange fragrance though. No safe. Usual coffeemaker, ironing board. Slow elevators, cigarette smell in corridors. Pool looked pleasant. Limited restaurant options on site. We ate at Shula's which was average - very slow service, waiter forgot part of our order, my beef tips sandwich was cold (but my husband liked his steak). Left early so cannot comment on breakfast options. Wouldn't stay here for sightseeing, but does the job for a transit stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Pinaki
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night. It is close to the airport and easy to find. The room was excellent value for less than $100 with a large comfortable room. Staff were freindly and very efficient. We would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Spot”
Reviews.Author: NeverUnpacked
Reviews.Content: Based on previous reviews I made a mental checklist on things to look for: Isolated location? I didn't see any convenient places within walking distance. If you're going elsewhere to eat, be prepared to drive or make a substantial walk. It also seems like there are no other people around unless they're in their cars. Parking ? Yes, $13 out back, $24 valet. Thanks for the warning. I can understand why someone might be uncomfortable walking from the back lot (see above). I felt okay, but I'm sure my wife would have reservations if she were alone. Staff? Check in and out was quick and convenient, the front desk staff I dealt with was friendly and informative and even the cleaning people acknowledged us and were friendly. Elevator problems? We didn't have any problems, but we were amused at the warning signs and the printed explanation in the hotel information packet. Yes, it's a long term problem. Chipped bathtub? Sure, there they are. It didn't affect the operation, but with the repairs and old tiles, it almost felt like you stepped into a different level of room to shower. Hair in the drain? None, but I have a headful of my own, if needed. The bathroom, as well as the rest of the room, was very clean. The location was convenient for us because it was just a few blocks from the rental car center and our plans to explore the coast to the north of town (Santa Barbara) as well as south (Orange Coast). We had a late arrival and early departure, so being near the airport helped with time. We got back fairly late one night and had appetizers in Shula's, which were very good. Also, our package included the breakfast buffet. Since it was included, I forgot to note the price, but we were very pleased with the quality, selection and attention of the staff. The pool area was very nice and there were families using it most of the time that we were there. I didn't have a chance to check out the exercise facility. We were pleased with our experience as everything went off without a glitch. Based on this stay and, for a reasonable price, we'd stay here again and not discourage anyone from trying it.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Wellingtonian
Reviews.Content: i got a good rate on priceline which was just as well because the rack rate would have been extortionate for the state of the bathroom and services. The bathroom was dirty; far more water came out of the tap than out of the showerhead on the shower setting; the water did not drain from the tub. Yuk. The "pinstripe" dark decor is depressing. The pool was nice early in the morning but in the afternoon there was a corporate function going on and since it's a small pool area it wasn't really inviting for an informal swim. Most of the lifts didn't work -- it took about 15 minutes to get down. The concierge sighed when I wanted to buy a stamp. The room service food was, as expected, overpriced and ridiculously salty. I wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Experience”
Reviews.Author: ILoveTheSun2008
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal through Hotwire. Very nice hotel - nice rooms, good breakfast, decent outdoor pool, handy for airport. We did however encounter a few problems 1) the free shuttle bus from the airport dropped us at the far end of the airport parking lot - a few minutes walk from the lobby - with 2 young children and 4 large cases this was not a good start! 2) the room we were assigned had not been serviced - beds not made, plate of food thrown across the floor, dirty bathroom - you get the picture. 3) Elevators slow, as some of them were out of order so getting back to reception after getting the unserviced room took a while 4) - and this was my biggest problem - the attitude of the front desk staff when reporting the unserviced bedroom - not a word of apology and no manners. Don't get me wrong - we enjoyed our stay and feel that we were just unlucky with the room, but I feel the front desk staff let the hotel down - I would have been very disappointed if we had paid the full rate.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to LAX”
Reviews.Author: heiranig
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel near LAX. It's reasonably priced (through Hotwire), comfortable, clean and most of all convenient with a 24hr shuttle running every 15-20mn to/from LAX. Would stay there anytime we need to catch a plane

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: 14clubs
Reviews.Content: We stayed the last night before flying home because we wanted to be close to airport to avoid any potential traffic problems getting to the airport on time. The price at Hotwire was amazing. Even after paying for valet parking, it was still cheaper than going even slightly further away for a Courtyard, Embassy, etc. Not sure what's up with the elevator problem. They have a laminated sign by the elevator banks apologizing and offering the service elevators as alternates. This sounds like a near permanent issue vs a slight fix. Didn't cause us any issues. Room was very nice on the 11th floor. Airport noise was not like being at the end of the runway with your windows open. Subtle and you almost had to be listening for it. Did not interfere with conversation, TV, and most importantly, sleep. Friendly efficient staff. In room coffee was single cup Starbucks. If you have two people and both drink regular, check to see what you have. We had one regular, one decaf.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Experience at Sheraton Gateway LAX”
Reviews.Author: GojyoChan
Reviews.Content: First let me say, for the price I paid via Hotwire.com, this was an excellent deal! For the level of hotel, the price was hard to beat. Also, the decor of the hotel fits my personal style and so I loved the feel of the place. The bar was awesome and Shula's 347 restaurant inside the hotel was amazing (pricey, but amazing)! The beds are super comfy and the pool area was very nice too, the location was great since our vacation had us traveling all over the LA area. That being said there are some definite problems with this hotel, in fact, if I was someone who could afford their normal room rates, I would absolutely think this hotel was the pits! First, there is NO FREE PARKING whatsoever. That's pretty normal for Los Angeles but the Valet at the Sheraton is the biggest rip off I've ever heard of in my entire life! It's around $25.00 if you valet over 15 minutes!!!! If you elect to self park, it's $13.20 per night. Make sure you add that on top of your room rate when budgeting your vacation. The hotel messed up my bill which added insult to injury, they failed to charge me for my hotel bar tab but then charged me for a week of valet parking I didn't use. When I tried to fix the issue and was honest about not being charged for the bar tab, they blamed me and I had to deal with three different people to get it fixed. The bathrooms are a bit scuzzy considering the rest of the hotel and the TV's need to be updated. Also, it appears they have been having elevator issues for a long time now with only 2 of the 6 working so you have to take the service elevator. The brasserie for breakfast is overpriced and the service is super slow, I was shocked how bad it was in comparison to Shula's the night before. I recommend avoiding a handicapped accessable room as well. I would probably stay here again but It would have to be an even better deal than the one I got. It left our vacation on a sour note due to the billing issues and the price gouging parking issues. Just be prepared for what you're getting into.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eric2321
Reviews.Content: This is a very good airport hotel. There are 3 negative issues that are consistently mentioned in reviews here. Everything else seems random and subject to personal preferences. 1. ELEVATORS: are a real problem. Consistently did not stop at the 12th floor to pick me up on the way down. Had to get on any elevator that was heading "up" since it would not stop again on the way down. Very long waits at times. Housekeeping staff kindly let us use their elevator a couple times. 2. PARKING: $24 for valet, $12 for self-park. Self-park lot is behind the hotel across the street. This is a 5-10 minute walk in relative dark at night. Shuttle to parking lot is inconsistent. Can park on street behind hotel but you might get a ticket during day. 3. INTERNET FEES: $10.95 per day. True that internet is free in the lobby area (which is quite large). Otherwise, the hotel is fine. Beds are comfortable and room was clean. I can't figure out how anyone can stay at an airport hotel and then complain about hearing airplanes?! Bring earplugs or noise machine. Color scheme? Yes, kind of dark but this shouldn't ruin your stay! Long check-in line? I checked in very quickly. I noticed going through the lobby that there usually was no waiting at the desk, but a couple of times there was a line; that seems normal to me. This hotel is about as close as you can get to the airport. Would stay there again but would check to see if there is improvement with the elevators first.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 4-star. 3 stars is pushing it.”
Reviews.Author: Metanoia
Reviews.Content: Overall, this was not a 4-star hotel as reported by Hotwire.com. First, when you walk in, you just feel like there's just something WRONG with this hotel. The lobby was dark, uninviting, and had uncomfortable furniture all around with bad loungy techno music playing. The hallways leading the rooms didn't match the motif of the lobby and rooms, which was definitely jarring. The rooms were small, the bathrooms were old and the tub was cracking and peeling, and the tiles were moldy. Water was not complimentary (as it should be for a 4-star) and the in-room coffee was horrid (Maxwell House!). The elevators weren't working either, 3 of 5 main elevators were out of service and we had to ride the service elevators along with the dirty linens and room service leftovers. Some guests even reported up to 30-minute wait times for the main elevators, as only some of the staff were notifying people about the elevator problem. Obviously, the hotel knew about the problem as there was a letter in the service elevator apologizing for the inconvenience. I would definitely not stay at this hotel again for what I paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton does good at LAX”
Reviews.Author: CSwan
Reviews.Content: It's a good hotel. Period. I don't critique the front desk, bell-hops, porters, valet etc. at hotels because I typically don't interact with them for more than a few minutes during my entire stay so I don't let them affect my review of the room. If they go above and beyond, then I usually make a note to say something (to them and in these reviews). My reviews usually deal with the nuts and bolts. The Gateway is what you would expect a large chain hotel near a major airport to be - busy. The lobby has been re-modeled with mod furniture and is a comfortable place to lounge/work/meet for drinks. And, do not fear, it has it's own Starbucks. The rooms are for the most part spacious but the bath rooms are a little small. Speaking of the bathrooms, mine (on the 14th floor) could use a little updating and a new tub (it had some missing paint), however, I'm only in there to shower and get moving, so it didn't really bother me. Back to the rooms - comfortable bed, good work desk, average t.v. (it's 2008, let's make with the flat screen already!). I couldn't tell you about wi-fi costs or speed as I have my own card. And I sure can't tell you about eating at the hotel, because I have a car and there are plenty of decent places to eat within a 5 mile radius. The hotel is close to a CPK and their in house choices are Shula's Steakhouse - think Ruth Chris - and The Brasserie (continental?). Don't forget, I mentioned the on-premise Starbucks. If you book this room through priceline, you're getting a steal, if you book it through Sheraton for $250 or under you should be happy (higher tier chain in a large city) and you better be a SPG member so you can get the points. One last reminder - this hotel is basically at the airport and situated close to the north side runway so you will hear planes taking off and landing day and night. It's not too noisy, but you can hear them. Earplugs can easily solve the noise situation.

Reviews.Title: “good clean quality safe stay near the airport”
Reviews.Author: heathrowterminal3
Reviews.Content: Just what you would expect from Sheraton. A nice clean hotel with plenty of room. The room was very nice and super comfortable bed. The only thing I could find that wasn't top notch was the bathroom tile and shower head could use a clean or replacement. But that is honestly the worse that I can say and it wan't a big deal at all! I just love a clean bathroom! The amenities were nice and there was a free shuttle to and from the airport and free wi fi. Breakfast wasn't a total rip off and had a large selection of premade stuff. I was perfect for a night to get over the jetlag!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: mmmfajitas
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights as a single traveller. I checked in at 2am and it was really quick and easy, my room was on the 14th floor and had two double beds, tv & writing desk and a coffee maker with Starbucks coffee, i found it quite spacious. I didn't have breakfast in the lounge but did take full advantage of the Starbucks in the lobby and there's a small shop onsite for snacks too. In the evening i ate in the bar area which seemed understaffed but the waitress kept acknowledging me and the food was good. Really nice pool area. during the day i travelled by getting collected by a tour bus and one day i got a taxi to santa monica, it cost 50dollars, i discovered the blue bus could take me straight back for 75cents so i did that. The walk from the bus station (10mins) was pretty isolated and there were quite a few homeless people around though but i felt safe enough. The only criticism is there really is nothing around the hotel area to do but all in all i had a great stay at teh Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: calgaryGirl25
Reviews.Content: Because we booked through hotwire we thought we were getting only one bed. The person on the phone for Sheraton was rude but the people at the Gateway were really nice and getting two beds was no problem. Getting to and from the airport was great and getting the metro or santa monica buses near the hotel was easy. The beds were a bit hard and there was something up with the bathtub but overall a very nice hotel with great food.

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough”
Reviews.Author: coronadoexplorer
Reviews.Content: If you are in town to see several different areas of LA, this location is relatively convenient. However, there is nowhere to walk from here for dining or entertainment purposes. The room was clean and spacious enough for our needs. The main restaurant serves a decent buffet breakfast but the items ordered off the menu leave a bit to be desired. Staff was friendly but overall they seemed a bit short staffed. Our key stopped working an hour and a half before check-out. This, in addition to the parking (an airport surface lot located behind the building where the nearest space you can find is sure to be the last one, approx. $13.00 per day) was the only complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Thumping still in my head”
Reviews.Author: lanceralot
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over the 4th of July weekend. When we arrived on the 4th, music was blaring at the swimming pool and could be heard across the lobby. When we got to our room on the 8th floor, the room was facing the pool and we were dismayed to find that we could heard the music from up there. Given that it was 4th of July, we thought...oh well, maybe this was a rare event and the manager had indicated that it'd be over at 8pm. The music kept going past 8pm and into 9pm. We didn't complain. Sunday afternoon comes around and they threw another party at the pool and the music was just blaring again. When I asked, the manager said it'd be over at 7pm. At 7:15pm, the thumping was just too much, so I called the front desk to ask when the music would be over, the front desk said 8pm. I decided enough was enough and went down to change our room. The manager said, oh it'll be over by 7:30pm. I said you can't entertain partygoers at the expense of disrupting an entire side of the hotel! Finally I got a new room facing the other way. I could hear the roar of the airplanes, but that was expected and I'd take that over the constant thumping any day. Room wise, it was ok. The bed slumped in the center and the shower/tub is in need of a renewal. The caulking were moldy and the stainless steel bars had rust streaks running down into the tub.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & comfy”
Reviews.Author: Fab50Mom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night (from NH) before a cruise. Very comfortable bed. Restaurant was nice & not too pricey (for LA). Rented a car to see some of LA, definitely need one. No place close to walk here. Use the valet parking. It's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room”
Reviews.Author: ann12172
Reviews.Content: I love staying at Sheraton hotels. This one was no different except for a few things: they do not tell you that you have to pay for parking (an extra$15/day, or valet for, I think $24). The parking lot was in the back of the hotel so it was pretty far. Luckily, the weather was nice. The interiors of the hotel were very nice: a little gift shop, a starbucks, nice rooms...bathroom too! Staff were nice. Like always, my room key didn't work at one point and I had to go all the way downstairs to get it reloaded. The concierge person took the time do it for me instead of having to wait in the line with the people needing to check in. I did not like that Sheraton would not let me add points to my rewards card though because I booked through Hotwire. The hotel is also very close to the airport (they have a shuttle)...so I could definitely hear airplane noise...not so bad though. Location wise, it was a pretty far drive to every where we had to go though. That sucked. L.A. traffic is bad.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel very near the airport”
Reviews.Author: Bzhpq
Reviews.Content: For anybody having a very early morning flight out of LA this is a very good choice. The (free) shuttle ride to the airport is about 5 minutes and there is shuttle at least every 20 minutes. But coming in at LAX I was confused by the way you board hotel shuttles. You have to go designated areas on the sidewalk and flag down the shuttle from your hotel. The hotel itself was clean and so was the room. Nothing bad to say.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But Extra Charges Were Annoying”
Reviews.Author: lilmisstex713
Reviews.Content: My 9 year old daughter and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in March. I booked on Hotwire and got a good deal. We went to the Los Angeles area for her Spring Break. This hotel is very close to the airport which ended up being very convenient for us because our flight didn’t arrive in LA until 11pm and that is 1pm Houston time. By the time we got our luggage and then picked up our rental car we didn’t get to the hotel until around 1am which is 3am Houston time. I would not have wanted to be driving all over the place at 3am looking for my hotel (we passed this hotel on the way to get our rental car so I knew exactly where to go back to.) This hotel is not within walking distance of many tourist sites but no hotel is within walking distance of all the tourist sites in the LA area since they are all spread out. We went to Universal Studios, Santa Monica Pier, Venice Beach, Hollywood, Beverly Hills, and the Hollywood Forever Cemetery while out there this trip and none of it was really that far. Thankfully our rental car had a GPS device in it so we never got lost. Also traffic wasn’t as bad as people make it out to be. If anyone thinks LA is bad try driving in Houston…. At least California has banned the use of hand held cell devices while driving and I really think that has helped their traffic situation. I wish Texas would do the same. The room was large enough, our A/C worked very well, there was plenty of hot water, and I didn’t really hear any noise. You can hear the occasional rumble of planes taking off but its not something that bothered me. Also I didnt hear any noise from other guests. I sleep with ear plugs in so noise is a non issue for me anyway. The hotel has a heated pool and my daughter got in that one evening. It was chilly and she said the water temp was perfect. I didn’t care for the fact that the hotel charges $25 a day to park your vehicle. Its valet parking and they do have self parking (for $6-$9 a day, cant remember for sure) but its located in the back of the hotel and I would not have felt safe walking alone at night with my 9 year old from where it was located at. It would have been a very dark walk. The hotel also charged per day for internet access which is annoying but most hotels with star rating charge for internet access. I think it was either $9 or $15 for a 24 hour period. There are not any restaurants around this hotel but there are some just up the road. I did not try the onsite restaurant so I have no idea how that is. Also beware when making u-turns on the road in front of the hotel. I got a ticket for making an “illegal” u-turn there.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: TexasTravelerAustin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a 12-hour layover at LAX. Worth the cost for solid sleep, use of fitness center and a shower! I slept most of the time so I didn't explore the hotel but I will say my room was huge with a king bed and a queen sleeper sofa in a sitting area around the corner. Very masculine decoration. Bathroom was kind of small for such a big room, but had great water pressure and towels were thick and soft. Fitness center opens to the pool and gets a nice breeze, and the equipment has TVs and fans for comfort. One strange thing is that the fitness center didn't have any dumbbells under 25 lbs. Hmm. Has a starbucks in the lobby, very convenient. Shuttle to airport was very prompt. Overall pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty extra charges”
Reviews.Author: petefrommaui
Reviews.Content: The overall experience was very satisfactory, airport pickup was perfect, room was clean, the concierge was very helpful, but there was a $10.95 surcharge for in room internet and a charge of $ 2.00 per international calling card call. The telephone charge card in the room mentioned a $ 2.00 charge for the first 60 minutes and 10 cents/minute thereafter, but did not mention the $ 2.00 per call charge. I feel that a 4 star hotel should not need to nickel and dime it's guests in this way.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasently Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Irwish
Reviews.Content: I was concerned once I found out that I had got this hotel from Hotwire. I read reviews on the hotel and I was afraid I had been had by the 4 star rating Hotwire had given the Sheraton. The checkin went smoothly and I was off to my room. The desk person promised me the room would be quiet My room is large, nicely appointed, and has a wonderful bed. The only downside was the tub, which had a bad refinishing job done to it at some point. There were a few hairs in the tub but more than likely they came from the room attendent. By the way the room was quiet except for a little airplane noise. Downsides; To use the phone in the room is very expensive and the $10.95 for the internet is unacceptable in the day of free internet in most hotels. If you are looking for a nice room at a fair price for the location this is not a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4-star. A dull 3-star.”
Reviews.Author: bdt61
Reviews.Content: Location was my first instinct, the Sheraton was less than 5 miles from work for the week-end of Memorial day. This particular need was fulfilled. however a very dull 3- star would be more fitting of a rating. There was never any hot water. Granted , I enjoy a hot, hot shower. It was warm, yes but never hot. We showered early and late in the evening as well as middle afternoon, hot water temperature availability never changed : warm. The rooms were clean, on the small side for a Sheraton. Self park, a nice walk, good for the digestion, 10 to 15 mn, depending where you could find parking. There was a shuttle to lot, if you have the luxury of time. I was there on business. The keys had to be changed twice, they simply stopped working, back to the counter to be rekeyed. Personnel helpful, friendly and professional. All around from luggage to front desk and all else. No where to eat truly. we had to tackle the long dark walk to the lot for dinner. Perhaps for an away flight, this an adequate choice. A 3 -day business trip, no. Too many inconveniences.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay”
Reviews.Author: okop
Reviews.Content: Myself and a buddy were in Palm Springs for some golfing and stayed here for one night after dropping off the rental car. Arrived and got checked in quickly. As a plat member I was upgraded to the club floor. Arrived onto the club floor and floors were dirty and just the overall feel was not very clean. Got to our room and found the colors very warm but dull ?? greys. maybe to hide the dirtiness - Although the bed sheets seemed very clean the bathroom was in dire need of upgrades and repairs. For a club room this bathroom had mold all over the shower area; shower head coming out of the wall and the shower itself was so low that you had to bend down to have a proper shower ? Checked out the club lounge for breaky......pretty lame and ended up going downstairs for breakfast. Not a vending machine in the place or anywhere for that matter to get any munchies.......I was told if I was hungry to order room service ? I just wanted a bag of chips or something. Had a few drinks in the lounge. No problems. Not a bad place but definately not a place that sticks out in my mind. As a starwood member I think the next time I am in the area I will check out the Westin down the street and see if it is any better.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't say it's quite 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Beautifulvocalist
Reviews.Content: First of all, I booked this hotel through Hotwire and it was given a four star rating for this airport hotel. I had a four day stay in the Los Angeles area and wanted it close to the airport. Once there I was informed of the $24 a day for valet parking or self park in the back of the hotel in an airport parking lot. Which cost us roughly $13 a day to park and you had to walk a distance to get back to the hotel. I never saw the shuttle to take us back to the hotel. This was a bit of an inconvenience but nevertheless we had no choice. For the most part i had a decent experience. I was not in the hotel long enough to enjoy any of the amenities. Check in went smoothly and the concierge was helpful. As far as the rooms go I was not really impressed (1063). It was a bit small.. outdated televisions, bathroom needs attention. It was small and, they seem to have problems with the tubs not being clean enough and chipping paint. Otherwise it was and okay experience and I would visit again, but I wouldn't say it is quite a 4 star hotel, maybe 3.5.

Reviews.Title: “Walls Very Thin!”
Reviews.Author: Mark049
Reviews.Content: All things started out well here at the Sheraton Gateway outside of the LA Airport. Check-in was fine and when we requested a discount they provided one. When we got to the room it was nice. Relatively clean and bed was comfortable. At this point we were quite pleased with the hotel. The problem began around 2am when the persons in the neighboring room returned. Four young men who were obviously wanting to have a fun evening and were under the influence. I don't fault the young men for wanting to have a good time and being loud can be part of that. I do, however, expect the hotel walls to be thick enough to resist some sound. The walls were paper thin and it was as if the young men next door were in bed with us talking and laughing. Things went from bad to worse when they started singing badly(at around 4:30am). I am glad they had a good time, but we did not. My wife and I are frequent travelers and are not very finiky, but we have stayed at Motel 6's with thicker walls. We will not stay here ever again and will now avoid Sheraton Hotels in general.

Reviews.Title: “Good for what ii is”
Reviews.Author: TOfamily269
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night to start our vacation and another on the end of our vacation. Rooms are not big but have been updated, althougth they didn't do complete job on the bathrooms. Check in was easy. Shuttle seemed to take longer to pick up on arrive, but it was at the end of a long day. We left at 5:30 am and shullte was waiting there. Pool area looked great for an airport hotel. Wouldn't suggest it for an extended stay but was good for an airport hotel. Starbucks in the lobby was handy too!

Reviews.Title: “discusting things growing in the tub”
Reviews.Author: KrmiNetherlands
Reviews.Content: Friendly reception, room luxury, but discusting things growing in the tub. Nasty bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “convenient to airport, but inconsiderate”
Reviews.Author: edwardratcox
Reviews.Content: We only needed a place to sleep for an overnight layover. The location was very convenient to LAX, but finding the shuttle bus was ridiculous. After 20 minutes we hailed a cab only to discover it was just a few blocks away. When we checked in, we reiterated our request for a cot and were told it would be there in 15 minutes. An hour later, my daughter was fast asleep in our bed and we called down to cancel the cot. Not a restful sleep at all. No one even bothered to apologize for the inconvenience. One weird thing that happened was the elevators had a mind of their own. There was a guy trapped on there with me who told me he stays in this hotel a few times a year and the elevators have been flakey like that every time he does.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: RL-TX
Reviews.Content: I wanted to update my previous review which was pretty good/neutral about this hotel. I have now stayed here quite a bit on business travel and would now say it's a bit inconsistent. First of all, if you can book with a Starwood preferred number, you're going to get a better room. I neglected to do so a few times and ended up getting rooms that smelled like they had *just* been smoked in - floor 4 BTW. I went down and asked for a different room and they've always been helpful and switched it immediately, while reminding me that it's a non-smoking hotel. If that's the case, then they have some serious fumigating to do in a couple rooms. I like this hotel - I'm sure most of the rooms are fine, they have good customer service and a great breakfast buffet in the morning - but I'm just saying...

Reviews.Title: “Good for airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: MattNY
Reviews.Content: On our way to Hawaii, leaving NYC at night, we needed a place for a few hours at LAX until we could catch the morning flight to Honolulu. For $116, this wasn't a bad option and they have a good shuttle to and from the airport being so close. When we checked in, they were friendly and even upgraded us to a small suite. Nice big room, but I cannot understand why they still had an old tv instead of a flat panel. The old tv was at an odd angle and distance from the bed and made watching in bed difficult. The only problem is that we got a room that connected next door, and at 1am, we had to call downstairs to have them call the guy to ask him to lower the tv (was watching some church sermon very loudly). Otherwise, it was great for what we used it for.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: MattJHB
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in April 2008. Check in was fast and friendly and my room on the 9th floor was great. I was originally in another room which had a noisy aircon and I was moved as soon as I called the front desk. The rooms are tastefully decorated and are very comfortable. The beds are fantastically comfortable. Room service was quick. Breakfast the nect morning was very good. The hotel deserves it's star rating, and my only complaint is the parking - you can either valet your car at enormous expense or park at a general airport parking lot behind the hotel, which isn't cheap either. People may feel uncomfortable walking around behind the hotel alone at night. Would I stay there again? Yes. It's a great hotel witn comfortable facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brian_Toronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Gateway by LAX in late March/08. The hotel shuttle is excellent. Check-in was wonderful. We stayed on the club floor. The room was large and not to over-crowded with furniture. The lobby is nice and the outdoor pool is very nice. There's a free shuttle bus that takes you from the hotel to Manhattan Beach area (very nice area)...about a 20 minute ride.

Reviews.Title: “Far from a four star experience”
Reviews.Author: KonaW
Reviews.Content: This hotel looses points for both service and room quality. I would not stay there again and would not recommend it to a friend. My assistant booked my room through hotwire and requested a 4 star hotel in West Los Angeles. I am familiar with the airport location but was hopeful that the Sheraton would infact be a 4 star experience. The lobby is beautiful and the valets very nice. However, it took 20min to check in and there was only 1 person ahead of us. I was told that I couldn't record the stay on my Starwood perfered account because it was booked through Hotwire. The room was above a very noisy airconditioner unit. I figured that was probably what booking with Hotwore is all about. But inspite of location, I would still expect a clean tastefully appointed room. Unfortunately I recieved netiher. The bathroom was dirty with a severely chipped and stained bathtub. The room and bedding generally dinghy (579). I attempted to call the front desk after 15min of the phone ringing I was moved to another room (518) the second was dirtier than the first, dirty glasses, severely chipped, mildewed and rusted shower/tub combo, black hairs in the tub and on the toilet. Unfortunately, I was late for a dinner reservation and could not wait anouther 40min to change rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: peacewalker
Reviews.Content: This Sheraton is right close to the airport - perfect for layovers - which is what it was for us. The beds are incredibly comfortable and the hotel itself is just really great - service, amenities, etc. There is a Starbucks downstairs in the lobby, Bliss bath products, plush towels and luxury bedding. A perfect spot for an overnight layover. The hotel shuttle was complementary and picked us up at 2am. I highly recommend this spot for layovers - not sure if the location is good for anything else but it was really great for us. I noticed a lot of conferences going on - seems like a good place for that too - esp because its so close to the airport. Booked on hotwire and paid $135. Well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile!”
Reviews.Author: pete0807
Reviews.Content: What a great experience! The staff in the hotel were courteous, helpful and friendly. Our room was very clean and well-appointed and we cannot praise the hotel and its staff enough. A couple of staff are worthy of special mention because their contribution to our stay helped make the difference. Albert - the concierge - is worth his weight in gold if you're a tourist and don't know the area. Nikki, who works in the bar, is a shining example of what a customer-facing employee should be. Choosing the Sheraton Gateway was a trade-off fo us, as tourists. We needed somewhere close to the airport after an 11-hour flight but wanted to be fairly close to the 'touristy' places. We made the right decision and wouldn't hesitate to say there again.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay again....”
Reviews.Author: RoKelly
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Gateway is a really rare airport hotel. Very well maintained as opposed to some of the reviews I've read on Trip Advisor. Our room was pretty clean, the hotel public space was pretty clean as well. One note, it took housekeeping at least two days to notice some nut shells in a public hallway on the 3rd floor. I actually thought that wasn't bad because I notice everything (other guests probably didn't even realize the shells were there) and that was the only housekeeping concern that I had in a public space. As far as the room goes my only issue was the comforter, it had a stain on it but I never use them anyway so I just took it off the bed but wanted to wait and see if housekeeping would notice it and replace it with a clean one. They didn't so on my 2nd night there I asked that it'd be replaced and they responded very quickly to this request and any others that I had. Other areas like the hot tub needed to be cleaned as well and the elevators were very slow and probably needed to be serviced; experienced a situation where several guests including myself were stuck on the 1st floor because the doors did not shut properly, a guest had to pull the doors open to reset them. I never reported this incident. Though we had some minor issues service was great, the restaurant was great, the room ultimately was very comfortable, beautiful decor and furnishings. I would stay again and more than likely will soon. My biggest problem with the Sheraton Gateway is parking...yes we've read this before, it is a headache. First off, we did choose to park valet the first day due to schedule constraints...it was just convenient at the time. On the next two days that we had a rental we chose the Sheraton/LAX lot behind the hotel. It was very inconveniently located. My husband had to shuttle back to the hotel after parking the car!! Then, on the day we checked out I noticed we were charged for valet for 5 days instead of 1...we didn't even have a car on the last three days of our stay. I was very disappointed by that...but otherwise this hotel is still one of the best I've experienced at a Priceline rate of $90/night for it's star-rating.

Reviews.Title: “80% good, 20% not so good”
Reviews.Author: Karch72
Reviews.Content: A got a wicked good deal on this hotel through Priceline, so I really can't complain about too much. As far as the hotel, it is fairly modern and conveniently located to LAX. The shuttle from LAX was fast and the driver was very friendly. The room itself was pretty big and had updated decor, but the bathroom was small and in need of renovation. Why would you update the room, but not the bathroom? I don't understand it. The enamel on the bathtub was peeling and you could barely close the door while using the toilet. I also expected the bed to be a little more comfortable ... that wasn't the case however. Pros: Very nice (and free) weight room, free Wi-Fi in the lobby, Starbucks in lobby, shuttle bus to airport, location near LAX. Cons: Elevators were slow and at one point was dropping people off on the wrong floor, $13 for offsite parking, expensive restaurants onsite (I walked to a Marriott down the road just to get a cheaper meal at a sports bar), no retail establishments nearby (food or shopping), old 25 inch TVs. Overall, I would stay at this property again. If they made some minor improvements it would go from a good place to stay to an excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Solid business hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: BenjaB
Reviews.Content: Pros: Free shuttle from LAX to the hotel, very friendly and helpful staff, VERY quick room service, comfortable beds, reasonable rates. Cons: Dated bathroom (the shower head was only at my chin level!), fee for in-room internet.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful night at the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: lhook
Reviews.Content: We flew into LA late on Saturday night, so we decided to spend the night at the Sheraton to avoid drivng in the dark. We arrived at the airport, called the Sheraton, got our luggage, walked outside and the shuttle pulled up. We got checked in right away and went up to our room. The beds were awesome - we used starpoints to stay here and it was a great night's sleep. There was not a lot of noise - I use ear plugs so you may be able to hear the planes - but I did not. In the morning, we got up and I went downstairs to check email on my laptop (it's free in the lobby) - there was tons of space to sit down and plug in and starbucks is in the hotel so that was an added benefit. We left and shuttled back to airport and picked up the shuttle for thrifty and headed out to Pasadena. Great hotel near the airport - clean and comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and modern!”
Reviews.Author: Bukwaas
Reviews.Content: Use the Four Points hotel phone number in the Arrivals area to get put through to this hotel's main desk, so that the 10 minute shuttle can pick you up. The rooms are very modern and trendy, and the view is pretty good (although you're in an industrial airport area, so what can I say). Amazingly quiet, considering that planes are flying overhead. Breakfast buffet is a bit over priced, and the selection is only OK at best.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor for a Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: theinsane
Reviews.Content: Service is awful, the elevators weren’t working, we never got attended on the bar. I was very sick and there wasn’t even a doctor available on the hotel. If you need to stay in LAX, look somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the parking”
Reviews.Author: flame01
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property from Jan 26th - Jan 29th and again on the night of Feb 1st. This hotel is really nice except for a few small details, Charging guests to park their cars is a little over the top when the car park (not the valet parking) is a 5 minute walk behind the hotel...not alot you might say, but when I stayed, the car park was almost full and I had to park at the furthest point from the entrance and then had to walk in very heavy rain to get to the hotel...and I got charged about €13 per day for this privledge. Its a public car park , but Sheraton guests get a special rate...big deal!!! My room was excellent but the door lock (electronic) required attention and after I was told it was fixed, it still caused problems...like locking me out of my room each time. The hotels saving grace...the quick shuttle to the airport and the "heavenly beds"....wow, the best ever

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: Mikar85
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights due to location. It was ok, but not great. The room decor was modern, though it did not feel comfortable. There were many conferences going on, so the lobby was busy and noisy. And cold! The food at the bar and in the restaurant was average and a little pricey. Front desk staff not knowledgeable about local info. Parking fee was a little high, too, as was the internet fee. Convenient to LAX, but other than that, nothing to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly nice airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: OutOfOffice2008
Reviews.Content: This is a completely reasonable airport hotel. I was only in LA overnight and would have preferred to stay in town, but the rate here was way more affordable. I went expecting the usually below-par airport hotel experience but was very surprised to find a large but fresh hotel. The room was great - very clean with an up to spec. Sheraton bed. I had to sleep and was able to make the room 100% dark, but there was some airplane noise audible (granted I did ask for a good view of the southern-most runway). This is still an airport hotel, impersonal and surrounded by parking lots and other airport hotels, but it did provide a good night's sleep. I did have my Starwood Gold status recognized at check-in and was put in a "preferred floor" - but had no club access as am not a Platinum.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Memories”
Reviews.Author: 2schlaffs
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for 1 night before departing via LAX for an around-the-world honeymoon trip. We'd actually 1st met at the hotel 10 months earlier during a Peace Corps orientation before heading overseas for volunteer service. So we stayed more for the memory of it being where we first met, but it would be hard not to really enjoy the nice, clean furnishings and very comfortable accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: livetortrvl
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel near LAX. Got a room for $89 on priceline and it was a steal at that price. We had a late international flight and had to stay overnight in LA. Couldn't have picked a better hotel. Right next to the airport. We were helped with our baggage both ways. The shuttle to the airport is frequent. Rooms were nice and clean. Room service was good although expensive like most hotels. Even though its right next to the runway, there's no airplane sound. Nice views of the runway, enjoyed watching the planes land and takeoff.

Reviews.Title: “clean and family friendly”
Reviews.Author: travelW3kids
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our clean room and the wonderful service. We ordered room service and my two young children (4 and 6) had plenty of delicious options on the kid's menu. (for a great price)! Also, the breakfast buffet the next morning was wonderful. They didn't even charge for the kids!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best bargains in LA”
Reviews.Author: steveindenver
Reviews.Content: Our corporate rate is 90/night for this hotel. Given the rate one might think the place is a dump. Nothing is further from the truth. The rooms are well furnished, some newer and nicer than others and the staff is excellent. One thing to note though, and this is not unique to just this Sheraton, I'd say 80 percent of the time I find urine on the toilet seat upon check in.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique-quality hotel right by the airport”
Reviews.Author: trilceana
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton LAX felt like a boutique hotel - interesting artwork in the lobby, amazing 1920s-ish furniture all around the public floors, lovely poolside area & bar for late-night drinks, and extremely comfortable & well-decorated guestrooms; so much nicer than I expected for an airport hotel (and free with Starwood points!) Transport from the hotel was quick and easy, and we knew we'd made an excellent choice when we saw pilots pouring into the hotel for a good night's sleep...

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: powersla
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here one night, but it was a good experience. I read some of the other reviews about the rooms needing an update, but my room was very modern and new (reminded me more of a W hotel) in the way it was decorated. I am a gold member, so maybe I got a newer, remodeled room? It was on the 12th floor. Service was professional -- not overly friendly, but they got the job done. I mostly chose this hotel because of it's location close to the airport, but I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely surprise for an airport hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kamtini
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Sheraton on a late night flight from the east coast and was very surprised because I had expected far less from an airport hotel. The rooms were extremely comfortable, well-decorated, and clean. And the staff was very helpful - when I was in desparate need of a bagel and cream cheese to accompany the Starbucks coffee I had purchased in the lobby, the restaurant kindly boxed it up so that I could take it back to my room and get back to some pending work. Small details but those are the things that compel an "excellent' rating. I would absolutely stay here again - it was fantastic to arrive there in minutes from the hellish experience that is LAX. This is the second recent Sheraton stay that was a great pleasure - the chain is definitely doing something right!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to LAX, average accomodations”
Reviews.Author: issyK
Reviews.Content: You probably won't want to stay in this area unless you need easy access to LAX, but even amongst the airport hotels this is a subpar choice. - feels more like a 3-star than 4-star property - tub was dirty - and when water was turned on, a gush of dirty brown water gushed out - felt worn and unkempt positive points: - bed is standard Sheraton, good quality sheets - large number of rooms - decent size room It's not completely disgusting, but there are other choices in the immediate area and even with the SPG group, I prefer to stay at the Westin LAX which is just down the road

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bobshady86
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel recently and I had a great experience. I am a Starwood Gold Member so I got the room free through points. At check-in, the employee wasn't too great or nice but did get the job done. I checked in very fast with no problems which I always enjoy. I especially liked the room that they put me in. There are 15 floors and I was on the 14th overlooking LAX with a great view of the runways and the airport itself. The room was good size, the sheets, bathroom and everything was clean so I was very satisfied. The only dissatifcation I had was the desk. It was made of wood and there was a lot of chips on the top and the side which were very noticeable. Just a little paint would make it look much better but that was just a minute detail. Everything else was way above satisfactory. I strongly recommend you stay at the Sheraton Gateway Los Angeles. It is very close to LAX and everything around and in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Needed a refurb about 10 years ago!!”
Reviews.Author: athtrasna
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Sheraton Gateway and it was disappointing to see that it was no closer to feeling like a 21st century hotel, to me it's still stuck in the 80s and needs upgrading soon. Check in agent was unhelpful verging on rude but at least this time we didn't get placed next to a family with energetic young children who screamed the place down at 6am! Elevators were a lottery, worked okay on arrival, didn't work when going to and from work out room and worked when we checked out. Room was a decent size, but no magnifying mirror in the bathroom and few accesible electrical sockets for those all important chargers for phones, ipods, cameras.... Wait for shuttle was about 15 mins the next morning. For $75 on Priceline it's not a bad deal but I wouldn't like to have paid too much more.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but dated”
Reviews.Author: superstardj
Reviews.Content: Stopped in for one night with a room booked via my Starpoints. Nice and close to LAX, fast, convenient shuttle, everything you'd really want for an airport hotel. Rooms however do feel a bit dated - if you've stayed in various Sheratons, you'll know that whilst the services are usually quite similar, the rooms can vary depending on how old the hotel is, and this was on the lower end of the scale. Both room and bathroom showing signs of wear+tear, and could use a bit of a makeover. Few lights etc not working in room, but no biggie. On a happier note, we did get upgraded to a suite (which wasn't much bigger than a room), and enjoyed a decent meal at the steakhouse on the ground floor which is pretty good. All in all, a decent airport stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Good but for the Elevators!”
Reviews.Author: HiIslandsGuy
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Gateway is a consistently good choice for a stay near to LAX except for one thing: the elevators. On my most recent stay, none of the guest elevators were working upon check-in. All guests (and housekeepers, room service staff, bellmen, etc.) were being routed to a single service elevator in a utility room. The waits were very long, the elevators very crowded. The elevator problem persisted off and on throughout our stay. I asked a staff member how long this had been going on and he told me there have been elevator problems for "several months". I know that any commercial establishment can suffer an elevator outage, but it concerns me that the problem here seems to be both extensive and chronic. In that this is a fifteen floor property, you may wish to call the hotel before booking to determine the current status of their elevator problems. That being said, it is worth checking on this hotel. It is very convenient to LAX. The rooms are comfortable, quiet and well appointed. The beds are exceptionally comfortable. The housekeeping is excellent. The staff is hard-working, yet pleasant. This hotel is a good way to begin, end or transit a trip. I have stayed at the Sheraton Gateway quite a few times so I feel qualified to comment on its consistency. But I am also surprised at this most recent development with its elevators and hope that hotel management will address it more seriously.

Reviews.Title: “Any closer to the airport and you'd be under a plane!”
Reviews.Author: Tandarook
Reviews.Content: I arrived at LA Airport with no accommodation booked for a 20 hour layover and got on the Sheraton shuttle bus thinking this was a hotel brand I can usually trust. As usual the Sheraton lived up to its expected high standards. My mini suite was perfect. Clean, spacious, crisp linen etc. The leather couch was perfect for an afternoon nap in front of the TV. I am actually surprised to read other reviews noting they found this pricey - I found it far cheaper than comparable accommodation and actually asked the receptionist if I had in fact heard the price right it seemed so cheap! The shuttle to the airport was literally minutes and I was assisted on and off both ends by the driver (always a worry getting luggage on and off when you are a female travelling solo). The only minor disappointment I will note is that room service is not 24 hours. Being so close to an international airport I was more than a little annoyed I could not get a "proper" meal because it was 9am LA time even though I had just gotten off a 15 hour flight from Australia and desperately wanted something more substantial than a bagel! Overall though I definitely recommend this place and will definitely stay here again in future.

Reviews.Title: “near airport but pricey”
Reviews.Author: jollygilly
Reviews.Content: we stayed here on our last night as we wanted to be near to the airport. The hotel was pricey and the room were shabby . The only good point was the security to go to the rooms, ie without a room key the lift would not work. There is a shuttle bus to the airport

Reviews.Title: “Very nice airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: FatherMckenzie
Reviews.Content: Very nice considering it is an airport hotel. It is very clean and comfortable. And I am particular! The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was large enough for three of us to be comfortable. The beds were comfortable the furnishings were good. The bathroom was a good size and clean. Cable Internet service in the rooms was $11 per day but wireless was free in the lobby. There is a business center but they charge for Internet and printing boarding passes. The hotel was clean and luxurious. The pool was nice with comfortable lounge chairs and good service for food and drink. There was annoying music over the loud speakers though. The shuttle to and from the airport runs about every 10 minutes. The location is fine if you want to walk for exercise, not pleasant in terms of noise and traffic but safe. They offered us a 6 PM checkout for only $50, which was great because we had an 11 PM flight.

Reviews.Title: “Declining property”
Reviews.Author: mlasser
Reviews.Content: First time I reviewed this property it was pretty good. This time, I think there are better options. Desk chair does not raise and lower and had a cigarette burn. Towles were still damp on the rack. No bath soap, only facial bars. Club room had food but not set up on time. Club room also over run by kids with no one trying to control them. Self-parking has Sheraton signage but is not part of the property so you cannot bill it to the room. Paying for parking took ten minutes and four different signitures. As a Platinum I was offered no upgrade despite a very empty hotel with lots of suites available. Better than the Westin accross the street, but there are better LAX hotels.

Reviews.Title: “parking situation”
Reviews.Author: bums
Reviews.Content: I give this hotel a neutral. I stayed here in my recent trip to LA. I find booking through spg.com or starwood phone very conveninent if you are an SPG member, so I picked this one up because of location and price. The location is good, I stayed at other hotels at LAX, nothing unusual here. Rooms are ok sized, nicely furnished, positive sides of my stay. I had 2 issues with the room in my 2 days stay, one with the heater and the other one with the bathtub drainage, but it was taken careof, so it is OK. However, parking drama is another story. Hotel only provides Valet parking for $24 a day. Or you park in the airport parking lots behind the hotel.(for $13). The problem here is, at night, you have to walk back to the front door from parking lot through some dark road, since all the side doors of the hotel are closed.Very inconvenient. Valet parking is not too good either, because of the crowds picking up their cars. I stayed at the radisson LAX and also paid for parking there but at least, parking was closer.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: WandererLondon
Reviews.Content: We spent a night here between international flights.I wasn't expecting a great deal from an airport hotel but was pleasantly surprised. It's literally minutes from LAX, probably one of the closest hotels and with acomp shuttle bus that goes very frequently. Rooms large, quiet, clean and comfortable. The Starbucks in the lobby is a genius idea and much appreciated! Only criticism was that there was only one person on reception when we checked in which was somewhat annoying. Have more reception staff: travellers relish quick check in and out! Otherwise full points!

Reviews.Title: “NIce Hotel; Recently Remodeled”
Reviews.Author: LouMonika
Reviews.Content: This hotel currently comes up with some of the best rates for upmarket properties in LA -- true it's next to a runway at LAX, but it was recently remodeled and the rooms are great -- for the price very very difficult to beat -- we also received complimentary club level (continental breakfast and snacks in p.m. but no complimentary drinks) upgrade for Starwood alliance membership which is free. Decor is muted grays, browns, and other earthtones -- very modern look in lobby. Sweet Sleeper Beds are pretty nice but only doubles not queens in the rooms with two beds. Request an airport view if you like to watch airplanes. Other side of the hotel may be a bit quieter but we slept fine with the runway side. Lounge off lobby is very nice as is the smallish pool which has free cabanas and teak chairs with cushions and lots of on site towels. Not hard to forget you are at airport. We found location convenient for runs up to Hollywood/Santa Monica and to other LA sites -- didn't encounter airport traffic congestion as we'd feared. Bathroom in hotel was spotless and housekeeping staff very efficient. Parking is a bit strange but for a big city relatively cheap (around $10/day but basically a block walk or more to your car which you park in the airport's remote parking entered by a back entrance across street from hotel -- might have misgivings as a single woman needing to access or leave car late at night, but it looked well lit patroled and safe so maybe not a problem -- at least again it was cheap). No attractions or restaurants within walking distance other than inside other hotels. We were very pleased with our 4 night stay and would recommend this Sheraton to others without qualification.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: chuggins68
Reviews.Content: Stayed the night of 07/24 in room 1163. This hotel was your typical full service property. Standard Sheraton hospitality but for all that was touted on its website I felt under served. The rooms are not well insulated so you do here noise throughout the night as guests arrive and depart as is expected of an airport location. But one would think that this would have been better considered for this location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay At the Gateway”
Reviews.Author: brytpa
Reviews.Content: Usually I'd not stay at an airport hotel unless airport access was key (such as an overnight layover or a quick business trip in and out of town) but some family matters had me traveling to Los Angeles and having to make last-minute plans not only for a room for myself but also for a couple of relatives for an extended (4+ days) stay. I chose the Sheraton Gateway because LAX would be an easy landmark for my relatives to find and LAX is somewhat central to the entire L.A. area (and I'd be driving all over, from Orange County to the Valley to the High Desert, Santa Monica and everywhere in between during my time in town). Check-In was a breeze, and I was upgraded to a suite (thanks to SPG status) that was extremely spacious. The entire hotel has received a rather recent upgrade, and the rooms are tastefully and quite well decorated with a modern feel. It had a large desk/workspace, sitting area with couch and two lounge chairs, king bed. Only aspect of the new, updated rooms that I found lacking were the bathrooms. They're nice and all, but pretty small. Your standard, hotel/motel-sized bathrooms. Closet was also small, but there was plenty of dresser space so that wasn't an issue for me. Wired and wirless highspeed for about $10/day. 24hr Room Service and just about everything I ordered while there was really good. The Starbucks in the lobby was extremely convenient and great to have handy when heading out for long drives to various relatives' homes every morning. It closes pretty early though so it's no evening hangout place. 24hr Valet came in handy. The lobby bar was a relaxing place to hangout at night. Maid service was attentive (I don't morning maid service and told them my first day there that 3pm was a good time for them to come clean, and they showed up at or shortly after 3pm every day while I was there!) and thorough. I never once heard a plane take off or land while there, though my room faced the airport. So either I got lucky or things were insulated quite well. Proximity to the airport actually made for some real convenience, as freeways are very close (405 and 105). All in all, was quite pleased with the stay and the relatives I'd arranged a room for also were very pleased with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable hotel near LAX”
Reviews.Author: asmythie
Reviews.Content: A clean, comfortable, near-luxury hotel with free shuttle service from LAX. Check in took longer than expected due to small staff and a customer at the front of the line having a complex issue. I was surprised that the front desk staff at such a large hotel was answering the phones as well. The room was nice, especially the beds. The one big disappointment given the overall quality of the hotel: the bathroom was poorly cleaned with gobs of hair leftover from the previous guest. The bar and restaurant were much more expensive than I'd expect for an airport hotel. A simple quesadilla, no drink ended up in a $15 tab. I'd expect this downtown or at a resort, but not out by the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bigtings
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights, great service, clean room, superior fitness facility, pool and hot tub. Found the concierge to be helpful and overall, the hotel's atmosphere is very tastefully done. having a starbucks on the premises adds to it, the rooms are soundproof and it was conveniently located near a major highway. Only drawback was getting your car from parking was time consuming.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: np2202
Reviews.Content: First for the good: the room and beds were nice. Now the rest. Parking is far away, valet parking is $22 a day, and allow a half hour to get your car in the morning. Breakfast is a ripoff, all a la carte and very expensive. I settled for a roll at the Starbucks inside the hotel and even that is very expensive, almost five bucks for a cup of coffee and a roll. No entertainment at night, not even a piano bar, just this awful techno music playing all day and night and the depressing black and white decor. Oh, and the "high speed" interenet. Almost $11 a day and I got speeds that reminded me of my old 100 baud modem, when it worked. But it usually didn't, so I called and got connected to some overseas guy who had to tweak it for me. And I had to do this every day, it never worked twice.

Reviews.Title: “Above average airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: terravisum
Reviews.Content: Arriving late at night, I was quickly checked in and soon headed for my room on the 14th floor. The key cards gave me a hard time in the elevator as the card reader did not want to read the cards. The hallways was in the standard yellow color but the room interior was a refreshing dark spa-like colors. The room is spacious with a king sleep sleeper bed, two couches and a work desk, flanked by the TV cabinet. There bed cover is not duvet and quite heavy so I just take it off as the blanket and the bed sheet was good enough. The bed is comfortable as usual but is a bit on the soft side for a sweet sleeper bed. The room is better sound-proofed than the usual hotel rooms and although there were some leaks from the airport, I was not disturbed at night. The air conditioning, while was quieter than other hotels, was impossibly cold and I have to resort to turning it off. Wired and Wireless Internet is available for a $10/24 hours. The bathroom is a bit larger than the usual Sheraton bathroom but only by inches. The usual Pantene and Vaseline products were ever present. The club lounge on the 15th floor has a computer with free Internet access and printer. The morning breakfast choice was quite poor. You have the choice between some hot oatmeal and same pastries as well as tea and coffee. The Starbucks in the lobby has a better breakfast items. The room is the best feature of this hotel and is much like the Sheraton Boston room, not as good but above average compares to other Sheraton and for a airport Sheraton, excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marilano
