Reviews.Content: Although I only stayed one night at the Sheraton Gateway just a few days ago (early July), I was generally pleased with the hotel. It was much quieter than I expected, given its proximity to the airport and some of the reviews on this site. I did ask for a quiet room, but the rooms were well soundproofed anyway (with double pane windows that didn't open). I was also very happy with the air conditioning system--very quiet and adjustable to a specific half a degree. At many hotels, the a/c is too loud to sleep with it on, but not at this Sheraton; I didn't even hear it going off and on during the night to keep the temperature at what I'd set it for, and I'm a light sleeper. The bed was quite comfortable with good quality sheets, although I was surprised the blanket didn't get covered with a separate sheet, as at most nicer hotels these days. And--my pet peeve at most hotels--the bottom sheet wasn't fitted so kept moving around during the night. The pillow choice was good, including foam or feather. The staff were friendly and the room was very clean. The room didn't have a refrigerator (or mini-bar), but they sent a small frig. up with no charge. Shuttle service from the airport was great; I only had to wait a few minutes for it. The less positive aspects of this hotel: the bathroom was a little small and didn't have a wall mirror or lighted stand mirror as some hotels do, so it was a little hard to see close up in the big mirrors. My primary complaint, though, was that even in a non-smoking room, there was a vague smell of stale cigarette smoke--enough so that I had to buy some air deodorizer and also use a couple of scented candles. Of course, I really shouldn't complain about anything, since I stayed for free with points from the Starwood Preferred Guest program. But since one can get a good rate even through the hotel website, and given the airport convenience, quick shuttle, comfy bed, and hotel quietness, I'll definitely stay here again when I'm in LA. Maybe by then the Sheraton chain will do what Marriotts have done and go all non-smoking!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Bed!”
Reviews.Author: pralin
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight in June 2007 at this hotel and loved it. The bed is soooo comfortable! Great pillows and bedding. The room was clean and comfortable. For being near the airport, I didn't hear much air traffic. I slept quite comfortably and was never disturbed by outside noise. The lobby is beautiful and the Starbucks in the lobby was very convenient. We would definitely stay here again and we highly recommend it. You can't beat the price for the quality-it's as close to five star as you can get.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED it!”
Reviews.Author: tudazwomanMclean_Va
Reviews.Content: I could not be more pleased with the Sheraton Gateway. Booked thru Expedia, I got a $95/night rate. The bathrooms offered a full complement of lotions/gels/mouthwash as well as a full-length mirror and immaculate robe. A two-phone room, it featured a glass-topped writing desk and computer port, as well as a glass-top side table separating two generously proportioned club chairs. There were FOUR lamps in the bedroom each w/a directional light switch so that one could lower the lights and still sleep. The room was well insulated and I couldn't hear the nearby airport at all. Beds had two comforters and a blanket in addition to sheets. Colors of room a restful gray complimented with a burnt orange bed backboard with navy pinstripe bed covers and club chairs. Staff was exceptional to me and most helpful; oh, and the shuttle runs every 15 minutes -- very convenient for a hotel property 5 minutes from the airport. Giftshop also well maintained. Will DEFINITELY return!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyGreen
Reviews.Content: We booked the Sheraton's "Park and Fly" package. With Sunday arrival it was only $169 plus taxes for a room, and 7 days of valet, covered parking! I wasn't expecting a lot but the hotel was fine. Quiet rooms, comfy beds and the Starbucks in the lobby was a bonus. The rooms need some updating but are not horrible. The bar downstairs is surprisingly hip with a good vibe, menu and food. There is also a branch of "Shula's" a higher end steakhouse. Overall I would say an excellent choice for one night, but no longer. Next time we depart early from LAX we shall stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Sharaton a nice Experiance w/great room service”
Reviews.Author: syd66ney
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Sharaton. The room looked exactly like it did in the pictures. Very 'chique' - great new modern style which i really enjoyed. They got good tv channels too as I was able to find my hockey game on an obscure channel. I was in town on buiness so I returned my rental car the night before. I had the rental company bring me back to the airport, where from there I didnt have to wait more than 10 minutes for a hotel van to come pick me up for the 10 minute ride back to the hotel. Then in the morning I took the shuttle back to the airport- again, the entire thing didnt take more than 20 minutes. I had a nice view of the planes landing and taking off. I could however hear them at night which was rather distracting. I cranked the air though and that pretty much muffled the noise. I could see the pool from my room and it looked nice but I didnt go down. Since I got to the hotel so late, the only thing I could pretty much get for food was room service. I ordered a chicken ceasar salad and a french onion soup. Let me tell you, this was THE BEST room service I have ever ordered. They came promptly. Along with what I ordered, they brought me 4 pieces of warm, fresh, crusty fench bread with butter. Also a tall ice water with lemon. Deff didnt expect that and it was very nice! And the french onion soup was not a cup but a hugh bowl! I was full just eating that. Yummy ceasar dressing too. Granted my meal cost me $35 but it was well worth the service and convenience. Loved the Sharaton and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overnight-Not extended”
Reviews.Author: abe_perkins81
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for it's main purpose, which is flying into LAX and staying one night and leaving. However, do NOT stay if you intend to stay a few days. 1.) No free continental breakfast, you pay for a real breakfast 2.) Parking is $12 per day one block away! Parking at the hotel is $24 per day! 3.) No free internet access, that is $10.95 However, look of the hotel and comfort is great. Hotel food is great but expensive. My recommendation, stay 1 night flying thru LA is okay....coming with a car whatsoever, do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable airport overnighter”
Reviews.Author: Lindyloo1
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Gateway rather late after a long and tiring plane journey from England. Hotel looks nice from the outside and the check-in was extremely pleasant. We had been upgraded as we are Platinum members so our room was better than average. We found the room quite large and pleasant but would not rave about it, however, it is built for people staying overnight and that it accomplished to perfection. The bed was very comfortable. The downside of the room was an extremely "tiny" bathroom. The room service snack was not very good. We could have had a meal downstairs in their steak house but we arrived when it was closing so cannot review on this restaurant. Unfortunately, we had a very early start the following morning (5am) and were not able to have breakfast in their Club Lounge as it did not open until 6am. Would we stay there again, probably as it did have the advantage of only being five minutes from the airport and overall was quite pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and luxury”
Reviews.Author: Blaize76
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the modern lobby and room design. The beds were SO comfortable and the business services really fit my needs. If you are staying in the LAX area I would suggest you check out this property, especially if you can stay on the club level (great views of LAX).

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: KernNative
Reviews.Content: Was lured by the marketing. The website described a relaxing atmosphere with sophisticated cabanas and inviting oasis poolside. Not the feeling I got. The cocktails were pricey, I was informed that happy hour was 1/2 priced drinks... The waitress/bar charged us full price and only corrected the price after we brought it to their attention. The price of our room included 2 free cocktails, which turned into confusion with the bar. If there was free breakfast/continental breakfast, there was no information of it. The restaurant was very pricey, we left for Pizza rather than eat at the Hotel. Hotel is not kid friendly. Not a place for kids. Parking and checking in was hectic. Checking out not any better-check your bill. Small rooms in comparison. Next time we'll stay at the Embassy-one of our favorites!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased With The Sheraton Gateway”
Reviews.Author: TRosel238
Reviews.Content: With an early morning flight out of LAX, I decided to stay at the Sheraton Gateway. As soon as I walked in the door, I noticed that the hotel has an upscale feel to it. Check in went flawlessly, and the bellhop ushered us to our room. The beds were very comfortable and the pillows were the same. We had an upper level room, which had a nice view of the airport. The next morning we took the hotel shuttles to the airport. The shuttles were prompt and ontime. I highly recommend this hotel for any traveler who needs to be near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice for price and location”
Reviews.Author: zuttoman
Reviews.Content: The past three or four reviews have a theme that I'm going to echo -- I was delightfully surprised by the design of the remodel. I thought I was in a Westin, not a Sheraton and I certainly didn't expect that. The only reason I was staying there was because there weren't any rooms at the hotels I usually stayed at (Westin or Sheraton downtown). The service was great. The lobby glam. The only downside (or upside) is that it's right next to the airport. The planes didn't keep me up at night but I could hear them. If there's a reason that you need to be near LAX (or on the west side of 405) this hotel is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Gatewat”
Reviews.Author: liketotravel89
Reviews.Content: Stayer here two different times in a week from April 13th-April 16 and again from April 21st to April 22nd. Stayed at this hotel last year and loved it, so we stayed there again. Our first stay we had a room on the 15th floor. The view was of the two runways, mainly 24L and R. The room was nice, a little bit of a different set up, the chair was against the inside bathroom wall,instead of against the window. The water pressure in the bathroom was low. We had access to the special room, where they had snacks available, as well as breakfast and dinner. The beds were awesome. Our second stay we had a room on the 12th floor. What a difference. My key didn't work, so we had to make a trip back down to the front desk. The view was of the 25L and R runways and of the parking lot. There was somebody else's hair on the toilet,which was kinda weird, and the room didn't have the awesomeness the room on the 15th floor had. The water pressure was much better, still not great, but much better then it was on the 15th floor. The front desk staff the first stay were great, but the girl we had the second time around was pleasant, but not as friendly as the others. She wasn't all that friendly when we asked for a new key, and when we asked if a free breakfast came as part of the reservation, which we had gotten before, and she gave us one, although didn't seem to be very happy doing so. We did use the workout room our first time around and it great. Our first stay only 2 of the 5 elevators were working, because a dance competition was using all the ballrooms and overloaded the elevators by a large amount. Second time around it appeared that 3 or 4 were working, but were still very shaky and slow. The valet guys were awesome. Will absolutely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 36000ft
Reviews.Content: First of all this Sheraton just completed a multi-million dollar renovation and it shows. The lobby and check-in area very open and modern. Check-in was a breeze. The guest rooms feature the new Sheraton beds, excellent work area and a very nice large chair by the window. I used the fitness center and I must say it is one of the best, each machine has its own flat-screen tv and everyone gets their own pair of headphones. It overlooks the outdoor pool area which has poolside cabanas, palm trees, and in the evening poolside cocktail service. There is a full-service Starbucks just off the lobby and its a little oasis from the busy lobby. The airport shuttle is very frequent and depending on which terminal you can even walk. By far the best part of this hotel is the fact that you do not feel like you are right next to LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but expected more from Sheraton. Would stay for same price.”
Reviews.Author: Value_Al
Reviews.Content: Got a hotel for about $119 through my employer's travel agent. (Rooms on web travel sites list $195). Picked this hotel because of location (meeting across the street) and the price I paid. Room was nice, but I expected more from a Sheraton and especially if I would have paid full price. Perhaps they give the nicer rooms to those who pay full price. Never understand why these hotels nickel and dime you for internet access. It is extra. Good choice for a hotel across from LAX. Free shuttle to the airport and a free shuttle to the $12 night parking (a bit of a walk if you don't want to wait for the shuttle. NOTE: There are spaces reserved on near the entrance for the Sheraton, but I did not see them until I had already parked and carried my 2 bags about 100 ft.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for overnight stay before leaving”
Reviews.Author: da_kaz
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal via Hotwire. Very clean and modern hotel and room. Unloaded the family and luggage in the loading zone before returning my van to Enterprise and getting dropped off back at the hotel. I didn't want the hassle of returning our vehicle or pay for guest parking. We just ate the food we bought from a take-out restaurant in LA and slept in our room, then rushed out. I checked out by phone later. The room was quiet and of decent size. I would have liked more than the 10-15 or so TV channels, though. A small refrigerator would have been helpful too. We would have bought coffee at the downstair Starbucks if we had time. The close location to the airport and shuttle every 10 minutes was very comforting for a quick departure for a morning flight. My wife was right: if we had stayed where we were previously in Orange County, we would've ran into problems getting ready for and catching our flight. I'd definitely stay there again for an overnighter, but that's about it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Gateway”
Reviews.Author: ELCHEAPEE
Reviews.Content: $129/night - nice room and decor. Excellent service. Had to catch a flight the next day, shuttle came very often. Valet is $13. Car rental places close by.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel by LAX”
Reviews.Author: Writer/Director
Reviews.Content: When flying out of LAX anytime before noon I always try and make it down the night before so I can have a decent night's sleep and avoid having to deal with traffic in addition to getting to the airport on time. I stayed at this hotel about a month prior and they were still doing lots of renovations. This time, all renovations on the floor I was on were finished and very nice. I was given a complimentary upgrade upon check-in because the room type I reserved was full. The service was quick and pleasant and my room was nice. I enjoyed the fact that the air conditioning system actually got down to 65 degrees (most hotels only get down to 70 or 72 no matter what you've set it at). I also enjoyed the steak at their restaurant and drinks at the bar. My one complaint was the lazy service at the bar. They have outdoor tables set up but the cocktail waiters only come out to see if you're doing okay once every 2 hours it seemed. Had they bothered to check on us more frequently we'd have spent more money and ordered more drinks. Bed was comfortable, slept great - and the hotel shuttle the next morning was nice. The shuttle driver, however, has a chip on his shoulder and I get the feeling he thinks the world owes him something and he hates his job. So he wasn't so happy to assist. But other than that, I'd say this is the ONLY nice place to stay at LAX. The only other place I've tried was the Raddisson which wasn't half as good as this.

Reviews.Title: “Fooled me twice!!”
Reviews.Author: gridskipper
Reviews.Content: The first time I stayed at this hotel, I resolved not to do so again. As luck would have it, we were paired up again on Priceline. Not much has changed since my last stay. Still a very dark, modern-looking hotel with terrible soundproofing. The parking situation seems to have improved, perhaps because the lot was less crowded so I didn't have to walk as far. I knew not to get room service this time. That said, I had a much worse experience than before. Why? They had no non-smoking rooms except on the "club" floor! I tried a smoking room once and the stench was awful. So I paid an extra $30 a night to stay on the top floor. The room was exactly the same. And although the woman at the desk was raving about the free breakfast, it was basically muffins and toast with some weak coffee. Next time I will bid an extra $30 in a different area to try to avoid the Sheraton, or just forget about Priceline altogether. How this place gets four stars is still beyond me!

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware”
Reviews.Author: Helonskiis
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a 4star, 2 rooms overnight, near LAX, for my husband & I, and my father and his companion, (in their 80's). Priceline doesn't guarantee they type of room; I know that. You request the type of room at the time of booking, and I requested non-smoking rooms at the time. A few days before our stay, I followed up with a phone call to the hotel to reconfirm that non-smoking rooms were requested. 'Gretchen' in reservations confimed this, and she did ensure our rooms were linked in the system (ie: across the hall) At no time was there any indication that we should be prepared for shoddy, worn out smelly rooms on the smoking floor (4th). . Or that renovations were ongoing in the hallway outside our rooms. Had I known in advance I could have made the decision to arrange another hotel and forfeited rooms at the Sheraton. At check-in, the front desk clerk also failed to mention that were were going to the smoking floor, until she handed me the key cards and I asked her that the rooms would be smoke-free. She appeared not to care less as she condescendingly stated "well .. you know you are [just] a Priceline customer" (Interestingly I did pay a little more than the AAA rate customers a couple of postings back). My father's companion wanted to take a bath, but when she looked in the tub, there was hard plaster stuck on the bottom of it. The venting in their room only had cold air, and when the fan came on dust and hairballs blew from the grate like a string of Tibetan prayer flags. There were dirty dishes from some previous occupant outside their room for our entire stay. The thin old blue houndstooth check carpet was full of bits of wallpaper and glue that clogged the wheels of my suitcase as I negotiated my way around workmen's pails and equipment on our way to the elevator in the morning. We did have dinner in the restaurant and it was very good. Besides, the atmosphere was a welcome relief from our rooms. This stay wasn't just disappointing, it was a horrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: realproperty
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice property very close to the airport. We stayed overnight both going to and returning from Tahiti. Check-in was fast, the rooms are updated and modern in design with an extremely comfortable king bed. It has a good upscale steakhouse (Shulas"s) as well as a general restaurant. It is within walking distance of other hotels that have branded restaurants as well. Be careful when booking and don't trust the internet. They quoted $219 a night as the cheapest rate available. When I called, they repeated $219 but when I asked for the AAA rate, it was $119 without batting an eye. For someone looking for a first class hotel right by the ariport, I found it an excellent deal for an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ideal for a layover”
Reviews.Author: yyjguy
Reviews.Content: A very clean comfortable hotel, ideal for an airport layover. No noise from aircraft or roadway. Very good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: cre8tive921
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel through Priceline.com at a resonable rate and I was blown away buy the customer service and pleasant atmosphere. The staff makes you feel welcomed. The rooms are very neat and clean. Maid service is very excellent. I would definetly stay again. It's right near the airport. The only downfall is parking... But other than that its very nice to stay close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: demaagddb
Reviews.Content: My husband I spent one night at this hotel and choose it for it's location near LAX. We arrived at about 9:30 PM and check-in took forever, even though there were just a few people in line. We had booked a club floor room, knowing that breakfast was offered on the floor beginning at 6AM. Our flight was due to leave at 8:55 AM and we had to return a rental car first. Upon taking the elevator up to the club floor, two other guests were complaining that their card to get to that floor hadn't worked the whole time they were there. My card worked on the elevator but not when I tried to get in my room!! I had to find a phone, call the front desk and then wait, and wait, and wait for a security guard to come and unlock the door. I ended up sitting on the floor next to the door for what seemed like forever (especially when you are tired!). The room itself was just okay. The bathroom was small. Not what I expected for a club floor room. Upon waking and hurrying to get some breakfast before our flight, we found the door locked and no sign of breakfast! (Breakfast was listed as being offered from 6AM to 9AM everyday on the club floor). We called the front desk at 6:10AM and were told that it was coming. Finally, at about 6:30AM, they opened the room and began to serve breakfast. We had to just grab a few things and go! Not the relaxing breakfast that we had planned on! Also, parking was a pain. The ramp for self-park was several blocks away and almost as expensive as valet.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Accommodations - Awkward Building”
Reviews.Author: Peggysuz
Reviews.Content: As requested, I was given a non-smoking room with a runway view. The room itself seems ideally outfitted for the business traveller - desk, Internet, seating area, coffee maker, free shuttle to airport (every 15 minutes). My bed was big and outfitted with high quality linens and lots of pillows but the mattress was in bad condition. I didn't use the robe provided. Their business centre closed early on the day I stayed there and since I had no laptop with me was unable to access Internet. There was no obvious stairway connecting the lobby level to the business/conference room level on flight above; I felt lazy but took the elevator to go up and down one flight. Dinner in the Shula steakhouse restaurant was a relaxing but definitely upscale experience. A Caesar salad and their award-winning hamburger cost me $22 before tax and tip. It's a good thing the service and food were excellent! At the street corner outside the hotel, visitors can access a free hourly shuttle service to the Manhattan Beach area and mall - handy for those of us with time to fill and no cars. I do have to agree with other reviewers on the points about hotel staff service. They don't seem to be stressing warmth and welcoming attitudes.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: abhetrck
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was very nice but very snobby,my grandsons had gone down to the pool,they were 17 and 14 and was told by someone (prob. Someones body guard) that they couldn't touch the side of the pool and could not come near these 4 people (the only other ones in the pool) nor talk to them,don't know who they were but no one's that important.My daughter was right behind them and they wern't doing anything but this guy just kept on them.We arrived around 9:00pm and nothing was open,we hadn't had supper yet. I was sure glad we were only going to be there that night and only did so because it was at the airport.As far as looks and cleanness goes,I would give it a 5 star but as far as staff and help goes,it only deserves a 4 or maybe even a 3.The staff was also very snobby and not helpful at all.

Reviews.Title: “Room With a Runway View!”
Reviews.Author: gstabc
Reviews.Content: Found out on short notice that I had to take my in-laws to the airport. Booked a room on Priceline and offered $65 for a 4-star hotel. I really wondered what I would find. I was delighted at the room. Clean, well-appointed and large. Slept 4 adults comfortably. Read previous reviews where they recommended getting the “runway” view rooms and that is what I asked for at the front desk. My room was 9-1-1 (they don’t call it 9-11.) upon opening up the door and opening the curtain - the view was excellent. Our TV was not on for the whole 3-days/2 nights that we were there (except 2 hrs worth). Did not use the hotel restaurant but ate out. Please note: parking is valet and the self-parking is 2 blocks behind the hotel and very crowded. I would recommend the valet service unless you want the exercise. No need to use the hotel exercise room if you park this way. All in all, an excellent stay with shuttle service to and from the airport that makes parking your car a cinch.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, reliable business hotel, close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: RWC99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for business for 4 nights - Sat - Wed. Room is basic Sheraton but comfortable, beds were wonderful. Bathroom is ok, not the nicest, but got the jobs done! Starwood Lounge was nicely appointed, with free Internet access, fax, and printer. The breakfast spread looked good, but did not partake. The afternoon "snack" always had sandwiches, cheese & crackers, veggie & dip, and a hot pasta dish. Also free sodas and bottled water (cash bar for beer & liquor) and fresh whole fruit (banana, apple, oranges). Perfectly serviceable for a snack before a late dinner. Bar in lobby was great, plenty of bartenders so you didn't have to wait too long to be served, also table service if you didn't want to sit at the bar. You can also bring drinks to sit poolside (very lovely). Schulers restaurant is a good, basic steakhouse. Stick to the steaks, and skip "the best burger in LA." Overall, was a pleasant stay for 4 days of business.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel. Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: JFulton
Reviews.Content: We booked on hotwire and gt a good price, but after reading the reviews, I was afraid we had made a mistake. Boy, was I wrong. We checked in late (10pm) and the check in was efficient and the room we had asked for was ready. Room was much better than expected, modern and very clean. In fact, I stayed at a 5 star resort recently that had more amenities but this room was much nicer. If you are looking for a nice place to stay close to LAX, this place would be hard to beat. One tip. If you want to pay for valet parking, its expensive. If you don't mind walking, park in the self parking in back and save $10-15. They offer an in and out rate for hotel guests, but if you just need to park and leave the car there, don't mention you are a hotel guest and pay even less.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: honestonly
Reviews.Content: Very bad service, forced me to stay in smoking room despite that they had a nonsmoking available and stated that the manager is out on the weekend and can not help me. They stated that my rate of $150 a night gives me only a smoking room and the nonsmoking rooms are reserved for higher rate, despite that they are standard rooms. Very nasty hotel with horrible manners. this is the first time I have a had a bad hotel experience. Enjoy your trip somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than I Expected”
Reviews.Author: NaMacD2
Reviews.Content: I booked one night for the end of a California road trip before departing LAX, and received a very good rate via my company's travel site. I dropped our rental car off at Avis, and walked to the hotel (about 8 blocks). My daughters and I loved our room - simple but luxurious bedding, nice bath, great night view, and quiet. But the best part was the room service meal. The Sheraton offers room service for FREE if it's not delivered within thirty minutes; ours was at our door in 22 minutes. Pretty good in such a large hotel! And it was nice and hot, beautifully displayed and delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you should expect”
Reviews.Author: BenoitChartier
Reviews.Content: What you would expect from a Sheraton. Clean rooms, ok check-in, no problem, but nothing memorable. Nice if you can get a deal, like on Priceline or Hotwire, otherwise may be a bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good as a priceline option”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is worth it for the priceline deal of about $85. I wouldnt be overly impressed if id paid the full rate though. The rooms, like most airport hotels are showing signs of ageing. Although the beds are very comfortable. The bathroom is very small. For a layover or just a good nights sleep after a long flight this hotel is fine. Although dont consider anything near LAX for your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A bit less than average!”
Reviews.Author: quin-i-bog
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a stopover between London and Sydney on June 7th 2006. The hotel is close to the airport with a free shuttle every 15 minutes, so I guess you could say that it is convenient. The beds and bedding are nice too - after that I'm struggling to find anything good to say. The check in process was painfully slow - not what you need after a long flight. There was no offer of assistance with baggage or directions given to the room. The bedroom was very disappointing small and dark- but probably not as poor as the "Club Lounge" which turned out to be a small sitting room with a coffee machine in it! Bathroom amenities were meagre, no separate shower but a half size bath with shower tap over. Having paid a reasonable amount for this "executive" room we were very disappointed and would not trouble this hotel with our custom in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Gateway to Mediocrity”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all, we booked our room on Hotwire, who guaranteed us a 3.5 star hotel. After arriving, I was told I could have a King / Smoking or 2 Queens / Non-Smoking, but my preferred King/Non-Smoking was not available, so 2 Qs it was. The bathroom's toilet dispenser was nearly falling off the wall - the tub in the shower looked like someone had spilled acid in the base of it. The coffee pot didn't work and needed to be replaced, as did a light bulb and the tv remote batteries. Obviously they reserve this room for their "special Hotwire" customers! Now to the service we received here: the breakfast restaurant was fine, very cheerful, prompt, and the food was good. $40 for breakfast was a bit much, but it was our first day, so we weren't quibbling. Later that afternoon we tried to get a drink and food at one of the lounge tables, but with only one entirely inadequate cocktail waitress on a Saturday afternoon, we finally had to go to the bar to pay $20 for a vodka martini and a virgin bloody mary. Yikes! When we finally got our food, it was good, however - one of the best quesadillas I've ever had. The next night we ate at Shula's 347, thbe beautiful hotel steakhouse. Now, it was a Sunday night - not busy at all - and there were diners interspersed throughout the restaurant, but nobody sitting too close to anybody else. We were sat at a table for two in an otherwise deserted part of the restaurant - deserted, that is, until the hostess sat a man with his 5 year old daughter RIGHT NEXT TO US and then promptly seated a single guy who must have gotten his lobster eating technique from Darryl Hannah in "Splash" - yes, he crunched his way through the tail, then spit the shell out on the plate. Granted, his dining habit wasn't the hostesses fault, nor was the whining 5 year old, but her placement in a sparsely populated restaurant left MUCH to be desired.So while Dad and the kid worked thier way through $5 of mac n cheese, our $140 meal was ruined. It doesn't take much brains or training to spread the groupings around. The waitress forgot the wine, the bus person wanted to take our plates every five minutes, even when we weren't done. The food was good - very good, in fact. Such a shame their customer service left us with a bad taste in our mouths. Oh, and then there was the $50 room service breakfast of lox and english muffins (not a bagel, as the menu said) and a $12 croissant and cup of coffee. One shouldn't expect to get off cheaply on room service, but when you're paying those kind of prices, one should expect the order to be right and adequately substantial. $21 a day for valet parking was a bit much as well. But hey - the maid did a great job cleaning the brokedown palace! We'll never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: Pullman1
Reviews.Content: This is an adequate hotel. Its advantages are its friendly, can-do staff and its convenient location. Although the building is in good repair for the most part, the public spaces on the main floor are big, empty, and anonymous: all the charm of an empty barn. The rooms are middle-of-the-pack functional. The good news is that mine was comfortable, well-equipped, and recently redecorated. On the other hand, water pressure was a problem, and hot water was in short supply some of the time. Along with several other people on my floor, I could never get a swipe card that reliably opened my door. Tried several different cards, but ended up unable to enter my own room on more than one occasion. Unless you want to use room service, the only on-site restaurant for dinner is a pretentious steak house where the waiters have airs, the food is only middling good, and the prices are steep. Do not waste money on the club floor. The amenities in the club lounge are very, very modest -- nothing like the generous food and stylish furniture available in the club lounge at the nearby Renaissance. This is on balance an OK hotel. The hot water and room-key problems I encountered were serious, but probably fixable. But nothing about this hotel rises above the ordinary, and to me it has no warmth whatsoever. The nearby Renaissance is far better.

Reviews.Title: “Got off to a bad start...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was looking last minute for my husband and I to stay prior to an early morning departure out of LAX. I decided to give Hotwire a try after not finding anything cheaper than $159/night - especially last minute. I found out that we were booked at this hotel and was excited after hearing so many great reviews. It was approximately $125/night (including taxes,etc.). Also, my husband is a Starwood Preferred Guest, so I assumed that things would go well. I called the hotel prior after booking to find out what kind of room we had, and that front desk said that we were booked in a non-smoking king room. The night of our arrival, we were exhausted from last minute travel preparations. We got to the front desk and I hate to say it, but felt like we were treated like second class. First of all, the boy at the front desk told us that we could not received SPG points because we booked through a third party provider. I was okay with that, knowing that we did get a lower rate. He then questioned us on how much we got the room for and told us that was a really good rate for that hotel. I told him that I called the hotel and we were told we had a non-smoking king room. He then said that we were not down for that type of room and that we were lied to and that they always say that. He said that he didn't know who we talked to, but they just say that. He then acted like he was doing us a huge favor by giving us the non smoking king. We then asked about parking validation or payment and he said that the hotel doesn't have self parking, only valet; but that the hotel just happens to be affliated with the parking lot in back. He said that if we are hotel guests, it would be $13.00/day parking rate. However, if I wasn't staying at the hotel, it is a $10.00/day rate. He then chided us, saying that next time, we should look at sheraton's web site and that we could have gotten a better park and fly rate, and that it really wasn't that expensive. By this point, I was so disappointed that he had decided to make us feel cheap and not worth staying there. I really was scared that our vacation was going to get off to a bad start. The room was great, couldn't hear a thing, but I was glad to get out of there the next morning. We left our car in the parking lot for convenience sake, and after returning from our vacation, didn't mention the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “As good as the prior reviews”
Reviews.Author: MetMan
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Gateway has strong review on Trip Advisor and I found out that it is worthy of the ratings that other travelers have given it. I had a very large room, an awesome corporate rate of $100 a night and it was very quiet, I couldn't hear the planes at all. The bed was comfortable, although I thought the raves on prior postings were a little extreme. It was nice, but certainly not the best ever. The best ever? Their workout facility was the best I've seen in a hotel in some time. Completely the opposite of the nasty little room at the Nashville Sheraton. Only complaint is the price of room service food, which I suppose is a reflection of LA. I got around that by going downstairs to Starbuck's and picking up sandwiches down there. Lunch sandwiches are $12-14 and when you add in a drink, taxes and tip you're going to be looking at $25 in a heartbeat. All in all, a very solid hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - loved the Bed.”
Reviews.Author: Shoechick
Reviews.Content: We just returned for our california trip and spent one night at LAX due to our late arrival. We booked the Sheraton and were not disappointed. They upgraded us to a suite that could have entertained 50 of your closest friends. Someone below mentioned the beds...they were the best...even after 3 nights at the St. Regis, this Sheraton beat them hands down on bed comfort. Very convenient and a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: JSmith75
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights 27th Apr - 30th Apr 2006 and found this to be a very nice hotel. Rooms were large, clean and comfortable. Found the staff helpful. Used Starbucks which was handy to have in the hotel and the staff were always friendly. Ate at Shulas and the food was good. Thought the prices were comparable if not better than a lot of airport hotels I have stayed in around the world. Didn't find the noise a problem, we were on 6th floor, not sure if this makes a difference? Used the self parking which cost $14 a day and found this acceptable. The area was manned and well lit at night. You can walk back to the hotel, maybe takes 2-3 mins or wait for the courtesy bus back to the hotel. Airport bus service is very good and runs every 10-15 mins 24hours a day. The drivers were always pleasant and took our cases on and off the bus. Did not have any negative experiences whilst staying here. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OMG The Bed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night but I will remember the bed forever. Wow. LAX is only a 5-10 minute shuttle ride away but the room was very quiet. Another plus, the shuttle is free. And the breakfast buffet was excellent. Only one problem, the table in the room was not bolted onto the base. A very wobbly concern. Called the front desk to let them know about the problem but nothing happened... again I was only there for one night, slept like a baby.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in March of 2006 while returning from my honeymoon if fiji. The hotel staff was wonderful and the hotel upgraded us to a junior suite. The staff was some of the best that I have ever dealt with. The hotel is close to the airport and runs a free shuttle from and to the airport. This was nice especially the day that we were flying out. The junior suite was large and the bed was the most comfortable of all the beds that I slept on during my trip. This is a great hotel with an excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “If for the bed alone..”
Reviews.Author: It'sFiji4us
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I stayed here for the last two days of our exotic honeymoon. After traveling in the South Pacific, we were just looking for something nice to finish off our trip. I must say that while we truly enjoy luxury hotels, Sheraton is quickly becoming a favorite of ours if for it's 'heavenly bed' alone. These beds are AMAZING!! The hotel is nice, but the rooms are quite comfortable, the beds as I already said are amazing, and the concierge at this hotel in particular is truly par none!! He knew us by name from the first day and always had things 'just so' for us. Truly exceptional! Not only that, but I must say that the management of this particular hotel is very professional! We selected this hotel on priceline and yet when they knew we were staying there as part of our honeymoon, they quickly upgraded us to a Junior Suite at no charge. This was a very pleasant surprise and we were quite impressed. Overall I would say very nice hotel, very convenient to the airport, and very professional!

Reviews.Title: “I'll Go to the Crown Point Plaza down the street next time!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Crown Point Plaza down the street I will NOT be staying at the Sheraton Gateway ever again! The used silverware and dirty napkins laying in the hall during the majority of my stay should have been my first clue about the quality and upkeep of this overated hotel. After using the phone to make toll free calls we were informed that toll free is not so toll free at the Sheraton Gateway. At $2.00 a call (whether you connect or not) it gets expensive to make toll free calls. I can understand charging for long distance...At approx. $10 a minute I will use my cell phone instead...After speaking to management (rude management of course) they informed us that toll free was not complimentary (even though they failed to label it on the phone). The management acted as though $2.00 isn't much but when I asked for $2.00 of his own personal money he acted as though I was asking for his life. I am not worried about the $2.00, but the fact that a supposed "reputable" hotel did not label items (which at other hotels are complimentary) that cost money is what bothers me. If they would have cleaned the room a little better I probably wouldn't have been in such a mood either. After looking at pictures from other reviews I have concluded that this was not just a hit and miss thing. I can't wait to check into the Crown Point or any other quality hotel in the vicinity the next time I am in L.A.

Reviews.Title: “A 4* stay at a 2* price.”
Reviews.Author: 4star-at-2star-price
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for four nites earlier this month. Booked at a 2* price using Priceline. But, I was concerned that we might get 1* treatment. Showed my SPG Gold card on checked in. Were given a very nice room on a high (non-smoking) SPG floor. Free bottles of water, USA today, lounge access w. free Internet etc. All the staff were very friendly and helpful thoughout our stay. When we left a note that the coffee machine in the room has stopped working, it was quickly replaced. Good view of 747's and other planes flying by our window every few minutes. But,it was very quiet with great sound-proofing. The decor is very modern but quite restful. The hotel is convenient to the bus transit treminal, so we could easily hop public transit to downtown, Santa Monica etc. Shula's was very nice but a bit expensive, e.g a burger & fries are $13 and cup of tea is $4, but then it is 4* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location next to LAX”
Reviews.Author: ChristianK
Reviews.Content: If you arrive after a long distance flight at LAX the Sheraton Gateway is a wonderful choice. We paid for a room with starwood points and upgraded for $50 to a suite with view on the runway!The hotel pool area is just wonderful for an airport hotel, same is true for the restaurant and bar not to mention the Starbucks. Parking is easy in case you don´t want to pick-up your rental car the next day. Very enjoyable place to stay the night before or afterwards! The room was big and very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mikeandcris
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night with my son on Dec 27. We picked this hotel ONLY because of it's proximity to LAX because he loves flying and watching aircraft land and take off. In fact, we specifically requested a room with a view of the air traffic. The receptionist was very friendly and put us in room on the 10th floor facing north. The room was decorated in a modern style and very clean. It was not very big, but certainly not small. The beds were soft and the bath room was nice with plenty of towels. The workout area has about 10 cardiovascular machines, each with it's own TV screen. The bar is comfortable. The pool was about 80 degrees and comfortable. We moved to a different room after I walked around and found that the view to the south (which has more traffic noise...but not enough to disturb you) had a better view of the airport. The receptionist was very friendly and helpful in finding a room with a southern view. Overall, I'd stay again (especially via the Priceline price I got.) Parking is a bit steep at $13.50 overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Gateway Hotel at Los Angeles Airport was not bad. I was traveling with my husband and we checked in, got a smoking room (smoking rooms are available on the 4th floor only) and was fast and friendly. I found the room to be clean and comfortable; however, the window does not open and was dirty. The only real negative issue I found was that telephone access charge. Pretty ridiculous. I would not recommend using the telephone in the room unless you want to pay $30.00 for a local telephone call that was under a minute of use. The parking situation could be better, but I felt the walk none the less could not have hurt us any. If you are staying as a guest at the Sheraton, parking is $10.00/per day. Shula's 347 restaurant in the hotel was just fabulous not to mention very convenient. I would more than likely stay at this hotel again when in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel right by the airport”
Reviews.Author: Neilbond007
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton for 1 night to split up a AKL to LHR plane journey. Booked 2 rooms for £67 each inc tax. a real bargain! we got the hotel at around 11.30am due to the arrival time of the aircraft from NZ. myself and my work colleague decided to try our luck to see if there were any rooms available. we were first told that there were only smoking rooms avaialble. i asked if we could take a look at them to see how bad they smelt. i was informed we couldn't. we were then offered 2 disabled rooms. the only difference being that they didn't have a tub, just a lrge shower. after a 12 hour flight all we needed was a bed! we took these. the rooms were on the 12th floor overlooking LAX. rooms were superb. there is some noise from aircraft, but it's an airport hotel!! i'm a light sleeper and it didn't keep me awake. the hotel bar is ok. very dark! checked out at 12pm. by 12.02 we were at the gate at terminal 2! all in all, a superb choice for a lay over.

Reviews.Title: “Nice remodel, fantastic beds, nicest hotel at LAX!”
Reviews.Author: Runner0382
Reviews.Content: The "new" Sheraton Gateway, after an extensive lobby overhaul, the addition of the overpriced but above-average Shula's, and room renovation (but not the bathrooms) is a pleasant place to stay. Like many reviewers state, it's a bit cold - check the pics - greys, blues, and black. While it's a modern feel that looks contemporary, it doesn't feel welcoming, but that will change once you try the new beds, the best part of the renovation. The pool area is fine, small, shaded, and close to the runways (only the Radisson sits closer), but you won't hear much noise from the room. This hotel is a good deal if you're not looking for a warm feel and can spend between $70-100 through Hotwire or LastMinuteTravel. Also, be aware - parking is a nightmare, valet is good but expensive, and street spots are non-existent. The Sheraton's the newest remodel in the area at the 4 star level, far nicer than the Westin, Marriot, or Crowne Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: barnowl54
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a conference deal and really enjoyed our visit. The shuttle from the airport was prompt and easy to find. We arrived before midday after a very long and tiring flight from Sydney and were afraid we'd have to wait for our room. Check in was quick and staff were very couteous. The room was ready straight away. We had a lovely room over looking the pool area and the airport runways. There was very little noise for a hotel so close to such a busy airport. The room was very tastefully furnished and very clean. The Concierge(s) was very helpful and would go out of his way to give good advice. He even advised us that we could buy tickets to the Dodgers' game on the internet far cheaper than he could get them for us. The hotel shop had a good range of essentials and some of their souveniers were cheaper than in the downtown stores. My son and husband spent a lot of time at the pool area. The pool was clean and the hot tub was also well maintained. There were always staff on hand to replenish towels and generally keep an eye on everything. The towels were large grey and white striped beach towels which was a very nice touch. We did not eat at Shulas but did use the bar menu to eat by the pool. The menu was limited but the food was good as was the food ordered from room service. The room service staff were delightful. We did not eat at the Sushi Bar either as we are not huge fans but it seemed popular. Breakfast from the buffet was good and plentiful and we felt it was very reasonably priced. This hotel is located a long way from anywhere except the airport which is a disadvantage for a long stay as cab fares are horrendous - $45 one way to Dodgers' Stadium. A car would have been helpful and we would rent one if we were staying for the same period of time next time. However, bus fares are cheap and a ride to Santa Monica or Long Beach is $1.50 round trip. A trip to Downtown LA will cost $3.00 for an all day pass. The bus station is 5 minutes walk behind the hotel. Make sure you have the exact money. We also found that it was easy to walk up Sepulveda Ave to the shops - about 20 minutes walk - or the bus will take you there also. There are quite a few cafes, department stores and supermarkets there. We also got wise and checked out the neighbouring hotels for more food choices. If you are desperate, there is a Subway outlet next door and other fast food outlets close by. My only gripe with this fine hotel was that when I ordered a cup of tea by the pool, I was charged $4.00 for a very small pot of semi boiling water and a tea bag! We stayed at a neighbouring hotel on our night before returning to Australia, and believe me, the Sheraton wins hands down. Everything at the Sheraton is professional and we were always treated with the utmost respect. A tip: If you are clastophobic as I am, elevators are always a bother. The elevator doors at the Sheraton Gateway are slow at opening, so don't panic!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel very nice”
Reviews.Author: sra225
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last night of our California vacation. When we arrived about 9 p.m. the clerk said she had no clean double non-smoking rooms available, so she upgraded us to a suite. The room was spacious and clean and remodeled. Asked for more towels, they came right away. Breakfast buffet the next day was one of the more reasonably priced hotel buffets ($15 for adults and $6.50 for kids) and very very good, both hot and cold. We were very satisfied with this room

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!!! Just terrible!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Took the recommendation from "Global Traveler" by Francis. The Sheraton has been remodeled. We signed up for the "Romance Package". "What?" was the response from the front desk. We had to explain to the front desk manager what it entailed. Club level was a flat out lie. Website states free alcholic drinks in the club lounge (not often found in the US). We arrived to find a price list. When we brought it to their attention they removed the drinks!! The club room was not finished it was in a make shift hotel room. Shula's Steak house was closed, for 3 days. When I requested to speak the the General manager via his voice mail, he had a lesser manager call, he was too busy. We changed our travel plans to spend one night here, before our trip to asia. What a bad hotel! Room was filthy. Sevice was awful. Staff were incompetent. Management most likely the problem. Global Traveler recommendation. Did he really stay here? Stay next door at the Radisson, no experience there, but the Sheraton is that bad!!! Their website still offer free drinks for the club lounge. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “hardly a 4-star”
Reviews.Author: lisamarie66
Reviews.Content: The first rude awakening was that the valet parking was full. I was forced to park in the hotel's off-site parking lot, where they charge more for hotel guests with in and out priveleges ($13/day) than someone not staying at the hotel ($11/day). You'd think they'd give their hotel guests a break. Since I am a woman and I was travelling by myself, I didn't relish having to hike back to the hotel late at night from the parking lot. They have a shuttle from the parking lot to the hotel, but you still have to sit at the shuttle stop for quite a while until the shuttle comes. The second night I stayed, the valet parking was also full. The reception check-in was extremely rude. I had purchased the hotel stay on Priceline and this proved that internet-paying guests are treated poorly. He said he couldn't guarantee a non-smoking room since I had booked through the internet. I told him that there was no way I could have a smoking room since 1) I'm allergic to smoke and 2) I'm 4 months pregnant. He "happened to have two non-smoking rooms left." When I arrived at the room, the carpets were damp as if they had just been cleaned. When I called to complain, they said they'd send someone up to dry them. Housekeeping came up with a tiny fan that was meant to somehow dry the entire room of its damp floors. I told them I didn't think that would work and asked if they could just set down towels. I ordered room service and both the woman who took my order and the delivery man were very friendly and professional. After the bad experience I had so far, I really appreciated it. The room was clean, but definitely no-frills. Very few amenities -- not even bottled water in the room or a mini bar. The bathroom was looking very worn -- cracks in the tub and the the sink did not drain well. The next morning I had breakfast at "The Brasserie." The service was very good. Besides their food service, this hotel should make a lot of improvements before it can call itself a 4-Star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the airport!”
Reviews.Author: usafan
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Sheraton Gateway. Large, clean rooms and the beds were very comfortable. They were the best beds during our 21-day round trip. The only negative i can say about this hotel is the parking situation. They have no self parking lot, only valet. They have no check in parking available, so you have to carry your luggage from the nearby airport parking lot or discuss with the valet parking personal to get 5 minutes to unload. The whirlpool also wasn't very good. So, choose this hotel as an airport hotel for the night before or after your flight, for that it couldn't be better. But it is not a resort-like hotel to stay more than a few days. All in all, it was a good experience and i recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked through priceline for $85/night. Rooms are large and very clean. Beds are fantastic! Free shuttle to and from airport is convenient. This hotel is one of the closest to airport terminals, so not ideal if our planning on staying in LA for a while, but for a good nights sleep after a long flight this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations and would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 nights through Hotwire for my husband and me and wound up with a non-smoking king room on the top floor directly across from the Sheraton Club Lounge (temporarily located in the Presidential Suite). Our room was $51 per night (plus tax) and allowed us access to the continental breakfast and lunch buffet in the lounge, even though we are not club members. Free internet use in the lounge. Also free newspaper delivered outside our door. The top floor was accessible on the elevator with a special room key. Check-in service and concierge assistance were both top-notch. Room was kept clean and bed was comfy. We could see LAX runways from our room, but noise (either external or from within the building) was never a problem. We dined at Shula's twice. Excellent food and service, albeit pricey. Hotel shuttle service was prompt and always reliable. Our experience exceeded our expectations, especially considering what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Airport”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Positive Remarks 1 Stayed at the Sheraton one night in July, great that its only 10 minutes from the airport on the shuttle bus. 2 The rooms were clean and we got a very comfortable super king bed. Negative Remarks 1 We didn't hear much plane noise, however we could hear the people next door and their tv. We were exhausted after our 10.5 hour flight so would have expected better sound proofing from this highly rated hotel. 2 The bathroom's toilet roll holder was coming off the wall. 3 Shular 357 is over priced - $10 for a bottle of sparkling mineral water! 4 Receptionist not very friendly/helpful as she insisted on taking my hotel voucher and only after my insistence would she give me a photo copy.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but could be better”
Reviews.Author: bp4559
Reviews.Content: One walk through the facility and you would say this place gets a 5 star review, but upon further review there were little problems that kept adding up, which ultimately resulted in me giving it 4 stars. The parking here is a nightmare, valet is expensive and although self parking is cheaper (13 dollars per day) it is annoying. Many times we grabbed the last or next to the last spot. There were several times when there was a long line waiting to get out and the situation became disorganized. Another problem is housekeeping, it took them forever to do our room, it was 1:30 in the afternoon and it still wasn't done. The elevators were broken during our time there, it wasn't that bad of a problem for us because we were on the third floor, but it could become a big problem for someone on a higher floor. Another thing I didn't like about this place was that the shower head was too low and I nearly hit my head on it a couple of times and I'm only 5-6. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the pool area was very good as well. What's good is you can order drinks and take them out by the pool. The pool tended to get crowded in the afternoon.The room service food was good and I also liked the bar there too. One thing about room service that I really liked was it is 24 hours, which is great when you are looking for something to eat at midnight. Shula's was expensive but the steak was good. I heard the planes a couple of times but it was nothing that was distracting.

Reviews.Title: “We can give you a bed for only $50 more!”
Reviews.Author: Bob045
Reviews.Content: I booked my reservation on Priceline a few hours before arriving at the hotel. When I arrived I was told that the hotel was sold out. I could either have a room with a sofabed or I could pay $50 more for a room with a bed. Despite explaining to the front desk clerk that this was totally unaceptable she refused to budge and was less than pleasant. Upon return I spoke to Priceline and they refunded my money.

Reviews.Title: “A surprisingly nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cynJacksonville_Fl
Reviews.Content: I needed an airport hotel for the night before an early-morning flight to Beijing and again on the way back. After reading the rave reviews here I decided to give the Sheraton Gateway a try. I had enough Starwood points for both nights from a bad experience at the Sheraton Towers in NYC so my hopes were not high even with the good reviews. The shuttle bus arrived immediately. But things did not start off well once at the hotel because I arrived at around 10 AM from the east coast and my room, or any other room, was not ready. I realize check in is not until 3 PM but I have never had to wait anywhere else and I had to watch as numerous Southwest pilots and flight attendents got rooms. I didn't get a room until after 2 PM after dozing in the lobby, not a pleasant situation. But when I finally got to my room it more than made up for the wait. What beautiful decor, exactly as on their website, although my room seemed even larger. The bed was wonderfully comfortable and I never heard a plane although there was some hallway noise. The shuttle arrived promptly in the very early morning and, as Starbucks was not open yet, there was coffee by the front desk. On the way back the shuttle was again prompt and I was able to check in early, exhausted from the long flight. The next morning I was thrilled by the huge breakfast buffet after many mornings of terrible Chinese breakfasts and literally stuffed myself. Everything was wonderful and the wait staff was superb. While not cheap, I think it was an excellent value for the large selection. I've stayed at the Marriott Courtyard a few doors away before for business and what a difference! I'll never go back there now. Hard to believe this is an airport hotel and I look forward to coming back, even as a paying guest. Also, believe it or not, I plan on copying some of the room decor elements and the sophisticated color scheme for a guest room at home, it was really that nice. The only thing I didn't like about the room was the lack of free high speed internet access. In today's world this should be included in the price of the room, especially at the airport. But all in all, this hotel far surpassed my expectations.
